Promotion.Summary: 50% discount on Standard class Adult tickets for 16 or 17 year olds

OfferDetails.Details:
A 16-17 Saver costs £30 and it'll save you 50% on Adult rail fares throughout England and Wales, and stations in Scotland served by Avanti West Coast, LNER and TransPennine Express. This includes Standard class Anytime, Off-Peak, Super Off-Peak, Advance, and Season Tickets.

There are plenty of ways you can use your Saver, for both long and short trips. Better still you can use it anytime of the day, every day of the week.

The 16-17 Saver is available to buy for any 16 or 17 year olds, and is valid for 1-year, or until the day before your 18th birthday; whichever is earliest. Season Tickets started during the validity of the Saver to be used up to four months after you turn 18 years old.

Visit the 16-17 Saver website for more information or to buy now.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see www.16-17saver.co.uk

BookingConditions.Details:
1. Whenever possible, tickets for your journey should be purchased before boarding the train. You must have your Saver with you on your journey and always show the valid Saver and discounted ticket to rail staff at their request. If you do not show both the Saver and the ticket, you will be required to pay the full undiscounted Standard Single fare for your journey as if no ticket was purchased before starting the journey and in some cases a penalty fare. This does not apply if there was no ticket purchasing facilities at the station at which you began your journey e.g. if the ticket office was closed and there was no ticket machine from which you could buy a discounted ticket
  2. Discount is 50% of Adult fares
  3. 16-17 Saver does not entitle holder to Child Rate tickets, unless no option for 16-17 Saver is available at time of ticket purchase
  4. The right is reserved to revise the Terms & Conditions and availability of the 16-17 Saver. The Train Companies will endeavour to give three months' notice of any changes before they are due to come into effect.
  5. Tickets issued to the holder of the 16-17 Saver are issued subject to the National Rail Conditions of Travel and the full Terms & Conditions below. Copies of the National Rail Conditions of Travel are available from any staffed station ticket office or online at www.nationalrail.co.uk/nrcot

View the full 16-17 Saver Terms and Conditions.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
To buy online, you will need a valid UK driving licence (full or provisional) or passport number to prove you are eligible and supply a digital 'passport style' photo.

For more information on buying online, please see our FAQ's.

You can also buy a 16-17 Saver by calling the National Rail telesales number on 0345 301 1656.
We're open 7am to 10pm every day except Christmas day

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Savers section simply select the number and type of Saver that you will be travelling with and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Saver!

Promotion.Summary: Aged 16-25 or a full time student aged 26 or over? Save 1/3 off most standard class rail fares throughout Great Britain with a 16-25 Railcard.

OfferDetails.Details:
A 16-25 Railcard costs £30 and it'll save you 1/3 on rail fares throughout Great Britain for a whole year, including all Standard and First Class Advance fares. Take a look at all the ticket types you can make savings on with a 16-25 Railcard.

You are eligible if you're aged between 16-25, or over the age of 26 and in full-time education. Please see our eligibility criteria for more information.

There are plenty of ways you can use your Railcard, for both long and short trips. Better still you can use it anytime on weekends, public holidays and during the week. The only restriction is that if you travel between 04:30 and 09:59 Monday to Friday (except during July and August) a minimum fare of £12 will apply. See minimum fares for more details.

Your Railcard also allows you to take advantage of our great partner offers, giving you exclusive discounts across the UK.  See our offers section for all the latest partner offers.

Now you can also buy a 3-year 16-25 Railcard, available only online. It's great value at £70, saving you an extra £20 on the cost of renewing your 1-year Railcard for three consecutive years. You can buy this 3-year Railcard up until the day before your 24th birthday.

Please visit the for more information or click here to buy now.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
1. Tickets for your journey should be purchased before boarding the train. You must have your Railcard (and Photocard/Permit to travel without Photocard if applicable) with you on your journey and always show the valid Railcard and ticket to rail staff at their request. If you do not show both the Railcard and the ticket, you will be required to pay the full price Standard Single fare for your journey as if no ticket was purchased before starting the journey and in some cases a penalty fare. This does not apply if there was no ticket office at the station at which you began your journey or if the ticket office was closed and there was no ticket machine from which you could buy a discounted ticket.

2. Minimum fare applies to both outward and return journeys between 04:30 and 09:59 Mondays to Fridays (except Public Holidays and in July and August). The minimum fare is £12.

3. Discounts are not available in First Class, except with a First Class Advance ticket or in Weekend First accommodation on some train companies, on payment of the appropriate supplement..

4. In the case of some low price tickets the actual discount with a Railcard may be slightly lower than that advertised.

5. The right is reserved to revise these Conditions and availability of the tickets mentioned here. The Train Companies will endeavour to give three months' notice of any changes before they are due to come into effect.

6. Tickets issued to the holder of the Railcard are issued subject to the National Rail Conditions of Travel and the Conditions listed here. Copies of the National Rail Conditions of Travel are available from any staffed station ticket office or online at www.nationalrail.co.uk/nrcot/ 

View the full terms and conditions.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
To buy online, you will need a valid UK driving licence or passport number to prove you are eligible, and have a digital passport style photo saved on your computer. For more information on buying online, please see our FAQ's.

Please note online purchase is currently not available for mature students. You will need your educational establishment to sign and stamp your Railcard application form to verify you are a full-time student, so must apply at a station. Pick up a leaflet from any staffed station ticket office.

You can also buy a 16-25 Railcard at a staffed station ticket office or by calling your nearest train company telesales number. For train company telesales numbers, please contact National Rail Enquiries on: 03457 48 49 50 (calls are charged at local rate).

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Railcards section simply select the number and type of Railcards that you will be travelling with and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Railcard!

Promotion.Summary: Aged 26-30? Save 1/3 off most standard class rail fares throughout Great Britain with a 26-30 Railcard.

OfferDetails.Details:
A 26-30 Railcard costs £30 and it'll save you 1/3 on rail fares throughout Great Britain for a whole year, including all Standard and First Class Advance fares. Take a look at all the ticket types you can make savings on.

You are eligible if you're aged between 26-30 and have a smart mobile device. Please see our eligibility criteria for more information.

There are plenty of ways you can use your Railcard, for both long and short trips. Better still you can use it anytime on weekends, public holidays and during the week. The only restriction is that if you travel between 04:30 and 09:59 Monday to Friday, a minimum fare of £12.00 will apply. See minimum fares for more details.

The Railcard also allows you to take advantage of our great partner offers, giving you exclusive discounts across Great Britain.  See our offers section for all the latest deals with our partner.

Please visit the 26-30 Railcard website for more information.

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: www.26-30railcard.co.uk

BookingConditions.Details:
1. Tickets for your journey should be purchased before boarding the train. You must have your Railcard with you on your journey and always show the valid Railcard and ticket to rail staff at their request. If you do not show both the Railcard and the ticket, you will be required to pay the full price Standard Single fare for your journey as if no ticket was purchased before starting the journey and in some cases a penalty fare. N.B. This does not apply if there was no ticket office at the station at which you began your journey or if the ticket office was closed and there was no ticket machine from which you could buy a discounted ticket.
  2. Minimum fare applies to both outward and return journeys between 04:30 and 09:59 Mondays to Fridays (except Public Holidays). The minimum fare is £12.00.
  3. Discounts are not available in First Class, except with a First Class Advance ticket or in Weekend First accommodation on some train companies, on payment of the appropriate supplement.
  4. In the case of some low-price tickets the actual discount with a Railcard may be slightly lower than that advertised.
  5. The right is reserved to revise these Conditions and availability of the tickets mentioned here. The Train Companies will endeavour to give three months' notice of any changes before they are due to come into effect.
  6. Tickets issued to the holder of the Railcard are issued subject to the National Rail Conditions of Travel and the Conditions listed here.

Copies of the National Rail Conditions of Travel are available from any staffed station ticket office or online at www.nationalrail.co.uk/nrcot/

View the full terms and conditions

PurchaseDetails.Details:
To buy a 26-30 Railcard online, you will need a valid UK driving licence or passport number to prove you are eligible and have a digital passport style photo saved on your computer. For more information on buying online, please see our About the Railcard section.

The 26-30 Railcard is a Digital Railcard product and is only available via the Railcard App on a mobile device. You will need to hold the Railcard on;

  • iPhone (iOS 11.1.0 or higher)
  • Android (OS 4.1 (Jelly Bean) or higher)

and to download the free Railcard app.

  • iPhone 
  • Android

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Railcards section, simply select the type of Railcard and number of Railcard holders travelling and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Railcard!

Promotion.Summary: Free parking when three or more rail passengers share a car.

OfferDetails.Details:
Chiltern Railways offer free parking to Rail Users at all Chiltern Railways Car Parks, when three or more people share a car.

At least 3 occupants of the car must come to the Ticket Office, where staff will record your vehicle registration number and provide free parking.

The offer is subject to the ticket office being open at the time of your arrival at the station and there being an available car parking space.

You can find Ticket Office opening times here.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Ask the car park attendant or ticket office for the "3 for free" car park ticket.

AdultFares.Details: For detailed information on Chiltern Railways  peak and off-peak car park fares, and to find out more about free parking, and the Chiltern Carshare scheme, visit www.chilternrailways.co.uk/parking

Promotion.PromotionName: Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire County Council Concessionary Scheme
Promotion.Summary: Reduction in train fares for certain bus permit holders.

OfferDetails.Details:
Terms & Conditions

1. Holders of Concessionary Bus Permits issued by any Local Authority in Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire can obtain a 50% discount on the following rail fares (Off-Peak Day Single; Anytime Day Single & Off-Peak Day Return) for journeys between any of the stations shown below, after 1000 Mondays to Fridays and all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

2. Tickets with this discount may be purchased from any staffed ticket office (or from ticket vending machines by purchasing a CHILD ticket).

3. Combinations of tickets cannot be issued from ticket vending machines.

4. They are not available for on-line purchase.

5. The person using the ticket must carry their valid Concessionary Bus Permit with them throughout the journey and must show it on demand.  

6. The £2.00 accompanied child flat fare tickets are valid with these fares.

7. This offer cannot be used in conjunction with any Railcards or with GroupSave.

8. The Concessionary Travel Scheme is  to encourage permit holders to travel by train (rather than bus) on journeys within Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire. Nevertheless, a discounted ticket to Elstree & Borehamwood / Hadley Wood / Crews Hill may be combined with an undiscounted ticket (including a Travelcard) from those stations. However the train must stop at Elstree & Borehamwood / Hadley Wood / Crews Hill for such a combination of tickets to be valid. A combination of tickets to / from Elstree & Borehamwood / Hadley Wood / Crews Hill is not valid on fast trains which do not stop at Elstree & Borehamwood / Hadley Wood / Crews Hill.

9. Customers wishing to use faster services to London (which do not stop at Elstree & Borehamwood / Hadley Wood / Crews Hill) are permitted to use the following combination of tickets:

 Stations Bedford to Harpenden inclusive

An off-Peak Day Return (CDR) with 50% discount to St Albans combined with an Off-Peak Day Return / Travelcard from St Albans

St Albans

Customers starting their journey at St Albans who wish to use fast train services to London are not entitled to any discount.

 Stations Royston / Sandy to Hatfield, Welham Green and Brookmans Park inclusive

An off-Peak Day Return (CDR) with 50% discount to Potters Bar combined with an Off-Peak Day Return / Travelcard from Potters Bar

 Potters Bar

Customers starting their journey at Potters Bar who wish to use fast train services are not entitled to any discount

10. Tickets issued in combination with tickets to London (Off-Peak Day Return / Travelcard) may be liable to restricted return travel from London during the Evening peak for trains departing London Kings Cross, St Pancras International or Moorgate between 16.30 and 19.01 inclusive.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.PromotionName: Accompanied child flat fare - Great Northern & Thameslink
Promotion.Summary: This ticket is available for children accompanied with an adult travelling at Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak times for most journeys on Great Northern and Thameslink train services.

OfferDetails.Details:
This ticket is available for children accompanied with an adult travelling at Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak times for most journeys on Great Northern and Thameslink train services. 

£2 One Day Travelcards are also available for journeys that start outside of the Zones 1-6 area.

So long as the adult ticket is not routed 'Thameslink Only', these tickets can also be used on Southern train services for journeys on the Brighton Mainline between London Bridge, Gatwick Airport and Brighton.

It is not valid on Gatwick Express services.

Travel is not permitted on other operators services except with the £2 One Day Travelcard where travel is permitted on the same National Rail services within Zones 1-6 as a normal child rate One Day Travelcard

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
This ticket is only available for children accompanied by an adult.

Up to four children can travel with one adult.

These tickets are available for journeys at Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak times on most Great Northern and Thameslink train services; except for journeys wholly within London Zones 1-9.

The adult passenger must hold one of the following ticket types:

  • Season ticket
  • Single or Return tickets
  • One Day Travelcards
Adult passengers with Railcard discounts can also take up to four children with each fare paying adult.

Adult passengers with GroupSave discounts can also take up to four children with each fare paying adult.

So long as the adult ticket is not routed 'Thameslink Only', these tickets can also be used on Southern train services for journeys on the Brighton Mainline between London Bridge, Gatwick Airport and Brighton.

It is not valid on Gatwick Express services.

Travel is not permitted on other operators services except with the £2 One Day Travelcard where travel is permitted on the same National Rail services within Zones 1-6 as a normal child rate One Day Travelcard

Promotion.Summary: This ticket is available for children accompanied with an adult travelling at Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak times on the Southern network.

OfferDetails.Details:
This ticket is available for children accompanied with an adult travelling at Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak times on train services operated by Southern and Thameslink across most of the Southern network.

£2 One Day Travelcards are also available for journeys that start outside of the Zones 1-6 area.

It is not valid on Gatwick Express train services.

Travel is not permitted on other operators services except with the £2 One Day Travelcard where travel is permitted on the same National Rail services within Zones 1-6 as a normal child rate One Day Travelcard.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
This ticket is only available for children accompanied by an adult.

Up to four children can travel with one adult.

These tickets are available for journeys at Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak times across most of the Southern network on Southern and Thameslink train services; except for journeys wholly within London Zones 1-9.

The adult passenger must hold one of the following ticket types:

  • Season ticket
  • Single or Return tickets 
  • One Day Travelcards
  • Southern Advance tickets

Adult passengers with Railcard discounts can also take up to four children with each fare paying adult.

Adult passengers with GroupSave discounts can also take up to four children with each fare paying adult.

These tickets are not valid on Gatwick Express services.

Travel is not permitted on other operators services except with the £2 One Day Travelcard where travel is permitted on the same National Rail services within Zones 1-6 as a normal child rate One Day Travelcard.

PurchaseDetails.Details: These are available from Ticket Offices and online at www.southernrailway.com

ConcessionFares.Details: N/A

Promotion.Summary: The Airport Travelcard provides discounted travel for all airport employees on selected bus, coach and train routes. It's flexible and easy to use.

OfferDetails.Details:
You can get up to 80% discount on bus, coach and rail.

The easy and cheap way to get to work at the Airport is by public transport. The Airport Travelcard is very simple to use and you have the option of purchasing monthly or annually over the phone, online or in person by visiting the Airport Commuter Centre.

Depending on your home postcode (please check the route you need) you are entitled to a £57, £70, £100 or £142 Airport Travelcard.

You have the option to purchase a monthly, 3 monthly, 6 monthly or annual Airport Travelcard - giving you more savings! An annual Travelcard gives you two months FREE!

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: www.stanstedcommuter.com/airport-travelcard/

TicketValidityConditions.Details: See 'Buying your tickets' below

BookingConditions.Details: Discounted travel for airport employees only

PurchaseDetails.Details:
To obtain your first Airport Travelcard make an appointment at the Airport Commuter Centre by phoning 01279 663322. Normal opening times are 09:00-12:30 & 13:30-17:00 Mon-Fri.

We will register you and provide a unique ID code that you will need to quote each time you renew your Airport Travelcard.

Once registered you can purchase your Airport Travelcard by using the link on this site or by visiting the Airport Commuter Centre or by phoning us.

If you purchase at the Airport Commuter Centre you can have your Airport Travelcard instantly and valid from that day. If you purchase online or by phone you have the option of collecting your Airport Travelcard from the Airport Commuter Centre the next day or we will post it out to you but this could take five working days to get to you.

Bring with you either your Airport ID or letter of employment on company headed paper issued by your manager.

To buy online, see https://www.airport-commuter-shop.co.uk/login.aspx

Promotion.Summary: If you buy an Annual Season ticket or Annual Travelcard in the South of England, you may qualify for an Annual Gold Card which offer discounts on leisure rail travel

OfferDetails.Details:
If you buy an Annual Season ticket or Annual Travelcard in the South of England, you may qualify for an Annual Gold Card which offer discounts on leisure rail travel.

When you buy an adult Annual Season ticket or Annual Travelcard at a station within the Annual Gold Card area and the origin and/or destination are also in the Annual Gold Card area, you are automatically issued with an Annual Gold Card or a Gold Record Card if your Season ticket is issued on smartcard or an Oyster card.

As well as being an Annual Season ticket, you also get a range of discounts on other leisure rail journeys in the Annual Gold Card area for yourself and others.

Holders of Annual Gold Cards and Gold Record Cards get the following discounts for journeys wholly within the Annual Gold Card area:
  • 1/3 off Standard and First Class Anytime and Off-Peak tickets for the cardholder and up to three adults aged 16 or over travelling with them
  • 60% off child fares for up to four children aged between 5 and 15 years (subject to a £1 minimum fare)
  • Up to two children aged under 5 years travel free of charge.
  • A one year Railcard for £10 for you or a friend - choose from a 16-25, Family & Friends, Senior, Two Together, Disabled Persons or Network Railcard. You can purchase one discounted Railcard, subject to eligibility, during the validity of your Annual Gold Card. See Discounted Railcards section for details.
  • 1/3 off Off-Peak Day Travelcard Zones 1-6
  • 1/3 off Oyster Off-Peak pay as you go single fares and the pay as you go daily price cap (after 09:30 Monday to Friday) for journeys on National Rail, London Underground and Docklands Light Railway services. The Annual Gold Card discount must be loaded on the Oyster card at London Underground ticket offices and is available to the Annual Gold Card holder only.
  • 1/3 off Anytime Day Travelcards when bought as part of your ticket to London from outside London Zones 1-9 (subject to time restrictions and a £17 minimum fare)
  • 1/3 off PlusBus Day tickets in the Network Railcard area (7-Day and Monthly or longer Season Tickets are not included) 
  • Discounts on journeys to the Isle of Wight using Wightlink, Red Funnel and HoverTravel. The Annual Gold Card discount is applied to this section of your journey provided a through-ticket is issued. No discount on port-to-port only tickets.

The maximum group size is four adults, four fare-paying children (5-15 years old) and two children under 5 (who travel at no charge). The Annual Gold Card holder must travel with the group at all times.

Annual Gold Card holders do not need to purchase a ticket for themselves if the journey being made is covered by their Annual Season ticket. When buying discounted Day Travelcards for accompanying adults or children, the Annual Gold Card holder must ensure their Annual Season ticket is also valid for travel in the London Fare Zone they wish to travel to, otherwise they must purchase a discounted Off-Peak Day Travelcard for themselves as well.

Discounts are available for travel at or after 09:30 hours on Mondays to Fridays. Valid at any time on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays.

Please note: You must apply for these discounts at the station where the Annual Gold Card was purchased, the applications are not available online.

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: See the page for full details

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Changes to the Scheme

The right is reserved at any time to amend or withdraw from any part of the Annual Gold Card Scheme, and also the ticket types and reduced fares included in the Scheme. Every endeavour will be made to give adequate notice of any changes before they are due to come into effect. You should enquire about current conditions and travel restrictions prior to travel.

PurchaseDetails.Details: You can buy an Annual Gold Card Season ticket or Annual Gold Travelcard from any station within the Network Railcard Area.

com:Annotation.com:Note: Cath Lyver, National Rail Product Manager

AdultFares.Details: When you buy an adult Annual Season ticket or Annual Travelcard at a station within the Annual Gold Card area and the origin and/or destination are also in the Annual Gold Card area, you are automatically issued with an Annual Gold Card

Promotion.Summary: Entitles holders of an Annual Season Ticket to a 34% discount for themselves and up to one accompanying Adult on applicable Off-Peak Standard Class journeys on selected Transport for Wales Rail Services.

FurtherInformation.Details: www.tfwrail.wales

BookingConditions.Details:
This Railcard scheme is not for retail, and is only valid upon presentation of an Annual Season Ticket at a Transport for Wales Rail Services ticket office.

Discounted travel may only take place during the validity period of the Annual Season Ticket.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Discount valid upon presentation at a Transport for Wales Rail Services ticket office

Promotion.Summary: In partnership with the Devon & Cornwall Rail Partnership, GWR will retail half price off peak Day Return travel on the Barnstaple branch, in the 'to Barnstaple' direction from Saturday 22 October 2016 until Easter Monday 2017.

OfferDetails.Details:
Ticket Type: “SCO”, priced at half the CDR price.

Discounts: Children travel at half the Adult fare, no further Railcard or Staff discounts.

Available From: Exeter Area Stations (Topsham, Digby & Sowton, Polsloe Bridge, Pinhoe, St James Park (Exeter), Exeter Central, Exeter St Thomas, Exeter St Davids), plus stations on the Barnstaple branch (except Barnstaple).

Available To: All stations on the Barnstaple branch, Newton St Cyres - Barnstaple inclusive, provided outward travel is in the 'TO Barnstaple' direction.

Start Date: (Sale & Travel): Saturday 22 October 2016

End Date: (Sale & Travel): Monday 17 April 2017

Available for retail from ALL channels.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available for retail from ALL retail channels.

Promotion.PromotionName: Bedfordshire County Council (Marston Vale) Concessionary Fares Scheme
Promotion.Summary: Reduces prices for Seniors and people with disabilities

OfferDetails.Details: A 50% discount on Off Peak Day tickets on the Marston Vale Line (all stations between Bedford and Bletchley inclusive) for all Senior Citizens and people with disabilities who produce a concessionary travel permit issued by the local district council.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: Key Fare Conditions including Railcard Use: No further Child or Railcard discount. Normal refund procedures apply relative to ticket type purchased

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from London Northwestern Railway and West Midland Railways staffed ticket offices, telesales and on-train staff.

Promotion.Summary: Travel with London North Eastern Railway and save a massive 25% on each ticket when you travel in a group of 3+ people

OfferDetails.Details:
Simply travel in a group of 3-9 people and you'll all enjoy a huge 25% off the total price of all London North Eastern Railway Advance tickets when you book at www.LNER.co.uk.

What makes this incredible offer even better is that it's applicable across all London North Eastern Railway Advance fares in both Standard and First Class - so you can make an even bigger saving.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• 25% discount will be applied for bookings of 3 or more (up to a maximum of 9) on Standard or First Advance tickets
  • Discount will only be applied to bookings made at  www.lner.co.uk/3plus

  • Discount includes 10% online discount where relevant

BookingConditions.Details:
25% discount will be applied for bookings of 3 or more (up to a maximum of 9) on Standard or First Advance tickets.

Discount will only be applied to bookings made at www.lner.co.uk/3plus

Usual Advance fare terms and conditions apply  Discount includes 10% online discount where relevant.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available online only at www.lner.co.uk/3plus

ConcessionFares.Details: Not valid in conjunction with any other offers or with Railcard discounts

Promotion.Summary: This is a rail, bus and admission combined ticket for Blenheim Palace

OfferDetails.Details:
Combined tickets are available to Blenheim Palace via Oxford using either Oxford Bus Company 500 service or Stagecoach in Oxfordshire service S3.

Bus information -

500 service departs stop R1 up to every 30 mins and runs via Banbury Road & Kidlington Airport.

S3 service departs stop R5 up to every 20 mins and runs via Woodstock Road & Yarnton.

Tickets are valid on either service and both services stop at the gates to Blenheim Palace.

For further bus enquiries, customers should call Traveline on 0871 200 22 33 or visit www.traveline.info

FurtherInformation.Details: For each passenger 4 coupons will print. Two coupons will be the Out and Return portions of the Off-Peak Day Return for rail travel with Great Western Railway (Standard Class only). One further portion will be for use on the Woodstock Bus link, and a fourth coupon will be used for admission to Blenheim Palace, gardens and grounds.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Through tickets may be issued where the fares shown in your TIS or the Fares Finder. These tickets are available from various locations around the Great Western Railway network to Oxford as far out as Hereford, Worcester,Cardiff Central, Bristol, Weston-Super-Mare, Swindon, Basingstoke, Gatwick Airport and London Paddington.

PromotionRailCard.Details:
Valid railcard holders will be given a discount on the rail element of the through-fare ONLY.

Children aged 5-15 will receive a discount on rail travel, bus link and admission.

No other discounts or concessions are valid with this offer.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions: Issue through fare to K850 "Blenheim Palace" from origin station. Restriction BP applies. If using Fujitsu Journey Planner, tick "Fares Only" in search options.

Promotion.Summary: Combination of rail and add-on discounted ticket to Bodmin & Wenford Railway

OfferDetails.Details:
The Bodmin & Wenford Railway is Cornwall's only standard gauge railway still regularly operated by steam locomotives.

Relax in style and enjoy a leisurely 13 mile round trip through Cornwall's countryside, taking in the sights, sounds and smells of a bygone age, as the era of a Cornish branch line in the 1950s reveals itself during the course of your journey.

Services are usually steam hauled to Bodmin General (for Town Centre) and Boscarne Junction (for the Camel Trail). Diesel trains also operate most Saturdays.

Inclusive through ticketing - Great Western Railway

Travel by train and there is a new inclusive ticketing arrangement to allow you to travel to and from the railway from any mainline station in Cornwall & Plymouth for our Freedom of the Line fare and from any station in Devon at a special rate. Go to any Great Western Railway ticket office in Cornwall or Devon to purchase tickets for this special offer.

Fares from any station in Cornwall & Plymouth

Adult - £13.00

Child (3-15) - £6.00

Child (Under 3) - FREE

Family (1 Adult and up to 2 Children) - £23.00

Family (2 Adults and up to 4 Children) - £35.00

Senior - £12.00

Fares from any station in Devon (except Plymouth)

Adult - £20.00

Child (3-15) - £10.00

Child (Under 3) - FREE

Family (1 Adult and up to 2 Children) - £30.00

Family (2 Adults and up to 4 Children) - £49.00

Senior - £19.00

Passengers should be advised to check that services are operating on the day concerned. Details are available from the Bodmin & Wenford Railway on 01208 73666

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Add-on to train fare.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Simply ask for an add-on ticket to Bodmin & Wenford Railway at any station.

InternalInfo.Details:
Adult / Child Return (all types)

Destination name & NLC: Bodmin & Wenford Railway L100

AdultFares.Details: £13.00 from any station in Cornwall & Plymouth, £20.00 from any station in Devon (except Plymouth)

ChildFares.Details: £6.00 from any station in Cornwall & Plymouth, £10.00 from any station in Devon (except Plymouth)

ConcessionFares.Details:
Normal Adult Railcard discounts are also available to the add-on fare.

Child Railcard discounts are not available to the add-on fare.

Promotion.Summary:
Racecourse admission at reduced rate for combined rail-race admission tickets.


Brighton racecourse provides a courtesy bus service that operates from Brighton Station to the race course from approximately 2 hours prior to the first race. The bus parks 200 yards south of the station (at the top of Queens Road). There are return journeys to the station after racing.


Brighton racecourse telephone 01273 603 580

OfferDetails.Details:
When you purchase your train ticket to Brighton then simply ask for the Brighton Races Add-on ticket at the same time.

If you already hold a valid train ticket for travel to Brighton, then simply show this at the Ticket Office and ask for the Brighton Races Add-on ticket.  

Brighton racecourse stands high above the vibrant City by the Sea, with panoramic views across the English Channel and South Downs.

Brighton racecourse assures to be the perfect venue to enjoy a day out with friends and family. With race meetings staged between April and October, not only do you have the opportunity to experience horseracing in an ideal setting on the south coast, which is less than an hour away from London by train, but have the option to continue your day's entertainment with a promenade along Brighton's cosmopolitan seafront of sophisticated bars, cafes, hotels and nightlife.

FurtherInformation.Details: www.brighton-racecourse.co.uk

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Only available on Non Feature Racedays.

BookingConditions.Details: Railcard discounts apply only to the rail element of the journey and not the Add-on amount for Brighton Racecourse.

PurchaseDetails.Details: You will need a valid rail ticket which allows travel to Brighton and then ask for a Brighton races Add-on ticket.

ChildFares.Details: Children under 16 accompanied by an adult are admitted free to the racecourse (Rail fare applies age 5 to 15 inclusive). Unaccompanied children under 16 are not allowed in the racecourse

Promotion.Summary:
Add-On Fares and Through Tickets via Bristol Temple Meads to Bristol Ferry Boats.

The Bristol Ferry Boats operate from Temple Quay which is a short walk from Bristol Temple Meads railway station.

Combined rail and ferry travel available as Single fares, Return fares and Hop-On Hop-Off fares for the Bristol Ferry Boats. For more information about Bristol Ferry Boats please see: http://www.bristolferry.com/

OfferDetails.Details:
Single fares are priced from a range of railway origins to 'Bristol Ferry SGL' and Return fares are priced to 'Bristol Ferry RTN'. Where the ticket includes railway travel as well as travel on the Bristol Ferry Boats, there are both Off-Peak Day and Anytime Day versions available.

For the flexibility of one return trip on National Rail services and unlimited Hop-On Hop-Off validity on the Bristol Ferry Boats, there are Return fares priced to 'Bristol Ferry HOP'.

Passengers can purchase this ticket from any booking office.

Discounts

Children and Seniors will each have a discounted rate on the ferry boats, and holders of any National Railcard will receive their normal discount on the rail travel part of the through-fares.

Add-On Amounts

Adults: £1.50 Single, £2.50 Return or £4.00 Hop-On Hop-Off Return*

Children (aged 5-15): £1.00 Single, £2.00 Return or £3.00 Hop-On Hop-Off Return*

Seniors: £1.00 Single, £2.00 Return or £3.00 Hop-On Hop-Off Return*

*Hop-On Hop-Off Return - The tickets priced to 'Bristol Ferry Hop' can be used multiple times on the Bristol Ferry Boats only.

AreaMap.Details: Route map for Bristol Ferry Boats

FurtherInformation.Details: http://www.bristolferry.com/home

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Single fares are priced to K925 Bristol Ferry SGL

Return fares are priced to K923 Bristol Ferry RTN

Hop-On Hop-Off fares are priced to K924 Bristol Ferry HOP

Promotion.Summary: Travel to Hoveton & Wroxham and visit the Bure Valley Railway

OfferDetails.Details:
Travel  by train with Greater Anglia and enjoy reduced admission on the Bure Valley Railway

Norfolk's longest fifteen inch gauge line runs between the ancient market town of Aylsham and Wroxham, the 'Capital of the Norfolk Broads' with country stations serving the villages of Brampton, Buxton and Coltishall.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

ConcessionFares.Details: Railcard discounts apply to the Greater Anglia rail portion of the ticket only.

Promotion.Summary: This First or Standard Business ticket includes 48 hour car parking and 2 food/drink vouchers each worth £3.50 on the train.

OfferDetails.Details:
Key Features

  • Business Plus tickets are available on EMR services to London only. 
  • Price includes: First or standard Class seat, 48 hours car parking and two food/drink vouchers worth £3.50 each. 
  • Tickets are available to London or Zone U12 as an add-on option  
  • Discounts are available with a Senior & Disabled Persons railcard 
  • First Business Plus tickets also include complimentary tea, coffee, fruit juice, mineral water, glass of wine from (16:00 - 19:00) and a small snack as appropriate to the time of day (Monday - Fridays). Complimentary newspaper

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
Refunds and changes to travel plans


Completely unused tickets - full refund less any local cancellation fee.

Unused outward leg and partially completed journey - no refund


Unused return leg - Half the equivalent Anytime Return fare & less admin fee.

Food/drink vouchers not used - no refund

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Business Plus tickets are available on EMR services to London Only.

Ideal for the Business commuter travelling Monday - Fridays.

The ticket can be purchased anytime including the day of travel.

Who can issue the tickets?

All stations, rail-appointed travel agents and call centres can issue tickets

OfferDetails.Details:
Where travelling on certain trains to and from London Marylebone a Business Zone Package or upgrade is available which offers travel in the Business Zone area of the train with wider seats, bigger tables and quieter accommodation than the rest of the train.

Reservations are compulsory.

Available on the following services, Monday to Friday: 

Monday to Friday

  •  07:05 Kidderminster to London Marylebone

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Customers will be able to book the upgrade in advance of the date of travel, either as a separate transaction to accompany a valid travel ticket, or as a package including an Anytime Return to London Marylebone.

Additionally, the upgrade can be bought from the Conductor on the train, subject to accommodation being available.

AdultFares.Details:
Business Zone Package £50 more than the Anytime Return for the journey,  if bought online in advance.

Upgrade £25 each way on the train, subject to accommodation being available.

Promotion.Summary: 30% discount when travelling to Cadbury World.

OfferDetails.Details:
Cadbury World, in conjunction with West Midlands Railway and London Northwestern Railway, is offering a discounted admission ticket upon production of a valid rail ticket.

Customers must download and complete a voucher from the Days Out Guide page and show a valid rail ticket to Bournville, a season ticket, concessionary travel pass or London Midland staff rail pass.

Cadbury World is approximately a 10 minute walk from Bournville station

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.PromotionName: Caledonian Sleeper - Crianlarich to Oban Bus
Promotion.Summary: Caledonian Sleeper will be operating a bus service again this summer between Crianlarich and Oban.

OfferDetails.Details:
The bus will operate from Saturday 13 April 2019 to Saturday 26 October 2019.

Crianlarich - Oban

The bus will connect with the morning arrival in Crianlarich, due 07:45 (Monday to Saturday).

The bus will depart:

                                                                (Mon-Sat)

Crianlarich                                                        07:55

Oban (Railway Station)                                    09:15

Oban - Crianlarich

The bus will connect with the evening departure from Crianlarich, due 22:06 (Monday to Friday) and 21:16 (Sunday).

The bus will depart:

                                                                         (Sun)                    (Mon-Fri)

Oban (Railway Station)                                  19:40                       20:30

Crianlarich                                                      21:00                       21:50

There are no intermediate stops between Crianlarich and Oban.

The arrival times are approximate and subject to road conditions. In the event of late running of the sleeper the bus will wait up to one hour to connect.

It should be noted that the interchange at Crianlarich station is not accessible for guests with reduced mobility. There is no flat access between the train and the bus.

The bus will be available for use by anyone who holds a valid train ticket.

In the event of there being no Guests identified for this service the bus will not operate.

FurtherInformation.Details: www.sleeper.scot

Passengers.Note: Any valid rail ticket allowing travel between Crianlarich  and Oban can be used on the bus.

Promotion.Summary: 10 discounted First Class overnight journeys on the Caledonian Sleeper train

OfferDetails.Details:
Save over 40% on normal First Class fares

Exclusive use of a First Class single berth

Flexipass offers 10 single berth journeys on all Caledonian Sleeper routes

Complimentary hot or continental breakfast delivered to the customer's cabin

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Available on Caledonian Sleeper service only
  • Available on all Caledonian Sleeper routes
  • Caledonian Sleeper Flexipass tickets are subject to availability of First Class accommodation only

  • Caledonian Sleeper website www.sleeper.scot
  • Caledonian Sleeper Guest Service Centre on 0330 060 0500

Promotion.Summary: Reduced rail travel on the Cambrian Lines

OfferDetails.Details:
The Cambrian Railcard offers at least one third off most individual Standard Class rail fares on the Cambrian Lines.

Holders of the Cambrian Railcard are entitled to purchase most Standard Class rail fares for journeys Pwllheli - Aberystwyth- Machynlleth - Newtown - Shrewsbury (including from / to all intermediate stations) at a discount.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
The Cambrian Railcard is not valid unless it has been signed by the holder, nor is it transferable to anyone else. Tickets bought with a Railcard are for use by the Railcard holder only.

A Railcard does not become your property and if requested must be handed in to Transport for Wales.

When requested by rail staff, the holder must show a valid Railcard, otherwise the full standard fare will be payable as if no Railcard were held.

If the Railcard becomes defaced, illegible or torn, it will not be valid. Replacement cards will be issued upon payment of a £10 administration fee.

When you cannot use your Cambrian Railcard

  • For the purchase of Season Tickets at discounted prices
  • On bus services (except in the case of certain rail - bus through ticketing facilities)
  • On special excursion trains (ie not shown in the public timetable)
  • With any Rail Rover products (including Day or Evening Rangers / Explore Wales, Explore North & Mid Wales and North Wales Rover tickets)
  • With 'Small Group Day' tickets
  • In conjunction with special promotion tickets - unless specifically advised
  • Travel beyond Shrewsbury (in north, south or east direction)
  • In conjunction with any other national or local Railcard (ie Heart of Wales Line or Pembrokeshire)

BookingConditions.Details: All single and return tickets subject to normal ticket restrictions.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Who is eligible?

Anyone 16 years of age or over who is resident in the following postal code areas:

LL35 0, LL36 0, LL36 9, LL37 2, LL38 2, LL39 1, LL40 1, LL40 2, LL41 3, LL42 1, LL43 2, LL44 2, LL45 2, LL46 2, LL47 6, LL48 6, LL49 9, LL52 0, LL53 5, LL53 6,  LL53 7, LL53 8, SA45 9, SA46 0, SA47 0, SY15 6, SY16 1, SY16 2, SY16 3, SY16 4, SY17 5, SY18 6, SY19 7, SY20 8, SY20 9, SY21 0, SY21 7, SY21 8, SY21 9, SY23 1, SY23 2, SY23 3, SY23 4, SY23 5, SY24 5

 

How to apply for your Railcard

Cambrian Lines Railcards are on sale at the staffed railway stations of:

  • Aberystwyth (opening hours Mon-Fri 0620 to 1725, Sat 0620 to 1520)
  • Machynlleth (opening hours Mon-Sat 0745 to 1600, Sun 1030 to 1330)

Please complete an application form along with proof of identity and conformation of residency, for example, council tax or utility bill.

Postal Applications

Postal applications should include:

  • a completed application form
  • a stamped addressed envelope
  • photocopy of proof of residence
  • cheque made payable to Arriva Trains Wales

Please mark the envelope 'Cambrian Lines Railcard' and send applications to:

  • Ticket Office, Aberystwyth Railway Station, Station Yard, Alexandra Road, Aberystwyth SY23 1LH
  • Ticket Office, Machynlleth Railway Station, Heol y Doll, Machynlleth, Powys, SY20 8BL

Promotion.PromotionName: Carnet 5 with London North Eastern Railway
Promotion.Summary: Two Carnet 5 products are available on selected journeys to / from London Kings Cross.

OfferDetails.Details:
The Carnet 5 product allows customers to purchase a set of 5 First or Standard Class return tickets, offering additional flexibility and 5 tickets for the price of 4.

Available for 5 return journeys on London North Eastern Railway services. First & Standard Class options available. Available for travel from selected London North Eastern Railway stations to / from London Kings Cross only.

The ticket is fully flexible and there are no travel time restrictions, break of outward or return journey is allowed. All travel must be completed within 3 months from the date shown on the ticket.

Seat reservations are not required, however they may be requested in advance of travel.

Refunds are not allowed on these fares, once purchased.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Validity of  Carnet 5 is 3 calendar months from date of issue.
  • Once dated a Carnet 5 ticket is only valid for that date
  • Carnet 5 tickets can be purchased at any time up until departure from Travel Centres. However they cannot be purchased on board or from Fast ticket machines.
  • Carnet 5 are available on selected London North Eastern Railway routes to and from London.
  • Non-refundable once purchased.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
There are a number of ways to buy a  Carnet 5. Just contact London North Eastern Railway in one of the following ways:

  • Book over the phone with London North Eastern Railway's Business Travel Service on 03457 225 225
  • Visit a London North Eastern Railway Travel Centre or the ticket office at any National Rail station
  • Contact a travel agent through any UK rail appointed travel agent
  • Contact any UK rail appointed travel agent

Passengers.Note:
When self-validating a Carnet, customers should be advised to endorse the date with 2-digit numerical values only, eg. 07 09 for travel on 7th September, using permanent black ink.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

Promotion.Summary: 10 Anytime Return tickets for the price of 9

OfferDetails.Details:
If you and your colleagues travel regularly to London, our Chiltern Carnet can save you time and money.

Chiltern Carnet is a pack of 10 Anytime Return tickets which can be ordered direct from our Business Travel Team and sent straight to you (please allow up to 5 working days for postage).

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Carnet is available to use from any station on Chiltern Railways into London Marylebone.

BookingConditions.Details:
The pack of Carnet tickets is valid for up to 6 months from the chosen start date for return trips to London Marylebone from the station selected at the time of ordering (as shown on the tickets).

Chiltern Carnet tickets cannot be used on London Underground. Tickets are transferable. Customers must fill in the box date in ink on the ticket before boarding the train.

Refunds will only be given on unused packs, unless the passenger is claiming under the passengers' charter. Lost or stolen individual Carnet tickets will not be replaced.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Carnet tickets are on sale from London Marylebone station.

Passengers.Note:
When self-validating a Carnet, customers should be advised to endorse the date with 2-digit numerical values only, eg. 07 09 for travel on 7th September, using permanent black ink.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

Promotion.PromotionName: Carnet tickets with Great Northern and Thameslink
Promotion.Summary: 10 journeys for the price of 9 with Carnet

OfferDetails.Details:
If you often travel back and forth to London on the train but you don't go regularly enough to buy a Season Ticket, the Carnet option could save you time and money.

A Carnet booklet gives you 10 single journeys for the price of just nine*. You can use each ticket for one journey - either from your local station to London or back from London to your local station.
Tickets are valid for three months and you can buy books of Peak (Anytime) or Off-Peak tickets to mix and match as you need.

* The individual ticket journey price is based on half the relevant 'Anytime Day Return' or 'Off-Peak Day Return' fare discounted by 10%.

To use a ticket, fill in the travel date in black permanent ink before you start your journey.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
• Tickets are valid for 3 months from date of issue.
  • Passengers MUST validate the ticket using permanent black ink before boarding the train.
  • Attempted fraudulent use will result in withdrawal of this ticket, payment of full fare for the journey being made and a possible criminal charge.
  • Only 10 complete unused Carnet tickets will be considered for a refund.
  • Lost or stolen individual tickets will not be replaced.
  • Peak tickets are valid at any time
  • Break of journey is permitted for both the Peak and Off Peak versions

  • Off-Peak tickets are valid at weekends and for journeys which arrive in London at or after 10:00 Monday to Friday (Public Holidays excepted). Check with local station for time of the first Off-Peak service to London. Also valid for travel from London after 09:30 Monday to Friday (Public Holidays excepted), but not valid for travel between 16:30 and 19:01 Monday to Friday (Public Holidays excepted) where Evening Peak restrictions apply

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Carnet tickets are currently available from the following stations:

  • Cambridge (Peak only tickets)*
  • Royston*
  • Letchworth Garden City*
  • Huntingdon*
  • St Neots*
  • Hitchin*
  • Stevenage*
  • Welwyn Garden City*
  • Hatfield*
  • Potters Bar*
  • Hertford North*
  • Bedford**
  • Leagrave**
  • Luton**
  • Luton Airport Parkway**
  • Harpenden**
  • St Albans City**
* From these stations travel is available to / from the following London stations:
  • London Kings Cross
  • London St Pancras
  • Old Street
  • Moorgate

** From these stations travel is available to / from the following London stations:
  • London St Pancras
  • Farringdon
  • City Thameslink
  • London Blackfriars
  • London Bridge

You can also buy these tickets online from either the Great Northern  or Thameslink websites.

Passengers.Note:
When self-validating a Carnet, passengers should be advised to endorse the date with 2-digit numerical values only, eg. 07 09 for travel on 7th September, using permanent black ink.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

Passengers can break their journey.

Promotion.PromotionName: Carnet - Take 10 (Returns) with Avanti West Coast
Promotion.Summary: Take 10 is a pack of ten identical, inter-available point to point return journeys tickets.

OfferDetails.Details: There is a saving of 10% on the published price of ten individual Anytime tickets. Each ticket will also include a zone 1 Underground ticket and a voucher for 24 hours free car parking subject to availability.

Each ticket needs to be validated by the customer before travel (the date and time of journey need to be written on the front of the ticket). No further discounts apply. No refunds or changes to validity period of tickets allowed.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

Each ticket needs to be validated by the customer before travel (the date and time of journey need to be written on the front of the ticket). No further discounts apply. Promotion.Summary: Easement to Avanti West Coast Off Peak ticket restrictions

OfferDetails.Details:
Avanti West Coast offer qualifying charities a 20% discount off the full range of Avanti West Coast-only Advance Purchase fares, including First Class.

Avanti West Coast's Charity Line is over 10 years old and feedback shows that most charities now wish to book online and so thetrainline.com provide Avanti West Coast with an online booking facility for charities.

Tickets can be bought up to 23.59 the day before travel and collected from a FastTicket machine at the station. The scheme requires the traveller to be in possession of a valid charity photo ID card or dated letter of authority on charity headed paper with discounted charity tickets.

The discount is available to registered charities that are able to prove a minimum 10% voluntary funding level. This can be validated by a letter from your Finance Director, or similar, stating your 10% minimum voluntary funding; or for charities with an income over £500,000, a link to the page on the Charity Commission website (OSCR in Scotland) that shows your charity's funding status.

 
To register at thetrainline.com

  • Click on the Business Account tab and then 'Create a business account for my company.'
  • Fill in your company details. Remember to select 'Charity' as the Business Type from the drop down menu.
  • After you complete your registration, you will be provided with a business ID number.
  • Once registered, please email the Charity team (charitydiscount@thetrainline.com) with the following information:
  • The ID number of your business account
  • Your registered charity number
  • Confirmation of your eligibility
  • Please put the name of your organisation in the subject line.


Activation will be completed within 15 working days of receiving a valid request.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: From 13 August 2010 until further notice.

Promotion.Summary: Combination of rail and add-on bus fare to Cheltenham Races

OfferDetails.Details:
A rail and add-on bus fare is available on race days to Cheltenham Races. Stagecoach run a race day shuttle bus service from outside the station to the racecourse.

Customers may obtain further details of the bus service by calling 'Traveline' on 0871 200 22 33, or by visiting www.traveline.info.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:

Hand luggage only. Accompanied dogs may be conveyed on the buses at the discretion of the driver.

Discounts

No Railcard or other discounts on the bus portion.

Holders of Privilege Travel facilities and Inter-Rail cards should book rail tickets to/from Cheltenham Spa, and purchase add-on tickets separately.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see
