Promotion.Summary: Free travel on West Midland Metro included with an Off Peak Return to London Marylebone

OfferDetails.Details:
Travel from anywhere on the Midland Metro to London Marylebone via Birmingham Snow Hill (or vice versa) for the cost of an Off Peak Return.

If starting your journey at a Midland Metro station, passengers should purchase a ticket for the Metro service as normal, and this will be accepted as part-payment for the through ticket when this is purchased in Birmingham.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
Not valid on services timed to arrive at London Marylebone before 10:00 on Mondays to Fridays.

No restriction on travel from London Marylebone.

Restrictions do not apply at weekends or on public holidays.

Promotion.Summary: Cheaper family travel

OfferDetails.Details:
Up to 2 adults and 2 children can travel together (a minimum of 1 child must travel). Up to 2 additional children can travel with the group for £5 each.

Available from any station between Kidderminster and Leamington Spa inclusive to London Marylebone. Also available from Stratford-upon-Avon to London Marylebone.

Return within one 30 days.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
Valid for return up to 30 days later; can be used to return the same day.

Valid on any train arriving London Marylebone after 1000 on Mondays to Fridays, any train on Saturdays and Sundays. Return on any train. Railcard or other discounts do NOT apply.

PurchaseDetails.Details: This offer can be purchased through Chiltern from the station concerned.

Promotion.Summary: Additional fare to travel from Cholsey station on the Cholsey and Wallingford Railway

OfferDetails.Details: The Cholsey & Wallingford Railway (CWR) is located within The London & Thames Valley region of the Great Western Railway network. Services operated by the CWR depart from platform 5 at Cholsey station and run for nearly 3 miles through the rural Oxfordshire countryside. On arrival at Wallingford station there are many activities for all ages. The line is a former GWR branch line that was originally constructed to run from Cholsey through to Watlington, however the line terminates at Wallingford.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
These fares are not valid for Santa Special days. This ticket can be bought for special events and Gala days but an additional payment may be required by The Cholsey & Wallingford Railway upon arrival.

You should check that services are operating on the day you wish to travel, details are available from the CWR on (01491) 835067 or at http://www.cholsey-wallingford-railway.com/

PurchaseDetails.Details: The combined fares that are available have been priced to include the admission cost for The Cholsey & Wallingford Railway.

com:Annotation.com:Note: Guy Watts, Fares Implementation Manager - Major Projects

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
For combined fares use ticket type CWR - 'Wally Rover' and include Off-Peak day travel with Great Western Railway and unlimited travel on The Cholsey & Wallingford Railway.

Although if outside of this area Customers should be retailed the appropriate ticket to Cholsey (3031) and then the admission ticket from Cholsey (3031) to Cholsey&Wallyrly K942, ticket type HCH.

This method also applies to anybody wishing to use their railcard, they should be sold the appropriate ticket from origin to Cholsey (3031) and then the admission ticket HCH from Cholsey (3031) to Cholsey&Wallyrly K942.

Promotion.Summary: City Cruises 2FOR1 entry when you travel by train.

OfferDetails.Details:
Cruise the Thames and see London the relaxed way in style and comfort aboard a modern River Liner. With open top decks and wheelchair-accessible enclosed lower saloons with panoramic windows, upholstered seats, tables, toilets, refreshments available from two bars and commentary available in your choice of six languages.

Cruises depart from Westminster, Waterloo (London Eye), Tower and Greenwich piers every 40-45 minutes between 10.00-16.30 (later at weekends and in summer) every day of the year except 25 Dec.

Single, return and all-day hop-on/hop-off tickets (River Red Rover) available. Journey times from under 30 minutes to two and a half hours. Download your 2FOR1 voucher from: http://www.daysoutguide.co.uk/City-Cruises

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary:
A new ScotRail membership club called Club 50, for customers aged 50 and over, giving them access to great rail offers plus additional benefits.

20% discount on selected Off-Peak and Advance fares when purchased via the ScotRail website.

10% discount on selected Off-Peak and Advance fares when purchased via other channels.

Occasional additional offers from 3rd party partners as advertised on the ScotRail website.

Occasional additional promotional rail offers.

OfferDetails.Details:
• Club 50 membership is available to anyone aged 50 or over.
  • Club 50 members can show their Club 50 registration confirmation email, Club 50 membership confirmation email, temporary Club 50 card or Club 50 Smartcard to purchase discounted tickets at stations or on-train.
  • Club 50 members MUST carry their Club 50 registration confirmation email, Club 50 membership confirmation email, temporary Club 50 card or Club 50 Smartcard with them when travelling to validate their ticket.
  • Club 50 members will also be required to carry proof of age with them when travelling to validate their ticket.  
  • Acceptable forms of ID are - UK or EU Driving License photocard, Passport (any Nationality) and UK Senior Citizen bus pass.
  • The 20% discount is only available when purchased online. Use 'Club 50 Web' from the list of Railcards for the 20% discount.
  • The 10% discount is available at stations or telesales.
  • Conditions of 20% and 10% discounted tickets are as appropriate to the full price ticket purchased.
  • Discount is available to the names Club 50 member only.
  • Available between any two stations in Scotland.
  • Valid for travel on all TOC's.
  • It excludes 'London North Eastern Railway only' and CrossCountry only' fares.
  • Club 50 discount cannot be used in conjunction with any other Railcard or Local Authority Concession Card.
  • Club 50 cannot be used in conjunction with any other rail promotional offers.
  • No further child discounts are available.
  • Upgrades to First Class are not available with Club 50 discounted tickets.
  • Weekend First supplements are not valid in conjunction with Club 50 discounted tickets.
  • Refund conditions as per the full price ticket purchased.
  • Changes to travel plans as per conditions of ticket held.
  • Customers cannot break their journey other than for connectional purposes.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Club 50 tickets can be purchased via the following retail channels:

  • www.scotrail.co.uk/club50
  • Via Telesales on 0344 811 0141.
  • At a staffed station.
  • TVM's.
  • On train, at stations where no ticket issuing facilities exist.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
• Please follow the normal Railcard procedure and select Railcard code C50 (Club 50).  
  • Tickets will be endorsed CLB50.

Promotion.Summary:
From Friday 13 September 2019, Club 50 members can purchase £17.00 flat fare Return tickets between any two stations in Scotland.

This flat fare offer is in addition to the permanent Club 50 offer of 20% discount on Off Peak and Advance fares when purchased online and 10% discount when purchased at other retailing outlets.

OfferDetails.Details:
• The £17 Club 50 Flat Fare Return ticket offer is open to new and existing Club 50 members with an active membership
  • Available for Off-Peak return travel between any two stations in Scotland (where the usual ticket price is higher than £17)
  • Travel is valid anytime at the weekend
  • Monday to Friday you can travel on all services except:
    - Services arriving into Glasgow Queen Street, Glasgow Central, Edinburgh Waverley, Haymarket, Dundee or Aberdeen before 09:30
    - Services departing Glasgow Queen Street, Glasgow Central, Edinburgh Waverley or Haymarket after 16:42 until 18:11
    - On the 18:15 Edinburgh Waverley to Glasgow Queen Street and Glasgow Queen Street to Edinburgh Waverley services
  • Valid on ScotRail services
  • Valid for outbound travel from 13 September to 13 November 2019 inclusive
  • Return tickets are valid for up to one month and all travel must be completed by 12 December 2019
  • This offer is non refundable and you can't make changes to your travel plans
  • There are no First Class upgrades available and the offer can't be used in conjunction with any other rail promotional offers or Railcards
  • You can only break your journey to change trains
  • You can buy as many Flat Fare tickets as you like during the promotional period but all passengers must be Club 50 members
  • If you're buying Flat Fare tickets online, you can only buy two per transaction
  • You must present your Club 50 membership Smartcard with your £17 promotional ticket to validate travel
  • Your Club 50 membership must be active for both the outbound and return legs of your journey
  • You may be asked to show proof of age

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
Refunds and Changes to Travel Plans

  • This offer is non refundable.
  • No changes to travel plans are permitted with this offer.
  • Customers cannot break their journey other than for connectional purposes.

Upgrades and Excess Eligibility

  • Upgrades to First Class are not available with this offer.
  • Weekend First supplements are not valid in conjunction with this offer.
Discounts
  • This offer cannot be used in conjunction with any other Railcard or Local Authority Concession Card.
  • This offer cannot be used in conjunction with any other rail promotional offers.
  • No child discounts are available.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Available to purchase via the following retail channels:

 

  • Online via the specific link www.scotrail.co.uk/club50
  • Telesales on 0344 811 0141
  • Staffed Stations.
  • On train, at stations where no ticket issuing facilities exist.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions: Club 50 £17 Flat Fare offer tickets MUST NOT be advertised, offered or sold to any passengers before Wednesday 1st May 2019, even though the ticket type will show in retailing systems before this date.

Promotion.Summary: Discount on tickets

OfferDetails.Details:
The Cotswold Line Railcard gives the holder a 34% discount from Off Peak Single and Return tickets, and Anytime Day tickets on the route between Worcester Foregate Street & Oxford inclusive. The Railcard costs £9.95 for one year and is valid for use when Off Peak tickets are available. Only available for sale at the following stations:

  • Worcester Foregate Street, Worcester Shrub Hill, Evesham, Moreton-in-Marsh, Kingham, Charlbury, Oxford.

Tickets with the Railcard discount can be sold at these station ticket offices, but when they are closed or travel is from an unstaffed station the discounted ticket is also available on board the train

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
Validity: 

  • Towards Oxford: valid on any train timed to depart Worcester Foregate Street at 08:40 or later
  • Towards Worcester: valid on any train timed to depart Oxford at 08:40 or later
  • Any time at weekends and Bank Holidays.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Please note: The Journey Planner and online ticket retailers will not calculate discounts for Cotswold Line Railcard holders. Tickets should be purchased in person from the Ticket Office to claim the Railcard discount.

Promotion.Summary: Purchase a Dales Railcard and save 1/3rd on the cost of single and day return tickets.

OfferDetails.Details:
If you live in the appropriate area you can purchase a Dales Railcard and save money on journeys within the map.

For a Dales Railcard application form, who can apply, where can you use it, select here

To apply complete application form and take it to Appleby, Carlisle, Settle, Skipton, or Carnforth Railway Stations with proof of your address and identity (eg driving licence, utilities bill). Alternatively apply on line at http://shop.scrdc.co.uk/dales-railcard.html/

Dales Railcards are valid for twelve months from the date of issue or commencement date. You can apply up to one month in advance for a renewal Dales Railcard.

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Travel validity is between all stations shown on the map, (plus Brampton and Wetheral on the Tyne Valley line) with the restrictions that it cannot be used exclusively within the Leeds/Bradford Skipton area or exclusively between Carnforth, Lancaster, Bare Lane and Morecambe. Also on Sundays only it is valid between Clitheroe / Whalley and Hellifield.

BookingConditions.Details:
If you live between:

  • Skipton and Carlisle (on the Leeds-Settle-Appleby-Carlisle line)
  • Skipton and Carnforth (on the Leeds-Morecambe line)
  • Carlisle and Brampton (on the Tyne Valley Carlisle-Newcastle line)

and your postcode is in one of the following areas:

  • CA 1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 9, 10, 11, 16, 17
  • DL 8, 11, 12
  • LA 2, 5, 6, 10
  • BD 23, 24
  • BB7

you can apply for a Dales Railcard.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Please note: The Journey Planner and online ticket retailers will not calculate discounts for Dales Railcard holders. Tickets should be purchased in person from the Ticket Office to claim the Railcard discount.

ChildFares.Details: Up to four children (ages 5 to 15 inclusive) can travel with a railcard holder and the child fare is based on an 81% discount on the adult fare. There is a minimum child fare of £1.

Promotion.PromotionName: Days Out in Kent and Sussex
Promotion.Summary: If you want to head out of town there's loads on offer, here are a few ideas to get you on the right track.

OfferDetails.Details:
Full details of all the following Days Out in Kent and Sussex can be found on Southeastern website here and here.

  • Canterbury - At your ticket office ask for an all-in-one Canterbury Passport ticket, providing you with entrance to the Cathedral, St Augustine's Abbey, Canterbury Tales, and one of the four museums.
  • Chilham: Kent Downs - Take the short walk from the station to the ancient village of Chilham. At the heart of the village is the 15th century Square, considered by many to be one of the most perfectly preserved medieval settings in south-east England.
  • Eynsford: Kent Downs - Swoop down into Eynsford station, where you'll find the Eagle Heights Bird of Prey Centre, with flying displays and indoor demonstrations.
  • Hollingbourne: Kent Downs - A historic village noted for its superb landscape where ancient buildings add to the rural heritage.
  • Lenham: Kent Downs - Explore the old village of Lenham with it's fine bakery, tea-room and pubs.
  • Otford: Kent Downs - Explore the village with its pretty duck pond, shops, bakery and pubs. Follow the North Downs Way out of the village and use public rights of way to take you further into the Downs.
  • Rochester - Find your way around this beautiful historic city with a self-guided tour of its most interesting spots, including the cathedral and the haunts of its most famous son, Charles Dickens. Whitstable - Make for the beach for some fun.
  • Shoreham: Kent Downs - Pick up the Darent Valley Path and walk to Otford, Kemsing or Eynsford, from where you can walk or take the train back again.
  • Tonbridge - The historic market town has something for everyone. It is well known for its culture and heritage as well as its excellent shopping facilities.
  • Wye: Kent Downs - Explore the charming village of Wye and its medieval college.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Whatever you're after, here are some suggestions that are only a short walk from London's National Rail stations.

OfferDetails.Details:
Full details of the following Days Out in London can be found on the Southeastern website. 

  • Buckingham Palace - Say hello to the Queen or watch the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace, just 10 minutes' walk from Victoria station.
  • The London Dungeon - Why not terrify the kids at The London Dungeon on Tooley Street - a journey through Britain's most gruesome history.
  • West End Theatres - Feed your imagination with a trip to a West End show.
  • West End Restaurants - Enjoy a meal at a fancy West End restaurant - there are hundreds to choose from.
  • Covent Garden - Be amazed by the live street performers at Covent Garden Market, just 5 minutes from Charing Cross station.
  • The National Gallery - Discover the country's finest treasures at the National Gallery, just across Trafalgar Square.
  • The London Aquarium - Sabre-toothed sharks, rays, piranhas - come and meet them all face-to-face at the London Aquarium at County Hall.
  • The London Eye - a 10-minute walk from Waterloo East, followed by a spectacular 30-minute flight over the city.
  • Tower of London - Visit the Tower of London and see the Crown Jewels, the Yeoman Warders and Traitor's Gate - in the flesh.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Unlimited travel on Southern services.

OfferDetails.Details:
DaySave - Southern offers unlimited travel on Southern services on the date shown on the ticket.

Off-Peak DaySave tickets can be purchased in person from the tourist information centres at Eastbourne, Lewes, Seaford and Hastings or online at www.southernrailway.com.

DaySave Off-Peak and Off Peak Group ticket offers unlimited travel on all Southern Off Peak services on the date shown on the ticket and carries the following restrictions:

  • Valid anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays
  • Not valid before 10:00 Monday to Friday
  • Not valid on trains departing from London Victoria, London Bridge, Clapham Junction and East Croydon between 16:15 and 19:15 Monday to Friday.
  • Group tickets are valid for up to four people (adults or children) who must travel together at all times.
  • Up to 4 additional accompanied children may travel with each adult for just £2.00 each.
  • DaySave tickets must be purchased a minimum of 3 days in advance if using Ticket on Departure from a Southern managed stations.
  • If the journey starts from another train operators station, the tickets will need to be posted and therefore must be booked at least 5 days before the date of travel.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Valid only on Southern services
  • Not valid on Gatwick Express services
  • Not valid on Thameslink services
  • Not valid on Great Northern services
  • Not valid on any other Train Operators services
  • The ticket is valid for one day
  • Valid for Standard class travel only
  • No railcard discounts available
  • Tickets cannot be exchanged or refunded

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Daysave tickets can be purchased on the Southern website and in person from the following Tourist Information Centres:

  • Eastbourne
  • Lewes
  • Hastings
  • Seaford

AdultFares.Details:
SD1 - DaySave Off-Peak  - From 2 January 2020 - Online £20.50 (Tourist Information Centre's - £21.00)  

SD4 - Daysave Off-Peak Group (3-4 adults) - From 2 January 2020 - Online £41.00 (Tourist Information Centre's - £42.00)

ChildFares.Details:
Child fares are not available for Daysave Off Peak tickets.

However, up to 4 children may travel with each accompanying adult who purchases a Daysave Off Peak or Daysave Off Peak Group ticket for just £2.00 each.

GroupFares.Details: SD4 - DaySave Off-Peak Group £39.00 (£40.00 from 2 January 2019) for 3 or 4 Adults and / or Children

Promotion.Summary: Unlimited off-peak travel on selected Thameslink services on the day the ticket is valid.

OfferDetails.Details:
DaySave offers you unlimited Off Peak travel on selected Thameslink services on the day of validity. DaySave tickets are not valid on the services of any other train operator.

DaySave can be used from 10:00 Monday to Friday. It is not valid for travel on northbound services departing St Pancras International between 16:30 and 19:01 for journeys to any station between St Albans and Bedford inclusive.

DaySave can be used at any time on weekends and Bank Holidays for journeys on Thameslink services over the following routes only:

  • Bedford and Brighton
  • Bedford and Sutton (via Wimbledon)
  • Bedford and Sutton (via Mitcham Junction)
  • Bedford and Sevenoaks
DaySave tickets are not valid on any other journeys where Thameslink train services operate.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Valid only on Thameslink services on the above routes;
  • Not valid on Gatwick Express services;
  • Not valid on Southern services;
  • Not valid on Great Northern services;
  • The ticket is valid for one day;
  • Valid for Standard class travel only;
  • No railcard discounts available;
  • Tickets cannot be exchanged or refunded.

DaySave tickets are not available to buy at train station ticket offices or on board trains. See 'Purchasing' section below for details

BookingConditions.Details:
• ONLY valid on Thameslink services on the above routes
  • Travel may be made up to 04:29 the following day
  • No further discounts available
  • Normal refund arrangements apply

PurchaseDetails.Details:
DaySave must be purchased before travel and is available from one of the following outlets:

  • Brighton One Stop Travel 
  • Dunstable Tourist Information Centre

ChildFares.Details: A maximum of 4 accompanied children may travel with each adult for £2.00 each.

Promotion.Summary: A combination of rail and add-on discounted ticket to Dean Forest Railway

OfferDetails.Details: The Dean Forest is a haven for walkers, cyclist and real ale enthusiasts alike. The Forest Railway branch line takes visitors through Lydney town centre, where you can visit St. Briavels Caste, the harbour or take a stroll around the famous park gardens. You can stop off at Nochard with its museum, cafeteria, woodland and line side walks. Or you can visit Parkend which offers a delightfully restored station, village with real ale pubs, forest walks, a RSPB nature reserve and cycle ways. The Dean Forest Railway's Lydney junction is less than ten minutes walk from Lydney station. You just exit Lydney station and walk north up the road towards the signal box. You will see the entrance to the Dean Forest Railway just before you arrive at the signal box on your right.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: The combined ticket allows unlimited travel on the Dean Forest Railway on the specified date.

BookingConditions.Details:
Railcard discounts apply only to the rail element of the journey and not the Add-on amount for Dean Forest Railway.

Normal refund conditions apply

Promotion.Summary: Reduced rail travel across Devon and Cornwall.

OfferDetails.Details:
Annual Season Tickets sold within and for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall are issued as a Devon and Cornwall Gold Card which offers the same reduced rail travel as the Devon & Cornwall Railcard including one-third off most Standard Class Off-Peak and Off-Peak Day train tickets across Devon and Cornwall.

Discounted tickets can be used for travel on Great Western Railway, South Western Railway and CrossCountry services.

One accompanying adult also receives one-third off their ticket and you can take up to four accompanying children (aged 5-15) for a flat fare of  £1 each (£2 for Day Ranger tickets).

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Which tickets do I receive discounts on?

  • 1/3 off Off-Peak Day Return / Single for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall
  • 1/3 off Off-Peak Return / Single for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall
  • 1/3 off Devon Day Ranger
  • 1/3 off Ride Cornwall Day Ranger
  • 1/3 off Atlantic Coast Line Ranger (Par to Newquay)
  • 1/3 off Looe Valley Line Ranger (Liskeard to Looe)
  • 1/3 off Maritime Line Ranger (Truro to Falmouth Docks)
  • 1/3 off Tamar Valley Line Ranger (Plymouth to Gunnislake)
  • 1/3 off Tarka Line Ranger (Exeter Central to Barnstaple)
  • 1/2 off St Ives Bay Line Day Ranger

BookingConditions.Details:
Not valid for discounts on:

  • Tickets that extend outside Devon and Cornwall
  • Season tickets
  • Anytime or Anytime Day tickets
  • First Class tickets, although you can upgrade a discounted Standard ticket at weekends by paying the normal weekend upgrade charge
  • In conjunction with any other special promotion, unless specifically advertised
  • On any special excursion train
  • On bus services

PurchaseDetails.Details:
How do I get a Devon & Cornwall Gold Card?

Devon & Cornwall Gold Cards are issued to Annual Season Tickets sold within and for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall.

AdultFares.Details: Issued free with Annual Season Tickets within and for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall.

Promotion.Summary: Reduced rail travel across Devon and Cornwall.

OfferDetails.Details:
The Devon & Cornwall Railcard residents of Devon and Cornwall one-third off most Standard Class Off-Peak and Off-Peak Day train tickets across Devon and Cornwall.

Discounted tickets can be used for travel on Great Western Railway, South Western Railway and CrossCountry services.

One accompanying adult also receives one-third off their ticket and you can take up to four accompanying children (aged 5-15) for a flat fare of  £1 each (£2 for Day Ranger tickets).

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• 1/3 off Off-Peak Day Return / Single for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall
  • 1/3 off Off-Peak Return / Single for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall
  • 1/3 off Devon Day Ranger
  • Discounted Ride Cornwall Day Ranger
  • 1/3 off Atlantic Coast Line Ranger (Par to Newquay)
  • 1/3 off Looe Valley Line Ranger (Liskeard to Looe)
  • 1/3 off Maritime Line Ranger (Truro to Falmouth Docks)
  • 1/3 off Tamar Valley Line Ranger (Plymouth to Gunnislake)
  • 1/3 off Tarka Line Ranger (Exeter Central to Barnstaple)
  • 1/2 off St Ives Bay Line Day Ranger

BookingConditions.Details:
Not valid on:

  • Tickets that extend outside Devon and Cornwall
  • Season tickets
  • Anytime or Anytime Day tickets
  • First Class tickets, although you can upgrade a discounted Standard ticket at weekends by paying the normal weekend upgrade charge
  • In conjunction with any other special promotion, unless specifically advertised
  • On any special excursion train
  • On bus services

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Am I eligible?

Anyone aged 16 years of age or over, who is resident within the counties of Devon or Cornwall, City of Plymouth, Torbay Unitary Authority or Isles of Scilly can apply for a Devon & Cornwall Railcard.

What documents are accepted as proof of residency and proof of identity?

Proof of residency:

  • Council tax bill
  • Utility bill
  • Bank/credit card statement
  • Driving licence

Proof of identity:

  • Passport
  • Driving Licence (incorporating a photo)
  • College / Work ID

How do I get a Devon & Cornwall Railcard (Gold Card)

To get a Devon & Cornwall Railcard please complete the application form and take it together with proof of residency and proof of identity to any staffed station within Devon and Cornwall.

Devon & Cornwall Gold Cards are issued to Annual Season Tickets sold within and for journeys wholly within Devon and Cornwall.

Please note: The Journey Planner and online ticket retailers will not calculate discounts for Devon & Cornwall Railcard holders (Devon & Cornwall Gold Cards will be recognised). Tickets should be purchased in person from the Ticket Office to claim the Railcard discount.

Promotion.Summary: If you are disabled, you can buy a Disabled Railcard for only £20 or £54. Save 1/3 on Standard and First Class rail fares

OfferDetails.Details: Please visit the disabled persons railcard website to find out more or click here to buy now.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
1. Tickets for your journey should be purchased before boarding the train and when buying tickets you must show the Railcard. You must have the Railcard with you on your journey and show the valid Railcard and ticket to rail staff at their request. If you do not show both the Railcard and the ticket, you will be required to pay the full price Standard or First Class Single fare, as appropriate for your journey as if no ticket was purchased before starting the journey and in some cases a penalty fare. This does not apply if there was no ticket office at the station at which you began your journey or if the ticket office was closed and there was no ticket machine from which you could buy a discounted ticket.

2. Time restrictions - ask for details.

3. In the case of some low price tickets the actual discount with a Railcard may be slightly lower than that advertised.

4. The right is reserved to revise these Conditions and availability of the tickets detailed here. The Train Companies will endeavour to give three months' notice of any changes before they are due to come into effect.

5. Tickets issued to the holder of the Railcard are issued subject to the National Rail Conditions of Travel. Copies of the National Rail Conditions of Travel are available from any staffed station ticket office.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You must provide proof that you qualify for the Disabled Persons Railcard. You might qualify if you have a visual impairment or a hearing impairment or have epilepsy or are in receipt of a disability related benefit.

The Disabled Person's Railcard can either be purchased online, through telesales or by completing the form available on the Disabled Person's Railcard website and send to the address given in the Rail Travel Made Easy leaflet with proof of your entitlement.

Existing Railcard holders who want to renew their card can do so by phone on 0345 6050 525 or online on the Disabled Person's Railcard website

 

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Railcards section simply select the number and type of Railcards that you will be travelling with and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Railcard!

AdultFares.Details: Save 1/3 on Standard and First Class rail fares throughout Great Britain.

ChildFares.Details: Save 1/2 on Standard and First Class rail fares throughout Great Britain.

Promotion.Summary: If you're making a Group Booking for 10 or more people on London North Eastern Railway - whether you're organising a school trip for a class, or a weekend away for you and some friends - you're better off making your booking through our Group Travel Services.

OfferDetails.Details: For more details go to www.LNER.co.uk

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Save time and money when you travel by train to Dreamland in Margate

OfferDetails.Details:
Combined tickets are available to Dreamland in Margate including the train fare and the admission to Dreamland.

Only day return tickets are available.

Southeastern Kids for a Quid tickets are available. 

The park is open every day up to and including 30th August 2019

During September 2019, the park is open on the following weekends: 7, 8, 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, 29

com:Annotation.com:Note: The park is open every day up to and including 30th August 2019 During September 2019, the park is open on the following weekends: 7, 8, 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, 29

FurtherInformation.Details: https://www.dreamland.co.uk

PurchaseDetails.Details: Tickets can be bought at any staffed railway station.

ConcessionFares.Details: Railcard discounts apply to the rail leg only, not the admission element.

Promotion.Summary: Through ticketing from National Rail stations in London, Kent and parts of East Sussex with an Off Peak Day Return which include a trip on the private heritage East Kent Railway (EKR) between Shepherds Well and Eythorne.

OfferDetails.Details:
Through tickets to the East Kent Railway (EKR) offer a reduction on the normal separate fares.

The EKR is a short but interesting 30 year old heritage railway running from Shepherds Well to Eythorne.

The railway runs on most Sundays with a limited Saturday service with train times entered in journey planners. Where no times are shown, this indicates that there is either no service or through tickets are not available due to a special event taking place on the EKR

The price is based on a slightly reduced Off Peak Day Return to Shepherds Well plus a reduced rate 'add-on' for the EKR portion, their fares are shown below in the 'Prices' section.

Normal railcard discounts apply to the NR leg to Shepherds Well

Concession fares apply to Senior Railcard holders on the EKR portion.

Reduced rates apply for Rail Staff with privilege concessions for the through journey.

Kids for a quid applies throughout at a cost or £4 to include the reduced EKR travel.

Whilst children under 5 years are free on the NR network child rate fares (£3.50) apply to children aged 2 to 15 inclusive.

Tickets are refundable subject to the normal refund rules applicable to the Train Company from which the tickets are purchased.

For further information about the East Kent Railway visit https://eastkentrailway.co.uk

FurtherInformation.Details:
2019 - dates when the through ticketing applies.

July 27th, 28th

August 3rd, 4th, 10th, 11th, 17th, 18th

September 1st, 8th, 15, 22nd, 29th

October 6th, 13th

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
This is a joint through fare to include both NR and EKR services via Shepherds Well.

The destination in ticketing systems is EKR.

Tickets are available on-train when joining from an unstaffed station.

Promotion.Summary: Discount tickets to/from London St Pancras

OfferDetails.Details:
East Midlands Railway has introduced a Carnet ticket based on 10 discounted Anytime tickets. There is a minimum of ten tickets that need to be issued. Only available on East Midlands Railway services to/from London St Pancras and one of the following stations:

  • Barnsley, Sheffield, Chesterfield, Meadowhall, Duffield, Whatstandwell , Willington, Ambergate, Derby, Nottingham, Alfreton, Langley Mill, Cromford, Long Eaton, Beeston, Burton on Trent, Matlock, Matlock Bath, Belper, Loughborough, Leicester, Market Harborough, Kettering, Wellingborough.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: Carnet tickets are valid for 3 months from the date of issue and all outward and return travel must be completed with in the validity period. No Railcard or child discounts are available. No refunds or changes to travel plans are allowed once a Carnet ticket has been purchased.

PurchaseDetails.Details: This product is available from staffed rail stations, rail appointed travel agents and East Midlands Railway Telesales.

Passengers.Note:
When self-validating a Carnet, customers should be advised to endorse the date with 2-digit numerical values only, eg. 07 09 for travel on 7th September, using permanent black ink.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

Promotion.Summary: Through fares and add on fares from Duffield are available to the Ecclesbourne Valley Railway.

OfferDetails.Details:
The Ecclesbourne Valley Railway is a community-owned and locally-managed railway. They operate passenger services between  Duffield, Shottle, Idridgehay, Wirksworth and Ravenstor using Diesel Multiple Units and steam locomotives.

Through fares and add on fares from Duffield are available to the Ecclesbourne Valley Railway.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.PromotionName: English National Concessionary Travel Passes Discount Scheme
Promotion.Summary: 34% discount on all walk-up singles and return tickets to holders of English National Concessionary Travel Passes

OfferDetails.Details:
34% discount for journeys between Weymouth and Westbury and between Swindon and Worcester Foregate Street on all walk-up singles and return tickets to holders of English National Concessionary Travel Passes.

This is not available on Season or Advance tickets.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Details on this event will be published closer to the time.

OfferDetails.Details: Details on this event will be published closer to the time.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Admission tickets to Epsom races can only be bought when customers purchase a travel ticket with a destination of Tattenham Corner, Epsom Downs or Epsom or by someone who produces a valid season ticket, which allows travel at Tattenham Corner, Epsom Downs or Epsom.

ConcessionFares.Details: Railcard discounts are only available on the rail element of the offer.

Promotion.Summary: Discounted fares for local residents travelling on the Esk Valley Railway between Middlesbrough and Whitby

OfferDetails.Details:
The railcard is valid for all journeys between Whitby and Middlesbrough and is available to residents of selected postcodes in North Yorkshire and Teesside only. The railcard costs £10.00 and is valid for one year.

Discounts available

Adult

The card holder is entitled to 34% discount on Anytime Day and Anytime ticket types. There is no minimum fare on Anytime Day and Anytime ticket types for the card holder.

Children

Children are entitled to 81% discount on Anytime Day and Anytime ticket types. There is a minimum fare of £1.00 for any accompanying child.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information visit www.eskvalleyrailway.co.uk  or the Northern webpage.

BookingConditions.Details: There are no time restrictions

PurchaseDetails.Details: The railcard can be purchased at Whitby and Middlesbrough ticket offices on the Esk Valley Railway Line and additionally at the ticket offices at Malton, Redcar Central, Scarborough, Thirsk and Thornaby stations only.

GroupFares.Details: Cardholder and up to four accompanied children under 16 years of age. Children who become 16 years of age during the validity of the Railcard are entitled to the discounted child fare

Promotion.Summary: Inclusive rail, bus transfer and one day entry.

OfferDetails.Details:
This inclusive offer for @Bristol includes rail travel, bus transfer between Bristol Temple Meads station and College Green and one day's entry. It represents a 15% discount on entry to @Bristol - an amazing world of hands-on discovery.

Visits to @Bristol typically take around 3 hours.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Open all year round 10.00-17.00 weekdays, term time, 10.00-18.00 weekends, bank holidays and daily during local school holidays.

Explore-At-Bristol is closed for a refresh on 16th-18th of September 2009 and Christmas Eve, Christmas Day and Boxing Day every year.

BookingConditions.Details:
This ticket can only be purchased at Great Western Railway staffed railway stations, not online or at Explore-At-Bristol.

Normal terms and condition, including refunds, apply to the ticket type sold. One day's entry to Explore-At-Bristol will be permitted either on the date on the ticket only for those tickets valid for one day, or within the period of validity for those tickets valid for a calendar month. Explore-At-Bristol will retain the outward portion of travel tickets. Please note that other "Concession" fares may apply and enquiries should be directed to Explore-At-Bristol.

EXCLUDED DAYS: Explore-At-Bristol will be closed for a refresh on 16th-18th of September 2009 and Christmas Eve, Christmas Day and Boxing Day every year.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from all staffed National Rail Stations, rail appointed travel agents and telesales. This ticket can not be purchased online or at Explore-At-Bristol. Explore-At-Bristol entrance tickets for children aged 3 or 4 must be purchased on arrival. Children under 3 go free. Concessions can be purchased on arrival for £4.50 for one attraction with proof of that day's train travel to Explore-At-Bristol.

InternalInfo.Details: Add on fare from Bristol Temple Meads

ConcessionFares.Details: Railcard discounts will apply to the rail element only.

Promotion.Summary: Travelling with kids? Get 1/3 off adult fares and 60% off kids fares with a Family & Friends Railcard.

OfferDetails.Details:
A Family & Friends Railcard costs £30 and it'll save you 1/3 on adult fares and 60% on kids' fares throughout Great Britain for a whole year.

The discount applies to all Standard, Anytime, off-Peak and Advance fares and what's more, up to four adults and four children can travel on one card, and they don't even need to be related. Take a look at all the ticket types you can make savings on with a Family & Friends Railcard.

The card can be issued in the name of two adults, so that when one named person can't use it, the other one can, as long as there is at least one child over the age of five travelling. See our eligibility criteria for more information.

There are plenty of ways you can use your Railcard, for both long and short trips. Better still you can use it almost anytime on weekends, public holidays and during the week.

  • The only restriction is morning Peak time services, Monday to Friday (not including public holidays) when journeys are made wholly within the London and South East area. See Time Restrictions for more details.

Your Railcard also allows you to take advantage of our great partner offers, giving you exclusive discounts across the UK.  See our offers section for all the latest partner offers.

Now you can also buy a 3-year Family & Friends Railcard, available only online. It's great value at £70, saving you an extra £20 on the cost of renewing your 1-year Railcard for three consecutive years.

Please visit Family & Friends Railcard website for more information or click here buy online.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: Tickets issued to the holder of the Railcard are issued subject to the Family & Friends Railcard Terms and Conditions and also the National Rail Conditions of Travel

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You can buy online on the Family & Friends Railcard website.
For more information on buying online, please see our FAQ's.

You can also buy a Family & Friends Railcard at a staffed station ticket office or by calling your nearest train company telesales number. For train company telesales numbers, please contact National Rail Enquiries on: 03457 48 49 50 (calls are charged at local rate).

Your Railcard will be despatched within one working day, and sent by first class post. Please ensure that you allow enough time before your journey for your Railcard to reach you.

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Railcards section simply select the number and type of Railcards that you will be travelling with and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Railcard!

Passengers.Note: Group size: At least one named cardholder and at least one child must be travelling to enable discounted tickets to be used. The maximum group size is up to four adults (aged 16 years and over) including the named cardholder(s), and four children (aged 5-15 years).

AdultFares.Details:
Save 1/3 on adult fares throughout Great Britain.

£30 for 1 year

£70 for 3 years

ChildFares.Details: Save 60% on child's fares throughout Great Britain

Promotion.Summary: A Family area ticket valid within the given area of the map

OfferDetails.Details:
A family ticket which gives unlimited group travel at off peak times

A group could be up to 5 persons. There must be at least 1 Adult and a maximum of 2 Adults in the group.

Permitted examples of eligible groups are: 

  • 2 adults and 3 children
  • 1 adult and 4 children

The group does not have to include 5 as 2 adults and 1 child could use this ticket

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Off peak is valid after 09:30 Monday to Friday, all day Saturday, Sunday and public holidays

Valid within the area of the map with Merseyrail and Northern only

Only 1 ticket is issued and the group must travel together

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from train stations within the map area

  • Bourne End

  • Henley on Thames

  • Marlow
  • Shiplake
  • Twyford
  • Wargrave

Promotion.Summary: 1 day unlimited travel

OfferDetails.Details:
Unlimited rail travel on Great Western Railway services from 09:30 on weekdays between Newport and Carmarthen inclusive, and at any time at weekends and on bank holidays. Unlimited travel (no peak period restrictions) on First Cymru buses in the South Wales area for one day.

Valid between the following rail stations: Newport and Carmarthen. Valid on all First Cymru buses within the area bounded by Cardiff and Carmarthen (including the Swansea - Cardiff shuttle coach service).

NOT valid on tours or excursions.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: Valid on Great Western Railway trains (only) for travel to/from any station in South Wales between Newport and Carmarthen stations only.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Purchase at any railway station ticket office between Newport and Carmarthen; First Cymru travel office; or Great Western Railway train manager. The one-day ticket can also be purchased from the driver of any First Cymru bus

FamilyFares.Details: £22.70 valid for 2 Adults and up to 3 Children, or 1 Adult and up to 4 Children travelling together.

Promotion.PromotionName: Flexible off peak travel for less!
Promotion.Summary: Now 50% off Super Off-Peak single tickets

OfferDetails.Details: For more details go to http://www.LNER.co.uk

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Combination of rail and discounted entry ticket to Fontwell races

OfferDetails.Details:
Combined tickets are available to Fontwell Races, simply ask at the Ticket Office for tickets to Barnham and then admission tickets to Fontwell Park or produce a valid season ticket for a rail journey to Barnham and you can benefit from a reduced entrance fee of £10 for the Grandstand.

Fontwell racecourse provides a courtesy bus service that operates from Barnham station to the course from approximately 2 hours prior to the first race. There are return journeys to the station after racing.

For details of race fixtures please visit the Fontwell Park website www.fontwellpark.co.uk/whats-on/.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Only available on race days

BookingConditions.Details: Railcard discounts apply only to the rail element of the journey and not the Add-on amount for Fontwell Racecourse.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Combined tickets are available to Fontwell Races, simply ask at the Ticket Office for tickets to Barnham and then admission tickets to Fontwell Park or produce a valid season ticket for a rail journey to Barnham and you can benefit from a reduced entrance fee of £10 for the Grandstand.

ChildFares.Details: Children under 16 accompanied by an adult are admitted free to the racecourse (Rail fare applies age 5 to 15 inclusive). Unaccompanied children under 16 are not allowed in the racecourse

Promotion.PromotionName: Free Travel for Accompanied Under 11s on London Underground, London Overground, DLR, London Tram and Bus
Promotion.Summary: To improve young people's access to education, sport and leisure activities throughout the Capital.

OfferDetails.Details:
Up to 4 children aged 5 -10 years old can travel free on the following Transport for London services when accompanied by an adult travelling with a valid ticket.

  • London Underground
  • London Overground
  • TfL Rail
  • DLR
  • London Trams
  • London Buses

By agreement, this facility is also available on other National Rail services on designated 'inter-available' routes.

Details are as follows:

Amersham and London Marylebone - (Chiltern Railways)

Finsbury Park and London Kings Cross / Moorgate - (Great Northern)

West Hampstead Thameslink and London Bridge / Elephant & Castle - (Thameslink)

London Liverpool Street and Seven Sisters / Tottenham Hale / Walthamstow Central (but not at intermediate stations) - (Greater Anglia)

Stratford and London Liverpool Street - (Greater Anglia)

Upminster and London Fenchurch Street / London Liverpool Street (via Barking) but not for entry/exit at Forest Gate or Maryland - (c2c)

West Ruislip and South Ruislip - (Chiltern Railways)

Children travelling free do not require tickets and will be allowed through ticket gates by staff. The accompanying adult should use gates as normal.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Unlimited travel on all train and most bus services in Bristol, Bath, North Somerset or South Gloucestershire.

OfferDetails.Details:
The Freedom Travelpass gives the holder unlimited travel on all train and most bus services in Bristol, Bath, North Somerset or South Gloucestershire.

Daily, weekly and monthly tickets are available.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
The Freedom Travelpass is valid on the following operator's services:

Rail 

  • Great Western Railway
  • CrossCountry Trains
  • South Western Railway

Bus 

  • Abus 
  • ACL Travel 
  • Faresaver 
  • First Bristol 
  • First Somerset & Avon 
  • Mike's Travel 
  • Ryans Coaches 
  • Shaftesbury & District 
  • Somerbus 
  • Vista Coachways 
  • Wessex Connect

For information about bus travel times and routes visit http://www.traveline.info or call 0871 200 2233

BookingConditions.Details: Off peak tickets are valid on all services after 0930 during weekdays. A Photocard is required for the monthly Freedom Travelpass.

PurchaseDetails.Details: The Freedom Travelpass is available for three zones; A, A & B or A, B & C (see map). It can be bought from station booking offices, on the train and from the bus drivers.

Freedom Travelpass

Promotion.Summary:
Great value fare available for groups of three or four people travelling together on longer distance routes.

Valid on the following ScotRail routes:

Glasgow/Edinburgh to Inverness

Glasgow/Edinburgh to Aberdeen

Aberdeen to Inverness

OfferDetails.Details: Flat fare for small groups of 3 or 4 people travelling together, the price is the same whether there are 3 or 4 people in the group. The Friends Fare is an Advance ticket and is subject to availability

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Travel is on ScotRail services only
  • Friends Fare tickets must be booked no later than 18:00 the day before travel
  • Reservations are essential when booking this ticket. Both outward and return reservations must be made at the same time
  • Each member of the group travelling on the correct train, holding a valid Friends Fare ticket AND a valid reservation will be able to travel with no excess required.
  • Any other members of the group who are travelling on a different train to that specified on their ticket, will be deemed to have no valid ticket and should be charged the appropriate fare for their journey.
  • Break of journey at intermediate stations is not allowed, unless for designated connections.
  • Friends Fares are only available for standard class travel.
  • Refunds are not available.
  • Travel plans can be changed, before outward travel, subject to a £10 administration fee for each ticket.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• At a staffed station
  • Rail appointed Travel Agents
  • Telesales on 0344 811 0141 
  • Online at www.scotrail.co.uk

NOTE: not available on the train

Promotion.Summary: Discount tickets on Gatwick Express services to/from London Victoria - Gatwick Airport.

OfferDetails.Details:
Gatwick Express have introduced a Carnet ticket based on 10 discounted Anytime tickets (Express Class Carnet) or 10 discounted Anytime First Class tickets (First Class Carnet).

Only available on Gatwick Express services between London Victoria & Gatwick Airport

FurtherInformation.Details:
For further information on Standard Class Carnet, please click here

For further information on First Class Carnet, please click here

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Each of the ten Carnet tickets are available for one single journey in either direction for twelve months from the date of issue shown on ticket.

There are no time restrictions on their use.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Carnet tickets are only available from Gatwick Express ticket offices.

Passengers.Note:
When self-validating a Carnet, customers should be advised to endorse the date with 2-digit numerical values only, eg. 07 09 for travel on 7th September, using permanent black ink.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

ConcessionFares.Details: Not Available

Promotion.Summary: If you're a regular Grand Central customer, you could save money by using Carnet tickets for your journeys to and from London

OfferDetails.Details:
The Grand Central Carnet offers significant savings versus Grand Central Anytime and Off Peak fares. 

Carnet tickets are sold as a bundle of 10 single tickets which you can use as and when you need them. Simply fill in the date of travel on the top of the ticket before you travel. Board the train and show your ticket to the Conductor.

You can turn up and go with your Carnet tickets, no need to queue at the station.

You decide when to travel within the validity of your Carnet tickets, plus you can share these tickets with colleagues who also travel regularly, giving you complete flexibility and freedom.

More details, including prices, are available on the Grand Central website

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• Through telesales on 0845 603 4852 (select option 2) available from 09.30 - 16.30 Monday to Friday excluding Bank Holidays. 
  • At a station with a manned ticket office.
  • Through rail appointed travel agents.

Carnets are sent by First Class Delivery. Please allow at least five working days for delivery. Next Day Delivery can also be arranged.

Passengers.Note:
When self-validating a Carnet, customers should be advised to endorse the date with 2-digit numerical values only, eg. 07 09 for travel on 7th September, using permanent black ink.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

Promotion.Summary: Save 25% with Duo on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. When two adults travel together, the second person receives 50% off.

OfferDetails.Details:
Duo is available on Greater Anglia's routes south of Manningtree/Harwich and Cambridge to London and intermediate stations.

It is not available for journeys wholly within the the Oyster pay as you go area. This area comprises London Travelcard zones 1-6 plus Shenfield, Brentwood, Broxbourne, Cheshunt, Waltham Cross and Theobalds Grove.

You can still buy Duo tickets for journeys to and from stations in the Oyster area as long as one of the stations is outside this area, for example: Ilford to Chelmsford or Bishops Stortford to Cheshunt.

BookingConditions.Details:
• Valid at any time on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays only.
  • Available where Super Off-Peak Day Return fares are offered. The fare charged will be 1.5 times the Super Off-Peak Day Return and will permit two adults to travel.
  • Not available to London Underground destinations.
  • Railcard discounts are not available.
  • Child discounts do not apply.
  • Not available for journeys wholly within the area bounded by London Fare Zones 1-6 plus Theobalds Grove, Waltham Cross, Cheshunt, Broxbourne, Brentwood and Shenfield.
  • Duo cannot be used in conjunction with any other promotion or offer.
  • The two adults must travel together throughout their entire journey.
  • Duo is a day return only ticket.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Duo tickets are available from your local station, by calling Greater Anglia on 0845 600 7245 or online

Promotion.PromotionName: Greater Manchester area - DaySaver TB (Train & Bus)
Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area

OfferDetails.Details:
DaySaver TB (Train & Bus) offers unlimited travel within the designated area.

Valid on all Rail and Bus services within Greater Manchester, also valid on Metrolink tram services within the City Zone only.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Tickets are not valid before 0930 or to join trains timed to depart between 1601 - 1829 Mondays to Fridays, valid all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Day saver tickets are valid until midnight on buses and until 04:00 the next morning on trains, where services exist.

Daysaver TB is valid on all Rail and Bus services within Greater Manchester, also valid on Metrolink services within the City Zone only.

Only available within the area shown on the map.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Daysaver tickets can be purchased at manned stations or from bus drivers.

ChildFares.Details: No child fares or railcard discounts are allowed.

Promotion.PromotionName: Greater Manchester area - DaySaver TBM (Train & Bus & Metrolink tram)
Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area.

OfferDetails.Details:
Daysaver TBM (Train & Bus & Metrolink) offers unlimited travel within the designated area.

Valid on all Rail, Bus and Metrolink services within Greater Manchester.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Tickets are not valid before 0930 or to join trains timed to depart between 1601 - 1829 Mondays to Fridays, valid all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Daysaver tickets are valid until midnight on buses and until 04:00 the next morning on trains/trams, where services exist

Daysaver TBM is valid on all Rail, Bus and Metrolink services within Greater Manchester.

Only available within the area shown on the map.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Daysaver tickets can be purchased at manned stations, from bus drivers or from vending machines at Metrolink stations.

ConcessionFares.Details: No child fares or railcard discounts are allowed.

Promotion.PromotionName: Greater Manchester area - DaySaver TM (Train & Metrolink tram)
Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area.

OfferDetails.Details:
DaySaver TM (Train & Metrolink tram) offers unlimited travel within the designated area.

Valid on local train (standard class) and tram services throughout Greater Manchester.

Please see the Validity rules below that apply.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Tickets are valid from 09:30 Mondays to Fridays, all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. Please note restrictions apply to all local train journeys, irrespective of direction, departing between 16:01 and 18:29, Monday to Friday excluding bank holidays.

Daysaver tickets are valid until 04:00 the next morning on trains/trams, where services exist.

Daysaver TM is valid on all Rail and Metrolink services within Greater Manchester.

Only available within the area shown on the map.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Daysaver tickets can be purchased at manned stations or from vending machines at Metrolink stations.

ConcessionFares.Details: No child fares or railcard discounts are allowed.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area

OfferDetails.Details:
With a Traincard you can save money and travel as many times as you like on journeys anywhere in the Greater Manchester ticketing area.

In addition:

  • Traincard also allows travel to and from Disley, New Mills Newtown and New Mills Central
  • Traincard also gives free travel on Metrolink trams in the city zone

A photo ID card is required from a staffed train station

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: You can buy a Traincard from the ticket office at staffed train stations. If this is closed or the station is un-staffed you can buy weekly Traincards from the conductor on the train. Monthly and annual Traincards are only available from main stations.

AdultFares.Details:
Prices of Traincards are:

  • Weekly  £32.30
  • Monthly  £111.00
  • Annual  £1,050.20

Promotion.Summary: Travel by train, tram and selected buses in the Manchester area and beyond.

OfferDetails.Details:
Travel for a day anywhere in Greater Manchester and in parts of Cheshire, Derbyshire, Lancashire, Staffordshire and the Peak District.

The Wayfarer ticket lets you travel by Metrolink tram or trains and buses run by participating Wayfarer companies.

The Wayfarer ticket lets you travel on any participating bus at any time. You can also travel on Metrolink trams or any train run by a participating company after 9.30am Monday to Friday, and at any time on weekends and bank holidays.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Travel by:

  • Bus at any time
  • Train and tram after 9.30am weekdays, and anytime Saturday, Sunday and bank holidays.

PurchaseDetails.Details: You can buy Wayfarer tickets from staffed railway stations and PayPoint outlets in the area of validity.

ConcessionFares.Details: £9.50 for holders of ENCTS (English National Concessionary Travel Passes for older or disabled people).

GroupFares.Details: £28.80 up to 4 persons, no more than 2 over 15 years of age

Promotion.Summary: Off-Peak travel for 10 or more people across London.

OfferDetails.Details:
A Group Off-Peak Day Travelcard is a paper ticket that allows you, as part of a group of 10 people or more, to travel as much as you like from 09:30 Monday to Friday and anytime on weekends and public holidays across the zones on your Travelcard.

Group Day Travelcards can be used on bus, London Underground, London Trams, Docklands Light Railway and most National Rail services.

You have to be travelling in a group of 10 or more. Group Off-Peak Day Travelcards are available for the following zones:

  • 1-6
  • 1-9

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Must travel in a group of 10 or more at all times
  • Not valid outside London zones 1-6 (1-9)
  • Not valid before 09:30 Monday - Friday

PurchaseDetails.Details: You can only buy Group Travelcards from London Underground and London Overground stations.

Promotion.PromotionName: Group Ticket with Avanti West Coast
Promotion.Summary: Discounts for groups of between three and nine passengers travelling together on the same trains.

OfferDetails.Details: Passengers travelling in groups of between three and nine people can receive a discount. The first two passengers pay the full applicable Advance fare, with the remaining third to eighth passenger receiving a 10% discount off the applicable Advance fare.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
The first two passengers must pay the full applicable Advance fare. The subsequent third to eighth passengers will receive a 10% discount off the applicable Advance fare.

The discount applies to Adult fares only. Children may be included as the third to eighth passenger(s) travelling within the group. However, they will pay 50% of the applicable full Advance fare.

  • Seats must be booked by 23:59 one day before travel.
  • All tickets are non-refundable
  • A change of journey is not permitted
  • Seat reservations are compulsory
  • Travel must be made on the date and service specified
  • Breaks of journey are not permitted

PurchaseDetails.Details: Online only at www.avantiwestcoast.co.uk - subject to availability

Promotion.Summary: Discounts for groups of 10 people or more

OfferDetails.Details: Must be a minimum of 10 people in a group. Discounts from 25% off standard fares. 50% discount on selected services.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: All discounts subject to availability of spare accommodation. 10% discount on First Class. Booking is recommended 4 - 6 weeks prior to date of outward travel. Catering packages available from packed lunches to Champagne break

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from Great Western Railway Group Travel on 0845 741 3777 (0900 to 1700 Mondays to Fridays)

Promotion.Summary: Discounts for groups of 10 people or more

OfferDetails.Details: With so many great places to visit along our route, taking the train for a day out is now even easier and excellent value for money. Minimum of 10 people in a group; 25% off standard fares.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: All discounts subject to availability of spare accommodation.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Call Chiltern Railways Business Travel office on 01494 420117 (Mondays to Fridays, 0930 to 1630), saying where and when you want to travel and how many will be travelling. A price will be given straight away, with the best trains to use. Advance booking is essential to take advantage of this special deal; tickets can only be booked through Chiltern Railways Business Travel office (no need to be travelling on business though!).

Tickets can be collected from the office at Bicester North station or posted to you - please allow 3 working days.

Promotion.PromotionName: Group Travel with Transport for Wales
Promotion.Summary: Discounts for groups of 10 or more people travelling together.

OfferDetails.Details:
Available across the Transport for Wales network. Minimum of 10 and maximum of 30 people in the group. 25% discount off standard fares.

All discounts subject to availability of accommodation and are available solely at Transport for Wales' discretion. Group discounts may not be able to be offered if services are already highly reserved or on days where special events are taking place at locations across the Transport for Wales network.

Key conditions Heart of Wales line services between Swansea and Shrewsbury restricted to a maximum group size of 15 people on weekdays and 20 on weekends.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
All discounts subject to availability of accommodation and are available solely at Transport for Wales' discretion. Group discounts may not be able to be offered if services are already highly reserved or on days where special events are taking place at locations across the Transport for Wales network.

Key conditions Heart of Wales line services between Swansea and Shrewsbury restricted to a maximum group size of 15 people on weekdays and 20 on weekends.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
In order to take advantage of this discount, please purchase as far in advance as possible to ensure availability. Bookings can be made up to 12 weeks before the date of travel.

Please contact 0870 9000 767 - details of your planned journey will be checked against availability on Transport for Wales services and special events taking place around the Transport for Wales network.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Customers should contact the telephone number above to arrange group bookings.

Transport for Wales cannot accept individual customer queries through the Group Travel email address.

Promotion.Summary: Small Group Travelling together?? Great discounts to be had!

OfferDetails.Details: GroupSave offers groups of three to nine adults travelling together 1/3 off, travelling off-peak on participating train company services.

FurtherInformation.Details: terms and conditions.

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• All members of the group must travel together for outward and return journeys.
  • There may be restrictions on when you can travel. Please ask for more details.
  • On Scotrail services, GroupSave is only available between Edinburgh and Glasgow Queen Street, available anytime at weekend and off-peak Monday to Friday. Also available between Motherwell and Edinburgh (both 'Any Permitted' and 'Not Via Glasgow' routes).
  • There are certain days when GroupSave cannot be used on some services. More Information
  • NOT available on Great Western Railway Night Riviera Sleeper services.
  • NOT valid on Great Western Railway London Paddington to Penzance services from London Paddington and intermediate stations to Tiverton Parkway inclusive on Fridays departing at 17:03; 18:03; 19:03. The Groupsave Offer is available for customers joining at Exeter St Davids and beyond.

com:Annotation.com:Note: Cath Lyver, National Rail Product Manager

InternalInfo.Details: All members of the group must travel together for outward and return journeys. There must be at least one adult in the group. Each person in the group is issued with a ticket.

Promotion.Summary: Discounted travel on the The Heart of Wales Line

OfferDetails.Details:
The railcard is valid for journeys between Swansea/Llanelli to Shrewsbury via Llandrindod Wells and is available to residents, aged 16 or over, of selected postcodes along the route of the Heart of Wales Line. The railcard costs £10.00 and is valid for one year     

Discounts available

Adult

The card holder is entitled to 34% discount on Standard Day Return (SDR), Cheap Day Return (CDR)  and Saver Return (SVR) ticket types.

There is no minimum fare on SDR, CDR and SVR ticket types  

Children

Accompanying children may travel for a flat fare of £2.00 and there is no minimum fare

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: There are no time restrictions

PurchaseDetails.Details: The railcard can be purchased at Llandrindod Wells station only

GroupFares.Details: Cardholder and up to two accompanied children under 16 years of age at a flat fare of £2.00

Promotion.Summary: Uno bus link to Hatfield Campus

OfferDetails.Details: This ticket has been replaced by the Hatfield PlusBus ticket; more information can be found on the PlusBus website here.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Only available with a rail ticket.

Promotion.Summary: An annual railcard for Highland residents which entitles holders to 50% off local rail travel

OfferDetails.Details:
The Highland Railcard discount is only available on the following routes:

  • Mallaig / Fort William / Oban to/from Glasgow (direct trains only)
  • Wick / Thurso to/from Inverness
  • Kyle of Lochalsh to/from Inverness

The railcard is available to residents aged 16 or over, permanently living in the following postcode areas:

  • All IV except: IV12, IV30, IV31, IV32, IV36
  • All KW
  • All HS
  • PA20 to PA38, PA41 to PA49, PA60 to PA78
  • PH16, PH17, PH30 to PH44, PH49, PH50
  • FK20, FK21
  • G83 

Discounts available

Adult

The card holder is entitled to 50% discount on the following fares:

  • Anytime Single or Return
  • Anytime Day Single or Return
  • Off Peak Return
  • Off Peak Day Return
  • Season Tickets (Highland Railcard holder only)

Up to two children may travel with the Railcard holder for a flat fare of £2.00 return each.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• The Highland Railcard is valid for 12 months from date of issue.
  • Customers must carry their Highland Railcard with them when travelling.
  • Customers with Highland Railcards must also carry their Photocard to validate their Highland Railcard.
  • No further National Railcard discounts apply.

BookingConditions.Details:
• Refunds are not available on the Railcard
  • Refunds, changes to travel plans and break of journey conditions for tickets bought with a Highland Railcard are as appropriate to the full price ticket

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Paper versions of the Highland Railcard can be purchased from the following stations:

Inverness

Dingwall

Kyle of Lochalsh

Thurso

Wick

Oban

Fort William 

Mallaig 

Or by post to the following address enclosing your application form, proof of residence and payment:

Highland Railcard Applications
Travel Centre
Inverness Railway Station
Station Square
Academy Street
Inverness
IV1 1LE

 

The Highland Railcard can now also be purchased and added to a Smartcard.  For further details see https://www.scotrail.co.uk/tickets/railcards

Promotion.Summary: Saves you 1/3 on most rail fares throughout Great Britain for a whole year.

OfferDetails.Details: PlusBus is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services. When you buy PlusBus with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
For journeys made between 04:30 and 09:59 Monday to Friday, a minimum fare of £12 applies (except in July or August, or on public holidays). This applies to all Anytime, Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak tickets.

There are no minimum fares for all Advance tickets.

Off-Peak Day Travelcard

A minimum fare applies on adult Off-Peak Day Travelcards at all times (including July and August). The minimum fare is £8.00. The minimum fare also applies to a discounted Zones 1-6 'Inboundary' Off-Peak Day Travelcard. Note - Railcard discounts are not available on any other zonal combinations of Day Travelcards.

Anytime Day Travelcard

Railcard discounts are available on Anytime Day Travelcards from stations outside the London Fare Zones 1-9 area. These are subject to the normal rules applicable to the Railcard, but in addition an adult minimum fare also applies at all times (including July and August). The minimum fare is currently £17.20.
No discounts are available on Anytime Day Travelcards issued for journeys wholly within Zones 1-9.

The Railcard is not valid:

  • For regular travel to place of employment, duty or education.
  • On any shipping or ferry services (except to/from the Isle of Wight).
  • On London underground services except for Zones 1-6 Off Peak day Travelcards and through train journeys across London on tickets routed 'Via London'.

BookingConditions.Details:
Tickets for your journey should be purchased before boarding the train. You must have your Railcard (and Photocard/Permit to travel without Photocard if applicable) with you on your journey and always show the valid Railcard and ticket to rail staff at their request. If you do not show both the Railcard and the ticket, you will be required to pay the full price Standard Single fare for your journey as if no ticket was purchased before starting the journey. In some cases a penalty fare may be payable. This does not apply if there was no ticket office at the station at which you began your journey or if the ticket office was closed and there was no ticket machine from which you could buy a discounted ticket.

Minimum fares and time restrictions apply as detailed here.

In the case of some low price tickets the actual discount with a Railcard may be slightly lower than that advertised.

The right is reserved to revise these Conditions and availability of the tickets mentioned here. The Train Companies will endeavour to give three months' notice of any changes before they are due to come into effect.

Tickets issued to the holder of the Railcard are issued subject to the National Rail Conditions of Travel and the Conditions listed here.

Copies of the National Rail Conditions of Travel are available from any staffed station ticket office or online at http://www.nationalrail.co.uk/nrcot

PurchaseDetails.Details:
To apply for your Railcard please see your Unit HR admin staff.

HM Forces Railcards cannot be purchased at National Rail stations.

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Railcards section simply select the number and type of Railcards that you will be travelling with and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Railcard!

com:Annotation.com:Note: Cath Lyver, National Rail Product Manager

OfferDetails.Details: A special ticket, this ticket offers through travel from Shanklin, Lake, Sandown, Brading and Ryde St Johns Rd Stations to Portsmouth and Southsea via Hovertravel's Hovercraft service.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.PromotionName: Hull City Council - Disability Rail Card
Promotion.Summary: A Disability Rail Card for residents of the Hull City Council area

The Card enables the holder to travel free of charge within the East Riding and to Scarborough and York (not valid via Leeds or Doncaster) on Northern Rail Services Only.

The Hull City Council Disability Rail Card is issued via Hull City Council not Northern Rail.

Any enquires regarding the issue of the Hull City Council - Disability Rail Card should be directed to the Hull City Council helpline which is 01482 300 300.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: The Pass is valid for travel for trains timed to depart from 09:30hrs Monday to Friday and all day weekends and Bank Holidays.

Promotion.Summary: Discount tickets

OfferDetails.Details: The Business Carnet is a sheet of ten discounted Standard Class or First Class Anytime or Off-Peak Single tickets.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: These tickets are only available for travel on Hull Trains. Seat Reservations are not required. Refunds are only available on complete unused sheets of ten tickets Railcards can not be used in conjunction with this offer. The Business Carnet is self-validated, anyone in the company can use them. This avoids the hassle of booking and collecting tickets at the station.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from the Hull Trains Business Travel Service on 01482 215 746

Passengers.Note:
When self-validating a Carnet, customers should be advised to endorse the date with 2-digit numerical values only, eg. 07 09 for travel on 7th September, using permanent black ink.

The ticket will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see
