Promotion.Summary: Unlimited travel for one day on the Island Line and Steam Railway

OfferDetails.Details:
A combined through ticket allows travel to the Isle of Wight via Portsmouth/Ryde with Wightlink and unlimited travel on the Island Line and Steam Railway. Also included is bus transfer to / from the station and admission

The interchange station for the Isle of Wight Steam Railway is Smallbrook Junction.

NOTE: Island Line Trains only call at Smallbrook Junction on "Steam" Days. There are no regular services during the winter months.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Through tickets are available from most staffed railway stations in London and the South East. Just ask for the "Isle of Wight Steam Day Rover" ticket at your local station.

InternalInfo.Details:
Ticketing

Destination name & NLC: IoW Steam DY RVR K048

ConcessionFares.Details: Railcard discounts are not available on the Isle of Wight Steam railway – passengers to be booked to Smallbrook Junction and advised to rebook, allowing one return journey on the Isle of Wight Steam Railway and the Island Line trains. Alternatively, they may rebook at Ryde Esplanade and purchase an "Island Liner" which would allow unlimited travel on both lines.

Promotion.PromotionName: Isles of Scilly Train and Ferry/Helicopter Package
Promotion.Summary: All in one ferry and helicopter package

OfferDetails.Details:
• First Class train travel (not available for Standard)
  • Helicopter/ ferry transfer to St Marys/Tresco Islands
  • Transfer between Penzance station and the heliport and transfers to/from St Marys/Tresco Heliport are not included.

Available from London Paddington, Reading, Swindon, Bath, Pewsey, Westbury, Castle Cary, Bristol Temple Meads, Taunton, Exeter St Davids and Plymouth.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
• Early booking is recommended. Please allow at least 7 full working days for the delivery of your tickets. 
  • These packages are only available on Great Western Railway services from the stations listed above. 
  • With the helicopter packages return transfer between Penzance Station and the heliport is available. 
  • On the ferry package a transfer from Penzance Station to the Scillonian is included, return transfer is not available. 
  • Accommodation and transfer beyond the heliport or ferry quayside on St Mary's or Tresco is not included.
  • It is recommended that you check accommodation availability before booking this package 
  •  Helicopter and ferry services do not operate on Sundays
  • Payment should be made by credit or debit card at the time of booking
  • our normal refund policies apply.
  • No other reduced fare offer can be used in conjunction with these packages. No further Railcard discounts apply.
  • Great Western Railway, British International and the Isles of Scilly Steam Ship Group terms and conditions apply.

To make your booking, or obtain further details, call 08457 000 125 quoting 'The Isles of Scilly package'.

InternalInfo.Details: This package will only be retailed by Great Western Railway Telesales. Should booking office staff receive any enquiries on this package then they should contact Great Western Railway Telesales in order to make the booking.

Step back in time and enjoy a train ride through the heart of Brontë country, an add-on ticket entitles the holder to a day's unlimited travel on the Keighley & Worth Valley Railway between Keighley, Haworth & Oxenhope.

On some special events, tickets may be only valid for one round trip.  Please check http://www.kwvr.co.uk for further details.

Promotion.PromotionName: Kids for a quid promotion - Southeastern
Promotion.Summary: Kids for a Quid with Southeastern

OfferDetails.Details:
This ticket is specific to Southeastern and is a permanent fare on Southeastern services only.

Kids travel for £1 each when accompanied by an adult with a valid ticket.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
When and where the ticket can be used

 

  • Up to four children can travel with each adult ticket holder
  • Valid for travel on Southeastern services only
  • Not valid for journeys wholly within the London Zones 1-8 area
  • Valid for off-peak travel only. No restrictions at weekends and public holidays
  • Not valid in first class
  • Unaccompanied children must pay the normal child fare, which is 50% of the adult fare

Conditions of use 

  • You must travel in the class of accommodation shown on your ticket.
  • The outward part of an Off-Peak Return ticket is only valid for travel when accompanied by an unused return part of the same ticket.
  • This offer is not valid with all promotional fares. This will be specified separately for each promotion.

Break of journey

Break of journey is allowed on Off-Peak tickets unless restricted for the journey you are making. If you intend to break your journey, please call 03457 48 49 50 to check if it is available on your specific journey.

If you break your journey and are still travelling at 02:30 then you may stay on the train to complete that part of the journey, but no further break of journey is allowed and all travel must be completed by 12:00.

Changing the time or date of travel

If you wish to change your time of travel or class of the ticket, you can pay the difference between the cost of the ticket held and the cost of the ticket that is most appropriate for the journey you need to make.

In many cases, if you are still travelling at a time when your ticket is not restricted, no additional fare is payable.

If you wish to change the date of travel, or the origin or destination of your ticket, it may be necessary to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your existing ticket (see below).

Refunds 

Your ticket is refundable.

If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can get a refund by returning your unused ticket to the ticket office or place of purchase (for tickets bought via websites, telesales or travel agents) within 28 days of the ticket expiry date. You may be required to pay an administration fee.

The refund amount will normally take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• Tickets can be bought in advance or immediately before travel
  • Tickets can be purchased at Southeastern website, ticket offices or on trains
  • Tickets are not available from ticket machines

ChildFares.Details: Up to 4 kids travel for £1 each when accompanied by an adult with a valid ticket

ConcessionFares.Details: Railcard discounts do not apply.

Leave the car at home on match days and catch a train from your local station to Swansea. Dedicated buses operated by First Cymru will run to and from the Liberty Stadium for Swansea City football, and also Osprey rugby matches.

Promotion.Summary: As buses are now cash free, the London One Day Bus & Tram Pass has been introduced as a solution for people who will only be travelling for one day on buses and trams and who do not already hold an Oyster card or contactless payment card.

A One Day Bus & Tram Pass allows:


•    Unlimited travel for £5 on buses and trams only
•    Travel on a single day and up to 0429 the following day


The One Day Bus & Tram Pass can be issued by all National Rail stations.


•    Adult rate only, no further discounts are available
•    Refunds or changes are only permitted provided the ticket is surrendered before the date of validity.
•    Ticket is for bus and tram travel only and is not valid for any travel whatsoever on any train services (not valid on National Rail, London Overground, London Underground, DLR)

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Select destination: H811 - London Bus&Tram

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated zones

OfferDetails.Details:
Railpass tickets are season tickets for regular travel on trains throughout Merseyside.

The area is split into a number of zones, so a Railpass ticket is sold for the specific zones through which the regular journey is taken. With the exception of the annual off-peak Ticket, Railpass tickets (except term-time tickets) are valid for travel at any time of the day and on any day of the week for an unlimited number of journeys within the zones and expiry date on the ticket.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Railpass term-time tickets are valid Monday to Friday, until 20:00 during term time only.

PurchaseDetails.Details: All stations sell weekly and monthly tickets, but only some sell annual and term-time tickets. Go to the Merseytravel website at http://www.merseytravel.gov.uk/ or ring Traveline on 0871 200 22 33 to check.

Promotion.Summary: Saveaways are cheap, one day tickets that you can use for unlimited travel on buses, trains and ferries in Merseyside at off peak times.

  • Area A
  • Area B
  • Area C

All Area Saveaways are also valid in Areas F and G.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated zones

OfferDetails.Details:
Trio tickets are season tickets for regular travel on trains, buses and ferries throughout Merseyside.

The area is split into a number of zones, so a Trio ticket is sold for the specific zones through which the regular journey is taken. With the exception of the annual off-peak ticket, Trio tickets are valid for travel at any time of the day and on any day of the week for an unlimited number of journeys within the zones and expiry date on the ticket.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
How long are tickets valid for?

You can buy a Trio ticket for a week, a month, a year or a term. There is also an annual off-peak, all zones ticket. You can buy young person's tickets for a week or a term.

  • You can use weekly, monthly and annual tickets at any time on any day.
  • You can use an annual off-peak, all zones ticket from Monday to Friday at any time (except for journeys starting between 06:31 and 09:29 and between 16:01 and 17:59) and all day Saturday, Sunday and Bank Holidays.
  • You can use term-time tickets on Monday to Friday until 20:00 during term-time only. You must be in full-time education, training or work-based learning.

Which zone or area do I need?

Please take a look at the map, as Merseyside is split into four areas:

  • Liverpool (Green)
  • Sefton (Red)
  • St Helens (Brown)
  • Wirral (Blue)

Check which zone your journey starts in and which zone it ends in.

Make a note of the zones you travel through.

You can use your Trio ticket on any buses, trains or Mersey Ferries in your chosen area.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• From any Merseytravel Centres
  • From any staffed Merseyrail station (Annual and term-time tickets are only available from selected stations)
  • From any main Post Office
  • From the Ticket Unit at 24 Hatton Garden, Liverpool, L3 2AN (Term-time tickets can be applied for by post)

Promotion.PromotionName: Money Back Guarantee with Govia Thameslink Railway
Promotion.Summary: If you cannot travel you can get your money back.

OfferDetails.Details:
When you book with us online, you can get a full refund on most tickets if you decide not to travel as long as you select the 'collect from station' option.

The Money Back Guarantee covers all Anytime, Anytime Day, Off-Peak, Off-Peak Day and Super Off-Peak Day tickets, which means that if you can't travel you can get your money back.

More information is available on our websites:

  • Gatwick Express click here
  • Great Northern click here
  • Southern click here
  • Thameslink click here

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
The Money Back Guarantee covers all Anytime, Anytime Day, Off-Peak, Off-Peak Day and Super Off-Peak Day tickets, which means that if you can't travel you can get your money back. 

More information is available on our websites:

  • Gatwick Express 
  • Great Northern
  • Southern
  • Thameslink

BookingConditions.Details:
For the terms and conditions, see the Money Back Guarantee page on our websites:

  • Gatwick Express
  • Great Northern
  • Southern
  • Thameslink

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• Book your Anytime, Anytime Day, Off-Peak, Off-Peak Day or Super Off-Peak Day tickets from one of our websites.
  • Choose to pick up your tickets at the station on the day you plan to travel by selecting “Ticket on Departure” during the booking process on our website
  • If you can't travel and require your money back, do not collect your tickets, but log in to 'Your Account' and view the relevant booking. Click the 'Refund' button, fill in all the required fields and submit the form.  Then print off the form and send it to the address shown.
  • The full price of your ticket will then be refunded.
  • If you wish to book tickets for multiple trips in a single transaction online, we advise that you book the tickets you need for each trip in separate transactions to ensure the Money Back Guarantee applies.

Promotion.PromotionName: Mums-to-be First Class Upgrade - East Midlands Railway
Promotion.Summary: Complimentary upgrade for expectant mothers

OfferDetails.Details:
Customers who hold Standard Class Season Ticket valid for any period between one month and a year can apply for a complimentary pass which allows an upgrade to First Class accommodation if no Standard Class seats are available.

To be eligible for the Mums 2B upgrade pass, the following are required:

  1. A copy of a MAT B1 form
  2. A copy of a current season ticket
  3. Name
  4. Home Address
  5. Season Ticket number
  6. Photocard number
  7. Season Ticket expiry date
  8. Daytime telephone number

This above information should be sent to:

Customer service Centre,

Prospect House -

1 Prospect Place
Millennium Way, Pride Park
Derby

Derbyshire
DE24 8HG

Email address getintouch@eastmidlandsrailway.co.uk 

Tel: 08457 125 678

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.PromotionName: Mums-to-be First Class Upgrade - Greater Anglia
Promotion.Summary: Free First Class upgrade for Mums-to-be

OfferDetails.Details:
To make life a little easier towards the end of your pregnancy, Greater Anglia offers a free First Class upgrade for Standard Class ticket holders in your last eight weeks of pregnancy before maternity leave. 

If you are pregnant and in your last eight weeks of pregnancy before maternity leave, you may apply for an authority to travel which will allow you to sit in a First Class seat if there are no seats available in Standard Class.

To obtain this authority you must be in possession of a season ticket Photocard.  If you do not hold a season ticket or have a Photocard, please take a recent passport size/style photograph to any of our ticket offices.  A Photocard will be created for you free of charge.

Apply in writing:

Freepost RSCZ-UXZJ-EHHE
Greater Anglia
Customer Relations
Station Approach
Norwich NR1 1EG

Please include the following information:

  • Your Photocard number
  • The journey details (origin and destination)
  • A letter from your employer confirming your last date of travel before maternity leave.  If you do not work a letter from your GP will be required.

We will send you an authority to travel in First Class accommodation valid until the last day of travel before your maternity leave is due to start.  You must show this authority, your train ticket and your Photocard during any ticket check on the train.

We offer this help for the last eight weeks of travel before maternity leave. We do not offer any alternatives, or extend the validity of the upgrade beyond eight weeks.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
* This offer is only available on services where first class accommodation is available.  On services where there is no first class accommodation we will endeavour to help you find a seat in Standard Class where there is a conductor on the service.

**  You must have prior authority before travelling otherwise you may be charged accordingly.

Promotion.Summary: Free entry. Get up close to over 300 years of fascinating railway history in York's only National Museum.

OfferDetails.Details:
For a fantastic day out for the whole family in York, visit the award winning National Railway Museum.

Free entry.

Get up close to over 300 years of fascinating history in York's only National Museum. Explore our giant halls full of trains and railway legends including the majestic Duchess of Hamilton, step on to the futuristic, Japanese Bullet Train or marvel at the stunning opulence of the Royal Trains. Get on board awe inspiring locomotives, watch our engineers at work in The Workshop, uncover hidden treasures in The Warehouse and make tracks to the outdoor area.

The children can let off steam with our outdoor play area, miniature railway rides and loads of interactive exhibits. Every weekend and throughout the school holidays, the kids can enjoy a lively programme of events, including science shows, story telling, steam rides, craft activities and special events too.

Check the website to plan your visit. Free entry to the museum.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Free entry.

Opening times: Daily 10.00 - 18.00.

Closed 24, 25 and 26 December.

Promotion.Summary: You can buy a Network Railcard for only £30 and save 1/3 off most rail fares for journeys in the Network Railcard area.

OfferDetails.Details:
PlusBus is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services. When you buy PlusBus with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.

Please visit the Network Railcard website for more information or click here to buy now.

AreaMap.Details: Network Railcard area

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
A Network Railcard gives discounts on the following services in the Network Railcard area:

Rail

  • Anytime tickets
  • Off-Peak tickets
  • Off-Peak Day Travelcards (Zones 1-6)
  • Anytime Day Travelcard (when bought as part of your ticket to London from outside London Zones 1-6)

PlusBus

Save on inclusive train and bus 'PlusBus' tickets - See www.PlusBus.info for details

Isle of Wight

Discounts on journeys from any National Rail station within the Network Railcard area to the Isle of Wight, on Wightlink* or Red Funnel* (ferries or 'Red Jet') services to Ryde, Cowes or any National Rail station to Shanklin.

Discounts on journeys from any National Rail station within the Network Railcard area to Ryde Hoverport* only, via Hovertravel services.

*Railcards do not secure discounts on port to port only tickets.

Please Note:

  • Some tickets may have conditions or restrictions that will apply, such as time restrictions for return travel from central London
  • Not every ticket type is available for every journey that you may wish to make
  • Minimum fares apply for all journeys Monday to Friday

Time Restrictions & Minimum Fares

  • Network Railcard is not valid between 04:30 and 09:59 Monday to Friday and no discount will be applied on journeys to start between those times, unless easements apply to your journey. Check the list of easements here
  • Discounted adult fares are subject to a £13.00 minimum fare, Monday to Friday, except Public Holidays. The minimum fare does not apply at weekends
  • Discounted child fares are subject to a £1.00 minimum fare at all times
  • Anytime Day Travelcards are subject to a minimum fare of £18.10 and London Area Zones 1 - 6 Off-Peak Day Travelcards are subject to a £7.90 minimum fare on weekends and public holidays
  • Minimum fares apply to each individual travelling, not to the total value of tickets purchased

BookingConditions.Details: Terms and Conditions of use of the Network Railcard

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You can buy your Railcard at network-railcard.co.uk or application forms are available at your local staffed National Rail station in the Network Railcard area. 

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Railcards section simply select the number and type of Railcards that you will be travelling with and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Railcard!

com:Annotation.com:Note: Cath Lyver, National Rail Product Manager

Promotion.Summary: Promotional Day Ranger or Weekend Ranger price with tokens from local newspapers

OfferDetails.Details:
To qualify for this special offer, customers must collect 2 tokens from local newspapers on participating dates, complete the correct on-line form, download and print the form and buy tickets from any staffed ticket office.

Three tokens allow you to buy up to 4 Northern only Day Ranger tickets or Weekend Rover tickets which must all be used on the same day or weekend (depending on the ticket chosen).

Travel is available between Monday 06 May - Sunday 14 July 2019.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Three tokens allow you to buy up to FOUR Northern only Day Ranger tickets or Weekend Rover tickets which must all be used on the same day or weekend (depending on the ticket chosen).

Tickets must be purchased at staffed Northern ticket offices or contact the Customer Experience Centre

Passengers.Note:
Terms & Conditions

  1. Tickets are available for sale from Monday 6 May 2019 until Sunday 14 July 2019 (for One Day Ranger tickets) and Saturday 11 May - Saturday 13 July 2019 (for Weekend Rover tickets). Tickets can be purchased up to three days in advance of travel.
  2. Travel is available from Monday 6 May - 14 July 2019. One day tickets are available every day for the duration of this offer. Weekend tickets are available each Saturday and Sunday between Saturday 11 May - Saturday 13 July 2019.
  3. Time restrictions: only valid on trains timed to depart after 0845 Mondays to Fridays. Valid at any time weekends and Bank Holidays.
  4. 3 tokens allow you to buy up to 4 Northern Day Ranger or 4 Weekend Rover tickets.
  5. Price: Day Ranger - adult £10.00 each / child £5.00 each for one day ticket OR Weekend Ranger - £17.50 each / child £8.75 each for one weekend ticket - no further discounts available. *Children 5-15 years inclusive.
  6. Valid on trains operated by Northern only. This offer is not valid for travel on Transport for Wales, CrossCountry, LNER, East Midlands Trains, Hull Trains, TransPennine Express, Grand Central, London Northwestern Railway, Merseyrail, Virgin Trains or West Midlands Railway services.
  7. Affix three tokens from participating newspapers to the application form and take to any staffed station within the Northern network. The tickets for this offer cannot be purchased on trains.
  8. Completed application forms are valid to purchase up to four Northern Day Ranger or Weekend Rover tickets (must include a minimum one adult ticket) for the same day/weekend of travel. Photocopies of tokens and application forms are not accepted.
  9. Postcode details will be shared with JPIMedia. If you opted in for marketing from Northern and JPIMedia during registration, your details will be passed to JPIMedia, 2 Cavendish Square, London, W1G 0PU.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area.

OfferDetails.Details: PlusBus is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services. When you buy PlusBus with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
How do I work out the number of zones I'm travelling in?
The map attached shows Tyne and Wear divided into just 3 zones - yellow, green and grey.
If your journey is entirely within just one zone (yellow, green OR grey) - you only need a 1 zone Transfare (T1 on Metro).
If you are travelling in the yellow AND the green zones or the green AND the grey zones - you need a 2 zone Transfare (T2 on Metro).
And if you are travelling in the yellow, green AND grey zones you need a 3 zone Transfare (T3 on Metro).

What if I start my journey on a zone boundary?
Bus stops and Metro stations on boundaries are in both zones.
For example, if you travel from Felling to Windy Nook via Heworth your whole journey is in the green zone so you need a one zone Transfare (T1 on Metro). Similarly if you travel from Felling to the Freeman Hospital via Monument your journey is entirely in the yellow zone so you need a one zone Transfare (T1 on Metro).

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Tickets can be purchased:

  • Choose the appropriate zone from T1 to T3 on the Metro ticket machine
  • on the bus
  • on the ferry

Promotion.Summary: The Duo gives you one return train ticket, plus a second for half the price when two adults travel together on selected routes.

OfferDetails.Details:
Two adults will only pay half the price on their second ticket when travelling together.

The routes where this ticket is available and conditions per route can be found on the Northern website.

Please note, if a ticket is routed 'Northern only' it cannot be used on any other participating operators services.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
You can travel across many routes on the Northern network with a Duo.

In general, tickets are valid from 09:30 on Mondays to Fridays; with some valid from 08:30 or 09:00 on certain routes.

Duo tickets are valid at anytime at weekends and Bank Holidays.

Duo's are valid for a break of journey on both the outward and the return portion of the tickets.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You can purchase a Duo ticket online or from ticket offices at any staffed train station.

If two adults are travelling together you will automatically be offered a ticket when buying online.

At a staffed station, or on a train, you should ask for a Duo ticket and the staff at the ticket office or on-train conductor will provide a ticket to your chosen destination if available. The Duo offers a full price return ticket and the second adult return ticket at half price when two adults travel together and return the same day on selected routes.

Promotion.Summary: London Sightseeing

OfferDetails.Details:
Experience the best of London aboard the Original Tour's famous red open-top buses.

London's most popular sightseeing tour offers its guests the ultimate introduction to the City and includes:

  • entertaining, English-speaking guides, 
  • an unrivalled fleet of superb modern buses, 
  • 3 tour routes, 2 of which offer full multilingual commentary, 
  • 3 fascinating free walking tours, 
  • a fantastic free Thames Hop-on Hop-off river cruise pass, and 
  • an exclusive Kids' Club.

All hop-on hop-off tickets are valid for 24-hours across over 80 conveniently located stops - see The Original Tour map for details.  

For more information see www.theoriginaltour.com

FurtherInformation.Details:

Please see https://www.theoriginaltour.com/news/service-update/ for latest details.

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Tickets are valid for 24 hours from the moment customers first board the bus, regardless of when they purchased the ticket.

The ticket provides unlimited travel on all Original Tour routes (within 24 hours) and provides the ability to hop on and off the buses at any authorised stop.

A free Thames Cruise Pass (worth £13) and Walking Tours (worth £14) are also included in the price and are valid for 24 hours.

FurtherInformation.Details: For full details, including maps and PlusBus fares, visit: PlusBus.info

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
PlusBus tickets can be used for unlimited bus travel on participating bus operators' services within a designated zone.

For details of where the PlusBus ticket can be used for Altrincham please refer to the map provided

PurchaseDetails.Details: Ask for PlusBus when buying your train tickets at a station booking office. PlusBus day tickets can also be purchased online from most retailers and some self-service ticket machines.

PLUSBUS is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services.

When you buy PLUSBUS with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.

PLUSBUS is available around many towns and cities across Britain.

This PLUSBUS ticket is available to and from Burgess Hill.

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
PLUSBUS tickets can be used for unlimited bus travel on participating bus operators' services within a designated zone.

For details of where the PLUSBUS ticket can be used for Burgess Hill please refer to the map provided.

BookingConditions.Details:
Unlimited travel on the following participating bus operator(s): Metrobus, Compass Travel

Excluded services of participating operator(s): None

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Ask for Burgess Hill PLUSBUS when buying your train tickets. PLUSBUS day tickets can also be purchased online from some retailers.

If you are buying a period return rail ticket, you will need to specify the date of your return journey.

Promotion.PromotionName: PlusBus - Dorridge, Longbridge, Rowley Regis, Smethwick & The Hawthorns
Promotion.Summary: PLUSBUS adds bus travel around Dorridge, Longbridge, Rowley Regis, Smethwick and The Hawthorns to your train ticket

OfferDetails.Details:
PLUSBUS is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services. When you buy PLUSBUS with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.

PLUSBUS is available around many towns and cities across Britain.

This PLUSBUS ticket is available to and from Dorridge, Longbridge, Rowley Regis, Smethwick and The Hawthorns.

FurtherInformation.Details:
PLUSBUS tickets can be used for unlimited bus travel on participating bus operators' services within a designated zone.

For details of where the PLUSBUS ticket can be used for Dorridge, Longbridge, Rowley Regis, Smethwick and The Hawthorns please refer to the map provided.

BookingConditions.Details:
Unlimited travel on the following participating bus operator(s): Arriva Midlands, Central Buses, Claribels, Diamond, Hansons, iGO, Johnsons of Henley, National Express Coventry, Midland Metro (National Express), National Express West Midlands, Travel West Midlands, Stagecoach Midlands, Travel De Courcey

Excluded services of participating operator(s): none

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Ask for Dorridge, Longbridge, Rowley Regis, Smethwick and The Hawthorns PLUSBUS when buying your train tickets.

PLUSBUS day tickets can also be purchased online from some retailers.

If you are buying a period return rail ticket, you will need to specify the date of your return journey.

Promotion.Summary:
The Fort William PlusBus scheme has been temporarily suspended, due to recent changes to the bus companies operating local routes in and around the Fort William area.

You are advised NOT to buy a Fort William PlusBus ticket at present (July 2018), as it will not be valid for bus travel. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused. We hope to have this situation resolved shortly.

If you have bought a Fort William PlusBus ticket and need a refund, please email: feedback@PlusBus.info

BookingConditions.Details:
Unlimited travel on the following participating bus operator(s): Kinch Bus, TrentBarton, Centrebus.

Excluded services of participating operator(s): none

Ask for Loughborough PLUSBUS when buying your train tickets.

PLUSBUS day tickets can also be purchased online from some retailers.

If you are buying a period return rail ticket, you will need to specify the date of your return journey.

Promotion.Summary: PLUSBUS adds bus travel around Oxford Parkway to your train ticket

OfferDetails.Details:
PLUSBUS is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services. When you buy PLUSBUS with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.  

PLUSBUS is available around many towns and cities across Britain.

This PLUSBUS ticket is available to and from Oxford, Oxford Parkway, and includes Cumnor, Kennington & Kidlington.

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
PLUSBUS tickets can be used for unlimited bus travel on participating bus operators' services within a designated zone.

For details of where the PLUSBUS ticket can be used for Oxford Parkway please refer to the map provided.

BookingConditions.Details:
Unlimited travel on these participating bus operators: Oxford Bus Company, Stagecoach, Thames Travel, Arriva.

Excluded services (of participating operators): none

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Ask for Oxford Parkway PLUSBUS when buying your train tickets.

PLUSBUS day tickets can also be purchased online from some retailers.

If you are buying a period return rail ticket, you will need to specify the date of your return journey.

Promotion.Summary: PLUSBUS adds bus travel around Stoke-on-Trent to your train ticket

OfferDetails.Details:
PLUSBUS is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services. When you buy PLUSBUS with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.  
        
PLUSBUS is available around many towns and cities across Britain.

This PLUSBUS ticket is available to and from Stoke-on-Trent

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
PLUSBUS tickets can be used for unlimited bus travel on participating bus operators' services within a designated zone.

For details of where the PLUSBUS ticket can be used for Stoke-on-Trent please refer to the map provided.

BookingConditions.Details:
Unlimited travel on the following participating bus operator(s): Arriva North West, Arriva Midlands, D& G Coach & Bus, First Potteries, Scraggs Taxis and Coaches.

Excluded services of participating operator(s): none

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Ask for a Stoke-on-Trent PLUSBUS when buying your train tickets.

PLUSBUS day tickets can also be purchased online from some retailers.

If you are buying a period return rail ticket, you will need to specify the date of your return journey.

Promotion.Summary: Discounted admission ticket when you travel by train

OfferDetails.Details: For more information on the Portsmouth Historic Dockyard and what there is to see and do, including opening dates and times, visit www.historicdockyard.co.uk or call the 24-hour information line  023 9283 9766 (Opt. 1)

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You can get your Joint Ticket from any staffed train station or from South Western Railway Customer Service Centre. Just ask about the Joint Ticket and enjoy the savings.

Tickets may be purchased in advance or on the day of travel.

If you arrive at Portsmouth Historic Dockyard with rail only tickets, you will need to pay the full public admission price.

Please note that these admission tickets cannot be treated as Gift Aid donations.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Admission tickets will appear in TIS, except on dates when the Dockyard is closed to the public.

Tickets should be issued as:

Origin: Portsmouth Hbr (PMH)

Destination: Ports Hist Dck (J183)

ChildFares.Details:
£11.55 (train fare not included)

Children under 5 enter free.

ConcessionFares.Details:
Senior: £22.05 (aged 60 or older with proof - e.g. Senior Railcard or Concessionary Bus Pass)

Student: £22.05 (e.g.16-25 Railcard, NUS/ISIC cardholders)

Promotion.PromotionName: Priority Card - Great Northern and Thameslink
Promotion.Summary: All Great Northern and Thameslink trains have specially designated priority seats available to customers that have a greater need to sit down (defined as people with disabilities, expectant mothers, elderly passengers and those carrying infants) than other customers. Priority seats can be used by anyone, but should be given up to holders of the Priority Card

OfferDetails.Details:
Any person who cannot stand safely for their journey and are elderly, pregnant, or have a disability can apply for a Priority Card

Successful applicants will be issued with a Priority Seating Card which can be shown to fellow passengers who are sitting in a priority seat. This will indicate that this passenger has been recognised by Great Northern or Thameslink as needing a priority seat. Card Holders will present their priority seat card and ask the person seated to give up their seat. However, consideration should also be given to their needs.

The Priority card does not guarantee a seat. Priority seats may already be occupied by other card holders or passengers with a similar need for a seat.

To travel in First Class accommodation you must have a valid First Class ticket. A Priority Seat card does not authorise you to sit in First Class.  Priority seats in First Class Accommodation are for First Class ticket holders.  

Renewal of cards is at the operators discretion but in general, cards will expire on a given date. For guidance, cards issued to pregnant ladies will expire two weeks after their due date. Applications for people with a temporary disability will expire two weeks after the expected date of recovery. 

In order to qualify for the scheme you must be able to provide one of the following documents:

Copy of doctors note; Proof of Attendance Allowance; Proof of Disability Living Allowance; Proof of receipt of incapacity benefit; A letter from the Department of Work and Pensions; Copy of your certificate of Visual Impairment; Copy of your DB8 certificate; Copy of MATBI or Written confirmation of pregnancy

This information together with application should be sent to: FREEPOST RRBR-REEJ-KTKY, Great Northern and Thameslink Assisted Travel Service, PO Box 443 PLYMOUTH, PL4 6WP.

For more details and application form see this link

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.PromotionName: Rail & Sail to Belfast and Ireland
Promotion.Summary: All in one ticket to Belfast and Ireland via Cairnryan

OfferDetails.Details:
This ticket offers an all in one ticket for rail (from any Scottish station), coach link (between Ayr and Cairnryan) and ferry travel to Belfast (via Cairnryan) with STENA Line.

Please note:

  • You'll need to book in advance, and travel on the date shown on your ticket.
  • Pets are not permitted on coach links to Cairnryan, and
  • travel is subject to availability based on ferry capacity.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Outward rail travel is valid for rail travel on the date shown on the ticket
  • Rail & Sail Anytime Single tickets are only valid for the ferry crossing shown on the ticket and are subject to availability based on ferry capacity

BookingConditions.Details: **Pets are not allowed on coach links to Cairnryan **

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• Online at www.scotrail.co.uk
  • Available for sale at Stena Line telesales on 08705 455 455
  • ScotRail Telesales on 0344 811 0141 
  • At mainline stations
  • Rail appointed travel agents

ChildFares.Details: 50% discount for children aged 5-15, under 5's travel free

ConcessionFares.Details: Holders of 16-25, Senior and Disabled Persons Railcards 34% discount off adult fare

Promotion.PromotionName: Rail & Sail to the Clyde Coast
Promotion.Summary: All in one ticket to the Clyde Coast

OfferDetails.Details:
This ticket offers an all in one ticket for rail and ferry travel from any station in Scotland to the destinations of Dunoon, Rothesay, Brodick, Campbeltown and Cumbrae with Caledonian MacBrayne ferries.  

Please note that Caledonian MacBrayne ferry services to and from Campbeltown do not operate all year round.

FurtherInformation.Details:
For further information visit:

www.scotrail.co.uk/travelconnections

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Availability

Standard Class travel from any station in Scotland to and from the following destinations:

  • Dunoon (Cowal) via Gourock
  • Rothesay (Bute) via Wemyss Bay
  • Brodick (Arran) via Ardrossan Harbour
  • Campbeltown via Ardrossan Harbour
  • Cumbrae via Largs

Travel Validity

Normal validity and restrictions apply to rail portion of the journey - see:
www.nationalrail.co.uk/times_fares/ticket_types.aspx

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• ScotRail Telesales on 0344 811 0141
  • Online at www.scotrail.co.uk (except Campbeltown) 
  • At a staffed station
  • On-train when boarding at a station where no booking facilities are available

Promotion.PromotionName: Rail & Sail to the Northern Isles
Promotion.Summary: All in one ticket to the Northern Isles

OfferDetails.Details: This ticket offers an all in one ticket for rail and ferry travel from any station in Scotland to the islands of Orkney and Shetland with Northlink Ferries

FurtherInformation.Details:

Promotion.Summary:
If you would like to travel by tram and train for up to a month around South Yorkshire, RailMaster may be the best option for you.

This ticket gives you unlimited travel for one calendar month on the South Yorkshire rail network.

OfferDetails.Details: RailMaster gives you unlimited rail travel between all South Yorkshire stations and on the Supertram network.  Also valid on the Tram Train service.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
RailMaster is available from all staffed National Rail stations in the county.

RailMasters are only available with photocards, so please bring along a passport size photograph when you buy one. 

Please note: Refund enquiries should be directed to Northern.

PurchaseDetails.Details: At any staffed National Rail station in South Yorkshire

Promotion.Summary: Through ticket to Ravenglass & Eskdale Railway.

OfferDetails.Details:
This through ticket combines the benefit of travelling by Northern along the scenic Furness and Cumbrian Coast lines to Ravenglass and a day return on the Ravenglass & Eskdale Railway.

The 'add-on' fares below are only available with Anytime Day Return or Off Peak Day Return tickets to Ravenglass. They are NOT valid with any Single tickets or Advance tickets.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Where no through fares exists - customers in possession of a valid rail ticket to Ravenglass, can purchase a Ravenglass to Ravenglass & Eskdale Railway Anytime Day Return ticket at the add on price from any rail station ticket office or the conductor on the train. Both a valid rail ticket to Ravenglass and the Ravenglass to Ravenglass & Eskdale Railway Anytime Day Return ticket must be shown to the guard on the Ravenglass & Eskdale Railway.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from all National Rail retail outlets.

ConcessionFares.Details: Normal Railcard discounts apply

Promotion.Summary: Travel between any two destinations on the Robin Hood line

OfferDetails.Details: A special Day Return fare available for travel to any two destinations between Nottingham and Mansfield Woodhouse on Sundays until further notice.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Available for travel on Sunday only

ConcessionFares.Details: No Railcard discounts are available

Promotion.Summary: Save up to 20% when you buy London North Eastern Railway Catering Vouchers before you travel

OfferDetails.Details:
You can enjoy excellent savings on food and drink with London North Eastern Railway Catering Vouchers.

  •  a £4 voucher gives you £5 to spend on food and drink.

All vouchers are valid in any London North Eastern Railway Café Bar

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
1. You may exchange Catering Vouchers on London North Eastern Railway services for purchases from the London North Eastern Railway Café Bar, Restaurant, At Seat Dining or trolley. 
  2. No change will be given from vouchers. 
  3. The voucher is valid for three months from the date of travel. 
  4. The voucher cannot be exchanged for cash. 
  5. London North Eastern Catering Vouchers cannot be used on any other Train Operators services. 
  6. The number of vouchers that may be issued per transaction is not restricted. They may be purchased in conjunction with adult, child, flat fare tickets, including all season tickets plus when a valid ticket is presented. 
  7. Vouchers cannot be used in conjunction with staff free travel facilities. 
  8. Refunds may be given if Catering Vouchers are submitted with unused travel tickets. 
  9. If the advertised catering service isn't provided, on-train staff will endorse vouchers accordingly and a full refund should be provided at the station of issue.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Vouchers can be purchased when booking your ticket online at www.lner.co.uk, via our Contact Centre (08457 225 225), or from selected stations (Peterborough, Grantham, Newark North Gate, Wakefield Westgate, Leeds (First Class Lounge), London Kings Cross, Stevenage, (Travel Centre), Doncaster, Retford, York, Darlington, Newcastle, Dunbar, Edinburgh, Berwick-upon-Tweed).

Promotion.Summary: Discounted admission to Scarborough SEA LIFE

OfferDetails.Details: This ticket combines your train fare to Scarborough with reduced rate admission to Scarborough Sea Life

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Tickets are only available from TransPennine Express

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Tickets should be issued from Scarborough (8185) to Scrbrosealifectr (K422).

There are 2 ticket types ADM and ADC. ADM is for Adult and Child tickets. ADC is for Concessionary tickets.

AdultFares.Details: £9 add-on to train fare (15+ years old)

ChildFares.Details: £6.50 add-on to train fare (3-14 years old)

ConcessionFares.Details: £8 add-on to train fare, 60+ (ID required), Student (NUS card required)

Promotion.Summary: 10 and 50 Journey Flexipass

OfferDetails.Details:
Flexipass tickets are available for a wide selection of journeys and offer customers significant savings over the cost of purchasing separate single fares.

The 10 Journey Flexipass allows the customer to make 10 separate single journeys, as and when required, on any train, at any time on over 95 key commuter routes throughout Scotland in Standard Class and is valid for one calendar month. 

There is also a First Class 10 Journey Flexipass between Edinburgh and Glasgow.

The 50 Journey Flexipass allows the customer to make 50 separate single journeys, as and when required, on any train, at any time. This Flexipass is only available for journeys between Edinburgh and Glasgow.

The 50 Journey Flexipass is available for both First Class and Standard Class travel.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Customers can travel anytime within the validity of their ticket between their chosen stations.
  • 10 Journey Flexipass tickets offer 10 single journeys which can be used over a period of one month.
  • 10 Journey Flexipasses are non transferrable.
  • 50 Journey Flexipass tickets offer 50 single journeys which can be used over a period of one year between Edinburgh and Glasgow.
  • 50 Journey Flexipasses tickets are transferrable.
  • Valid on all operators' services.
  • Flexipass tickets are only available point to point, customers cannot join or depart at intermediate stations along their chosen route.
  • Flexipass tickets between Edinburgh and Glasgow can be used on all routes between the two cities.
  • Flexipass tickets contain a date box for the customer to complete with the appropriate date of travel using a dark biro pen to ensure clarity, prior to boarding the train.  Customers should be advised of this at point of sale.

50 Journey Flexipass Easements

  • May be used to board/alight at Motherwell for travel via Shotts route or on Virgin Train East Coast services.
  • May be used to board/alight at Croy for travel to/from Lenzie and Bishopbriggs.
  • May be used to board/alight at Coatbridge Sunnyside, and stations east thereof, for travel to/from Edinburgh via Bathgate.

BookingConditions.Details:
• No refunds are available.
  • Unused 50 Journey Flexipasses, submitted before the deadline, may be credited against the purchase of a new 50 Journey Flexipass.
  • Customers cannot break their journey other than for connectional purposes.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Flexipasses can be purchased:

  • At staffed stations
  • Via Telesales on 0344 811 0141
  • www.scotrail.co.uk
  • Rail Appointed Travel Agents

Promotion.Summary: An executive package available to London

OfferDetails.Details:
The Scottish Executive Package includes:

  • Standard Class Return rail travel by London North Eastern Railway from Glasgow Central or Edinburgh to London Kings Cross, plus complimentary upgrade to First Class (return), subject to availability
  • One outward and one return free seat reservation
  • Complimentary food and drink in First Class, according to the day, time of day and journey Subject to availability    
  • London Underground Zones 1 & 2 return ticket (tickets to London only)

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Available from:

  • Stations
  • Travel agents
  • Online

Promotion.Summary: Reduced rail travel with the Young Scot National Entitlement card

OfferDetails.Details:
The Scottish Youth Railcard (SYR) discount is available free to 16-18 year olds and full time volunteers up to the age of 25. 

16 - 18 year olds will no longer be issued with a SYR, instead they will use their Young Scot National Entitlement Card (NEC) which bears their photograph, Pass hologram, date of birth (DOB) and the Young Scot logo.  It is important to check their DOB on the Young Scot NEC to ensure the card holder is under the age of 19. 

Full time volunteers up to age of 25 may still have the old version SYR as they are aged over 19.

Holders of a Young Scot NEC are entitled to:

  • 34% off most rail fares
  • 50% off all season tickets
  • 34% off most advance purchases
  • Minimum fares apply before 10:00 Monday - Friday (except in July & August)

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Discounts available on any journey taken wholly within Scotland.
  • Valid on all operators services.
  • Minimum fares apply before 10:00 Monday - Friday, except in July & August.
  • If the passengers Young Scot National Entitlement Card (NEC) does not show the holders date of birth (DOB) then no discount should be given and the holder advised to contact their Local Authority.
  •  For season tickets, the Young Scot NEC also acts as the photocard.  The last 8 digits of the card number should be recorded as the photocard number.
  • Period season tickets may be issued at a discounted rate for a maximum of four months beyond the nineteenth birthday of the holder.  The start date of the season ticket must be before their nineteenth birthday.
  • Reservations are required where the product being discounted is reservation compulsory, i.e. Advance.
  • On unused travel tickets, refund is as appropriate to ticket type, less admin charge.
  • For a replacement Young Scot NEC the young person must contact their Local Authority.

BookingConditions.Details: Please note that you will need to spend a minimum of £12 in order to receive the one-third discount.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Please note: Our Journey Planner and our associated online ticket retailers will not calculate discounts for Scottish Youth Railcard holders. Tickets should be purchased in person from the ticket office (or on board the train from the conductor where there is no ticket office) to claim the Railcard discount.

AdultFares.Details:
Anytime and Anytime Day Single and Returns, Off-Peak, Off-Peak Day and Super Off-Peak Single and Return fares are all discounted by 34% with a £12.00 minimum fare.

Advance fares are discounted by 34%.

Season Tickets are discounted by 50%.

Promotion.Summary: Aged 60 or over? Save 1/3 on most rail fares throughout Great Britain with a Senior Railcard.

OfferDetails.Details:
With a Senior Railcard anyone 60 years or over can save 1/3 on all Standard and First Class, Anytime, Off-Peak and Advance fares for £30. Take a look at all the ticket types you can make savings on with a Senior Railcard.

The card costs just £30, so if you make one journey that normally costs £92 or a couple of shorter trips you've covered the cost. And you can look forward to dramatic savings for 12 whole months.

There are plenty of ways you can use your Railcard, for both long and short trips. Better still you can use it almost anytime during the week, weekends and public holidays.

  • The only restriction is morning Peak time services, Monday to Friday (not including public holidays) when journeys are made wholly within the London and South East Network Railcard area. See Time Restrictions for more details.

Your Railcard also allows you to take advantage of our great partner offers, giving you exclusive discounts across the UK.  See our offers section for all the latest partner offers.

Now you can also buy a 3-year Senior Railcard, available only online. It's great value at £70, saving you an extra £20 on the cost of renewing your 1-year Railcard for three consecutive years.

Please visit the Senior Railcard website for more information or click here to buy online.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details:
• Tickets for your journey should be purchased before boarding the train and when buying tickets you must show the Railcard. You must have the Railcard with you on your journey and show the valid Railcard and ticket to rail staff at their request. If you do not show both the Railcard and the ticket, you will be required to pay the full price Standard or First Class Single fare, as appropriate for your journey as if no ticket was purchased before starting the journey and in some cases a penalty fare. This does not apply if there was no ticket office at the station at which you began your journey or if the ticket office was closed and there was no ticket machine from which you could buy a discounted ticket.
  • In the case of some low price tickets the actual discount with a Railcard may be slightly lower than that advertised.
  • The right is reserved to revise these Conditions and availability of the tickets detailed here. The Train Companies will endeavour to give three months' notice of any changes before they are due to come into effect.
  • Tickets issued to the holder of the Railcard are issued subject to the National Rail Conditions of Travel. Copies of the National Rail Conditions of Carriage are available from any staffed station ticket office.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
To buy online, you will need a valid UK driving licence or passport number to prove you are eligible. For more information on buying online, please see our FAQ's.

You can also buy a Senior Railcard at a staffed station ticket office or by calling your nearest train company telesales number. For train company telesales numbers, please contact National Rail Enquiries on: 03457 48 49 50 (calls are charged at local rate).

 

Your Railcard will be despatched within one working day, and sent by first class post. Please ensure that you allow enough time before your journey for your Railcard to reach you.

 

 

PLEASE NOTE: When planning a journey with our Journey Planner, in the Passengers and Railcards section simply select the number and type of Railcards that you will be travelling with and click 'Add' after each selection. When the fares are displayed, click on one of the prices to see how much money you've saved by using your Railcard!

Promotion.Summary:
Currently not for sale from station ticket offices.  All tickets must be pre-booked via the SVR website until further notice.
Joint rail and admission ticket to Severn Valley Railway

OfferDetails.Details:
When you buy a rail ticket to Kidderminster you can benefit from a special discounted day of unlimited travel on the Severn Valley Railway.

The Severn Valley Railway is a glorious 16 mile steam and diesel railway which travels between Kidderminster and Bridgnorth. The line is within sight of the River Severn for most of the journey and passes through beautiful countryside and the Georgian town of Bewdley along the way.

FurtherInformation.Details:
The 2020 dates for Special Events when the add-on/through ticket MUST NOT be sold are shown below:

16-19 April 2020 - Spring Steam Gala
2-3 May 2020 - Open House Weekend
14-17 May 2020 - Spring Diesel Festival
23-25 May 2020 - 50th Anniversary
27-28 June 2020 - Step Back to The 40s
4-5 July 2020 - Step Back to The 40s
8-9 August 2020 - Steam On The Road
5-6 September 2020 - On The Buses/Classic Car Day
17-20 September - Autumn Steam Gala
1-3 October 2020 - Autumn Diesel Gala
29-31 October 2020 - Ghost Train Specials
28 November 2020 - 3 January 2021 - Santa Steam Specials

Only open weekends from 10 Oct - 22 November 2020

Notes:

  • The Severn Valley Railway (SVR) will run daily from 4 April - 27 September 2020. The SVR also operates during all school holidays and weekends until 22 November 2020.
  • From 28 November through December 2020 add-on/admission tickets are not available due to special Christmas themed events.
  • The railway is then closed throughout January 2021 for engineering works and re-opens again for February half term 2021.

BookingConditions.Details: These prices are exclusive of rail travel to Kidderminster and are not valid for first class travel on the Severn Valley Railway. Normal refund rules apply as per the National Rail Conditions of Travel.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from any staffed West Midlands Trains station, except Kidderminster, if a National Rail ticket to Kidderminster is being purchased. Also available on the train when joining from an unmanned station. The separate add on/Admission Only ticket can be be purchased from any train operator if customer holds, or is purchasing, a travel ticket to Kidderminster.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Joint National Rail travel/admission tickets are available for all West Midlands Trains priced journeys to Kidderminster.

Customers travelling on journeys to Kidderminster priced by other TOCs should be sold a National Rail ticket to Kidderminster and a separate Admission Only ticket from Kidderminster (4581) to Bridgnorth SVR (L830).

Tickets are also available on the train when joining from an unstaffed station.

ConcessionFares.Details: Railcard discounts are only valid on the rail element of the journey and not on admission to the Severn Valley Railway

Promotion.Summary: Through ticketing on Sheffield Supertram

OfferDetails.Details: Tickets can now be purchased for travel on Sheffield Supertram where passengers are travelling to / from Sheffield with EMR

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Tickets can be bought at the train station or on the train where stations are unstaffed. Passengers should then present their rail issued ticket to the conductor on the tram, who will retain the ticket and issue the relevant Supertram ticket.

Promotion.Summary: Promotional return fare to Skegness

OfferDetails.Details:
EMR will be operating a High Speed Train from Nottingham to Skegness.

This promotion offer of £24 return is only available on the 08:24 service from Nottingham to Skegness on Saturdays.

Passengers may also travel on this service from Derby at 07:53 costing £24.50 for a return ticket.

This service calls at Derby Long Eaton, Nottingham, Sleaford, Boston and Skegness.

The return portion of your ticket is valid for a month on any service from Skegness.

BookingConditions.Details: Normal refunds apply

Promotion.PromotionName: Small Group Day discounts with Transport for Wales
Promotion.Summary: Discounted travel for groups of 3 to 9 people travelling together.

OfferDetails.Details:
Small Group Day is a product that offers groups of between 3-9 people the opportunity to travel at discounted rates (25% of the equivalent day product) across the Transport for Wales network.

Small Group Day is available for any combination of adults and children on Transport for Wales and the services of other train operators to the locations served by Transport for Wales.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information about group discounts with Transport for Wales, please visit www.tfwrail.wales, or ask for information at your local booking office.

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Small Group Day tickets are valid for travel outside of peak times (different times apply depending on the journey taken).
    Customers in the group must travel together at all times.

BookingConditions.Details:
Not available:

  • On certain dates where major sporting events occur within the Transport for Wales network
  • With any other special offer or promotion
  • With combined train and bus travel

PurchaseDetails.Details: Small Group Day tickets can be bought from ticket offices and ticket vending machines, and should be purchased at the first available opportunity before boarding. Where ticket purchasing facilities do not exist at your starting point, you can purchase Small Group Day tickets from the Conductor on the train.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Small Group Day should not be sold on special event days as briefed out by TfW Revenue Team (Small Group Day Barred Dates). 

To be added to the distribution list for Barred Dates emails, please contact the email address above.

to

Promotion.Summary: Upgrade to First Class on Stansted Express services from the Airport to London Liverpool Street or Tottenham Hale.
