Promotion.PromotionName: Steam - The museum of the Great Western Railway
Promotion.Summary: Discounted admission to Steam

OfferDetails.Details:
Steam, Museum of the Great Western Railway, celebrates the story of the men and women who built the Great Western Railway.

It is located in Swindon in a restored Grade II listed building in the centre of the Great Western Historic Area formerly the Swindon Railway Works.

The Museum recreates the atmosphere of the original works using sights, smells and sounds to bring history to life. The displays use interactive exhibits, archive film footage, videos and audio tracks to complement the world renowned collections of famous Great Western locomotives, carriages, rolling stock, posters, archive photographs and railway memorabilia.

The museum is 10 minutes walk from Swindon Station. It is open daily from 10.00 to 17.30 Monday to Saturday and 11.00 to 17.30 Sunday.

During the winter months the museum closes at 17.00. Discounted admission to Steam is available when purchased at the same time as a rail ticket.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: No further discounts apply to the admission part of the ticket. Railcard discounts are valid on the rail portion of the ticket. On arrival at the Museum customers should present the outward portion of their rail ticket for entry. No refunds are permitted on the admission ticket for the museum. Normal refunds apply for the rail portion of the ticket. Passengers over 60 must produce proof of their age.

PurchaseDetails.Details: The add-on should be purchased at the same time as the ticket. Available for purchase from stations or on-train staff

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions: Destination name & NLC: Swindon STEAM J841; Swindon STEAM SR J842

ConcessionFares.Details: Senior (over 60) £3.20

Promotion.Summary: Reduced fares on ScotRail services which start and finish within the scheme's boundaries and on Glasgow's Subway

OfferDetails.Details: PlusBus is a discount price bus ticket for unlimited travel around the origin and/or destination of your rail journey on participating operators' services. When you buy PlusBus with your train ticket you pay for your whole journey by public transport in one transaction.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
For journeys of over 10 miles, Concessionary fares are based on SDS and SDR tickets.

Flat fare tickets, including flat fare zone (single and return) are valid as dated. For journeys over 10 miles (except flat fare zone), tickets are valid as appropriate to the full price ticket from which they are derived.

Not valid on trains timed to depart between 06:00 and 09:00 and between 16:30 and 18:00 Monday to Friday. Valid all day at weekends and on Bank holidays.

There is no peak time restriction if the cardholder is travelling to a hospital appointment (Written proof in the form of an appointment card or other clear written evidence regarding the time and date of an appointment at a Health Board hospital must be produced on request. This will include at time of ticket purchase and on mode of travel where ticket inspections are undertaken).

Disabled card holders are NOT subject to the time restriction.

Ferry card holders are NOT subject to the time restriction.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Tickets may only be purchased within the area covered by the scheme. Only National Entitlement Cards may be used to purchase tickets

If you have not received your Entitlement Card:

Visit the Transport Scotland website for more information (opens a new window)

AdultFares.Details:
Flat fare of £1.00 single, £1.50 return for distances less than 10 miles.

Over 10 miles, the concessionary fare is half the standard single or return fare.

Adults under 60 must hold a valid disability concessionary card with the L logo.

ConcessionFares.Details:
Flat fare of £1.00 single, £1.50 return for distances less than 10 miles.

Over 10 miles, the concessionary fare is half the standard single or return fare.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area

OfferDetails.Details:
Daytripper offers unlimited travel for one day by rail, Subway, most buses and some ferries throughout Strathclyde.

On your chosen day, simply rub off the year, month, date and day when you start your first journey, then seal down the plastic cover or your ticket will not be valid.

There's nothing more to pay for any number of journeys for the rest of the day. Use your Daytripper ticket the day you buy it, or save it and travel on another day - it's valid for the remaining years indicated.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Daytripper tickets are valid after 09:00 Monday to Friday and all day at weekends and Glasgow public holidays. Travel is allowed in the area shown on the Daytripper map.

Tickets cannot be purchased from drivers / conductors on rail or bus services

The party must always stay together for travel with the Daytripper ticket.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Tickets can be purchased from:

  • Any staff rail station
  • SPT Travel Centre
  • Online

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area

OfferDetails.Details: The Roundabout Ticket is the inner city one-day ticket that gets you out into the country. With unlimited travel by rail to over 110 stations and unlimited use of the SPT Subway.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Roundabout Tickets are valid after 09:00 Monday to Friday and all day at weekends and Glasgow public holidays.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Tickets can be purchased from any staffed ScotRail station, from on-train ticket staff or from any SPT Travel Centre, and are valid for rail travel within the area indicated in the map.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area

OfferDetails.Details:
The ZoneCard is a flexible season ticket for unlimited* travel by ScotRail, Subway, most buses, and some ferries in the Strathclyde region.

ZoneCard may be used wherever you see the ZoneCard logo. To buy a ZoneCard go to any ticket office or staffed ScotRail station with a passport-sized photo of yourself and select the zones you want to travel in.

*Except for First Glasgow  and Stagecoach night bus services, the First Glasgow U1/U2 (UWS Link) services, premium services or tours, and TransPennine Express rail services.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: The Zonecard map shows the area covered. For example, Kilmarnock is in Zone K1 and Ayr is in Zone A1. Simply select the zones you need to travel through - the minimum number of zones you can buy is two - and you can enjoy unlimited travel with participating operators.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Tickets can be purchased from a number of outlets in each zone.

For full details of where to buy your ZoneCard, please take a look here

AdultFares.Details:
Prices vary with the number of zones required and the length of time the ZoneCard is required for.

A full price list can be found here

ChildFares.Details:
Prices vary with the number of zones required and the length of time the ZoneCard is required for.

A full price list can be found here

Promotion.PromotionName: Student Connect - Great Northern and Thameslink
Promotion.Summary: Discounted rail travel for students.

OfferDetails.Details:
The Student Connect card offers discounted season tickets for rail travel to all students aged between 16 and 18 years old in full time education.

It entitles the card holder to purchased reduced rate season tickets (minimum of a month up to a year) for journeys on Great Northern and Thameslink trains in the specified area. More information is available here.

Passengers aged 16 or 17 may prefer to buy a 16-17 Saver card which as well as giving 50% discount on most season tickets, also gives 50% discount on most other rail journeys throughout England and Wales, and stations in Scotland served by LNER, CrossCountry, TransPennine Express and Avanti West Coast. More information is available here.  

Weekly season tickets do not qualify for the discount.

An alternative for passengers wishing to buy weekly season tickets is instead to buy a 16-17 Saver card. More information is available here.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Discount codes to use:

  • Student Connect Cambridgeshire - 0397
  • Student Connect - 0346

Promotion.Summary: A TransPennine Express offer for holders of a Young Persons Railcard.

OfferDetails.Details: Student Getaway Tickets are available to holders of a valid Young Persons Railcard, and offer 50% savings against the normal adult Super Advance fare. They are available on most long distance TransPennine Express routes for off-peak journeys in standard class only.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: The offer is subject to availability.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Tickets should be purchased from www.tpexpress.co.uk

Tickets are non-refundable and are only valid on the date and train services shown on the ticket.

Excluding Airport Advance tickets to and from Manchester Airport.

Tickets are subject to availability.

Promotion.Summary: This summer sees the return of the Derwent Valley Line Summer Evening Saver, with evening fares from just £3 return, great for an evening out in the city or a visit to the countryside

OfferDetails.Details: Until 6 September EMR and CrossCountry are offering a special summer evening return fare on train services between Nottingham / Derby and Matlock travelling after 18:15 (Monday to Saturday) and after 16:30 on a Sunday. Return evening fares are £3 for travel between Derby and Matlock or intermediate stations; £4 from Long Eaton for stations to Matlock and £6 between Attenborough, Beeston or Nottingham and stations to Matlock. These prices apply for travel in either direction after these times. Return evening fares are £3 for travel between Derby and Matlock or intermediate stations; £4 from Long Eaton for stations to Matlock and £6 between Attenborough / Beeston or Nottingham and stations to Matlock.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

AdultFares.Details:
Between Derby and Matlock / Matlock Bath / Cromford / Whatstandwell / Ambergate / Belper / Duffield.  Adult price for a return ticket is £3

Between Long Eaton and Matlock / Matlock Bath / Cromford / Whatstandwell / Ambergate / Belper / Duffield. Adult price for a return ticket is £4

Between Nottingham / Beeston / Attenborough and Matlock / Matlock Bath / Cromford / Whatstandwell / Ambergate / Belper / Duffield. Adult price for a return ticket is £6.

Promotion.Summary: Cheap travel between London and the West Midlands (and vice versa).

OfferDetails.Details: The “Super Off-Peak” is Chiltern Railways' cheap walk-up fare at the quietest times of day.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: Monday to Friday, valid on trains arriving into London Marylebone after 1130, leaving Marylebone before 1600, and after 1900. No restrictions at weekends. Return journey can be made the same day or within 1 month of purchase date, as shown on the ticket..

PurchaseDetails.Details: Buy from the station or call 08456 005 165 (0700 to 2000) to buy in advance..

Promotion.Summary: Travel within the designated area.

OfferDetails.Details:
If you would like to travel by bus, tram and train around South Yorkshire, SYConnect+ Day may be the best option for you.

This ticket gives you unlimited travel on all local bus, tram and train services within the South Yorkshire TravelMaster zone.

The SYConnect+ Day ticket offers unlimited travel on local bus, tram and train services within the South Yorkshire TravelMaster zone.

Not valid on dedicated school services or late night bus services with prefix 'N' (eg N52).

Full ticket information, including prices, products, boundary information and conditions of use, is available on the TravelMaster website.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information visit www.travelsouthyorkshire.com

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
One-Day available to buy on board from participating TravelMaster operators and from staffed railway stations. Also available for purchase via the First and Stagecoach m-Ticket Apps.

Full details on where to buy this ticket are available on the TravelMaster website.

Promotion.Summary: Available on all local public transport within the appropriate South Yorkshire zones.

OfferDetails.Details:
The GetAbout+ Day ticket offers under 18 year olds unlimited travel on any local bus, tram and train service within the South Yorkshire TravelMaster zone.

Not valid on dedicated school services or late night bus services with prefix 'N' (N52).

Full ticket information, including boundary details and condition of use, is available on the TravelMaster website.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
They may be used for travel on bus and tram services, and for standard class travel on specified local rail services (excluding LNER) in those areas specified for each product.

TravelMaster Products are valid up to notified county boundary points - for further information visit www.travelsouthyorkshire.com or by ringing 'Traveline' on 0871 200 22 33.

On cross boundary rail services into and out of South Yorkshire they may only be used on journeys wholly within South Yorkshire. They can be used in conjunction with another ticket product provided that the train stops at the designated boundary station to permit passengers to alight.

Not valid for travel without further payment on services specified as 'Late Night Services' or other 'special' services.

Rotherham zone tickets are not valid for travel for travel on the 'A1 Shuttle' bus service between Catcliffe and Rotherham.

There are no refunds or replacements for lost or stolen tickets.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
SY Getabout+ Day tickets are available from the staffed National Rail station, bus driver or tram conductor.

Tickets are also available through a Travel South Yorkshire information Centre

Please note: 

  • Children aged between 11 and 16 will need a valid MegaTravel Pass in order to purchase a GetAbout+.
  • Children aged between 16 and 18 will need a valid 16-18 Travel Pass in order to purchase a GetAbout+.
  • When buying a GetAbout Day ticket you will need to show your MegaTravel or 16-18 Travel Pass to the driver or conductor and then show it each time you use the ticket.  
  • When buying a GetAbout 7 or 28 Day ticket the driver/conductor will load this on to your MegaTravel or 16-18 Travel Pass.  All you need to do after that is scan your pass when you board the bus, tram or train.

Promotion.Summary: 50% discount on applicable Standard Class journeys on journeys set by Transport for Wales Rail Services within a defined geographical area for 18 year olds (no minimum fare will apply).

FurtherInformation.Details: www.tfwrail.wales

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Only available to purchase at Transport for Wales ticket offices.

Proof of age will be required.

Promotion.Summary: 2 for 1 entry to The Electric Cinema

OfferDetails.Details:
The Electric is the oldest working cinema in the UK, first opened in December 1909. 

Now showing an eclectic range of arthouse and intelligent mainstream, The Electric is the perfect environment for any movie lover. 

The building is also home to a full bar and luxury sofa seating with waiter service.

Days Out Guide offers 2 for 1 entry on many attractions across the UK with a valid train ticket.

Details can be found at https://www.daysoutguide.co.uk/electric-cinema

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Customers must show a valid rail ticket to Birmingham.

BookingConditions.Details: See Terms & Conditions

Promotion.Summary: Reduced rate admission tickets to THORPE Park when you travel by train.

OfferDetails.Details: Please visit the Days Out Guide website to see the latest offer for THORPE Park.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Please visit the Days Out Guide website to see the latest offer for THORPE Park.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Admission tickets are not available through National Rail retailers in 2016.

Customers should visit daysoutguide.co.uk for the latest offer.

Promotion.PromotionName: Through fares to the Continent from across the UK via Eurostar
Promotion.Summary: The European high-speed railway network is closer than you think!

OfferDetails.Details:
Experience Eurostar's new faster carbon-neutral journeys to the Continent from stations all over National Rail network.

Eurostar's Regional 'Through Fares' deal offers the benefits of European high-speed rail travel from doorstep to destination. And the beauty of it is you only have to pay one fare to travel between the likes of Peterborough and Paris, Birmingham and Brussels or Liverpool and Lyon.

Eurostar have teamed up with several UK train operating companies to make your European journey seamless from start to finish and to offer you the very best value fares available.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Call the Eurostar contact centre on 08432 186186.
Planning your itinerary with a member of the contact centre team, they will be able to suggest the best routes, journey times and fares

Once you have booked, Eurostar will post your National Rail and Eurostar tickets to you immediately Remember one fare covers your whole journey from your UK departure station to your Continental destination (and back if it is a return).

Promotion.Summary: This Railcard entitles holders to a 34% discount on applicable Standard Class journeys (non-Season Tickets) and a 10% discount on Standard Class Season Tickets on selected journeys priced by Transport for Wales Rail Services (no minimum fare will apply).

FurtherInformation.Details: www.tfwrail.wales

PurchaseDetails.Details: Transport for Wales Student Railcard can only be purchased at Transport for Wales Rail Services ticket offices. It cannot be purchased at other National Rail ticket offices, or online.

Passengers.Note: Valid for one year

Promotion.Summary: The new Two Together Railcard gives two named adults 1/3 off rail fares when they travel together by train.

OfferDetails.Details:
Get 1/3 off rail fares when you travel together with the new Two Together Railcard.

The new Two Together Railcard gives two named adults 1/3 off rail fares when they travel together by train.  You can get 1/3 off Standard and First Class Anytime, Off-Peak and Advance fares on train services throughout Great Britain, when you travel after 09:30 Monday to Friday, and any time at weekends and on Public Holidays. 

The Two Together Railcard costs just £30 - that's £15 each - and you can use it as many times as you like throughout the year. 

Please visit twotogether-railcard.co.uk for more information or click here to buy now.  You will need digital photos of the two named people on the Railcard.

FurtherInformation.Details: www.twotogether-railcard.co.uk

TicketValidityConditions.Details: The two named adults must travel together throughout the whole journey.

BookingConditions.Details: See Terms and Conditions

PurchaseDetails.Details: The Two Together Railcard is now available nationally, from 3 March 2014, following an earlier trial in the West Midlands which began in 2011.

Promotion.Summary: Unlimited train travel for students in the Unizone area

OfferDetails.Details:
Special season tickets exclusively available for students available in the Brighton area. 

Brighton Unizone gives you unlimited travel to all stations below:

  • Falmer
  • Moulsecoomb
  • London Road
  • Preston Park
  • Brighton

  • Aldrington

Monthly - £68.80 (£70.70 from 2 January 2020)

Quarterly - £206.30 (£212.00 from 2 January 2020) (valid for your 13 week term) 

Annual - Not available

Unizone Season Tickets can only be purchased at staffed Ticket Offices inside the area of validity, not available on train or at TVMs.

Promotion.Summary: Unlimited train travel for students in the Unizone area

Special season tickets exclusively available for students available in the Worthing area. 

Worthing Unizone gives you unlimited travel to all stations below:

Unizone tickets can be issued in line with the Season Ticket Period Factors Calculator to fit term dates. Please ensure ticket validity dates match the term dates required by the customer.

Promotion.Summary: Discounted rail travel on the Valley Lines network in South Wales

OfferDetails.Details: The Valley Lines Senior Railcard offers 50% off Standard Day Return standard class rail fares on the Valley Lines after 09.29. The railcard is available to anyone aged 60 or over and costs £12.50 valid for one year.

com:Annotation.com:Note: Valid on Valley Lines services which are scheduled to arrive at Cardiff Central at 09:29 or later, for the entire duration of the train's journey. The railcard is also valid on all Valley Lines services on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

FurtherInformation.Details:
As an alternative to the Valleys Senior Railcard, Transport for Wales now also offer a 34% discount on the same routes for customers presenting a Concessionary Card provided by their local council. These are available to buy on the train and at any staffed station on the Cardiff Valley Lines network.

The discount is valid all day on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. On Mondays to Fridays after 09:29.

PurchaseDetails.Details: The railcard can be purchased at any staffed station in the Cardiff Valley Lines network

AdultFares.Details: £12.50 for the railcard for a one year duration, and then 50% off Standard Day Return fares between Valley Line stations.

Promotion.Summary: - Discounted rail travel along key Valleys and Cardiff local routes.

OfferDetails.Details: - Offers 34% off all day tickets and 10% off all season tickets along key Valleys and Cardiff local routes. Discounts apply out of term and at weekends too.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information please visit www.tfwrail.wales, or ask for information at your local booking office.

Promotion.Summary:
Coming soon.

See https://www.veterans-railcard.co.uk/ for details

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product

FurtherInformation.Details: Please see www.veterans-railcard.co.uk for details

Promotion.Summary: A discount on the normal price of Advance Purchase tickets

OfferDetails.Details: Purchase your tickets through the CrossCountry website or call CrossCountry Telesales 0844 811 0124 to receive a discount on the normal Advance Purchase price.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: First Class Travel for just a little bit extra...

OfferDetails.Details:
Holders of most Standard class tickets can upgrade to the added comfort of First Class on selected train companies on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays on trains which convey First Class accommodation. Sometimes, trains have designated "Weekend First" coaches which are clearly labelled.

You can upgrade on the train - on a first come, first served basis. On some services, you may be able to reserve a seat in advance. If you have a seat reservation and miss your selected service, you can still use it on another service for the same journey on the same date at no extra charge, as long as you're not travelling on an Advance tickets.

Please be aware that many Train Companies offer a reduced First Class service at weekends and on Bank Holidays and may not offer the full service that they offer during the week. Upgrading to First Class during the week is also possible - find out more.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: Sometimes, if trains are very busy, the availability of Weekend First may be restricted to allow for passengers who already hold First Class tickets to take a seat.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Available from most staffed stations, rail appointed travel agents and telesales offices. Also available onboard the train, subject to accommodation being available.

Promotion.Summary: A Travelcard that lasts for the weekend.

OfferDetails.Details:
The Weekend Travelcard is valid for 2 consecutive weekend days (Saturday, Sunday or Bank Holiday Monday)., and allows the passenger to make a return journey from the start station to the Travelcard zones on each of the 2 days, as well as unlimited travel in the London Fare Zones on both days.

Normal Child discount of 50% applies. No Railcard discounts. Special 2-Adult discount also applies: 2 adults traveling together with Weekend Travelcards pay a total price which is less than twice the full fare.

Valid from Aylesbury Vale Parkway, Aylesbury, Stoke Mandeville, Wendover and Great Missenden stations.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Discounted rail travel on the Valley Lines network in South Wales for holders of a Welsh Government Concessionary Bus Pass.

OfferDetails.Details: From the 2 January 2015, holders of a Welsh Government Concessionary Bus Pass can obtain a 34% discount on Standard Day Singles, Standard Day Return and Cheap Day Return rail fares on the Valley Lines Network in South Wales.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

BookingConditions.Details: The reduced fare is available to all passengers who produce the Concessionary Bus Pass card when purchasing a ticket and also when travelling.

PurchaseDetails.Details: 2 January 2015 - until further notice

Passengers.Note: Discounted travel is only available after 09:30 Monday to Friday and any times at Weekends and Bank Holidays.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions: For commercial purposes it is important that the correct discount code is used. Please ensure you use discount code WGC.

Promotion.Summary: DaySaver tickets give you the freedom to choose how and when you want to travel.

OfferDetails.Details: You can buy a Train & Bus DaySaver for travel on a specific day or a ticket that enables you to choose your date of travel. You can choose to travel by bus, by train or by bus and train.

FurtherInformation.Details:
Group Validity: Valid for up to five Adults travelling together within Metro Zones 1-5

Family Validity: Valid for up to two Adults with three Concessionary travellers, or one Adult with up to four Concessionary travellers anywhere in West Yorkshire

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
DaySaver tickets come in two forms, Scratch Off and Pre-dated, depending upon when you want to travel.

  • Scratch Off tickets (Family, Train & Bus DaySaver), which are sold at bus stations and some Tourist Information Centres, have no specific date of travel. On the day you want to use the ticket, simply scratch off the day, date and month and year and seal it with the protective overlay. Scratch Off tickets are not sold at rail outlets.
  • Pre-dated tickets (Family, Train & Bus, Train DaySaver) are sold at rail stations. You can buy them on the day of use or in advance if you know when you want to travel. You can even buy your Train DaySaver on the train if there is no booking office open.

DaySavers mean you can start out as early as you want at weekends and on public holidays, and after 09.30am on normal weekdays.

Tickets are not valid on trains Monday to Friday between 16:01 and 18:29.

Note that use between midnight and 0030 is permitted on a ticket showing the previous day's date.

Train & Bus travel is not valid in Zones 6 & 7

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You can buy your DaySaver at:

  • Bradford Interchange
  • Dewsbury Bus Station
  • Halifax Bus Station
  • Huddersfield Bus Station
  • Keighley Bus Station
  • Leeds Bus Station
  • Pontefract Bus Station
  • Wakefield Bus Station.
  • All staffed National Rail stations in West Yorkshire (Train DaySaver and Train & Bus DaySaver only).
  • Some Tourist Information Centres.

Promotion.Summary: Standard Class single rail travel with London North Eastern Railway including an upgrade to London North Eastern Railway First Class, subject to availability

OfferDetails.Details:
A standard class single ticket, with an upgrade to First Class.

This ticket will be priced slightly more than a standard single ticket, but will allow the holder to travel in First Class. Complimentary food and drink, according to the day and time of the journey will be provided, subject to availability.

Complimentary access to London North Eastern Railway First Class lounges is also included.

Reservations are compulsory.

FurtherInformation.Details:
Travel must be completed by 16 June 2014.

Reservations are compulsory.

Full refunds are available subject to administration fees if the ticket is unused.

Should complimentary food and drink not be available, no refund will be provided.

Promotion.Summary: Day Rover tickets give you the freedom to choose how and when you want to travel.

OfferDetails.Details: Metro Train DayRover allows one day's unlimited travel in standard accommodation between all stations within the West Yorkshire P.T.E area.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
DayRover tickets come in two forms, Scratch Off and Pre-dated, depending upon when you want to travel.

  • Scratch Off tickets (Family, Train & Bus DayRovers), which are sold at bus stations and some Tourist Information Centres, have no specific date of travel. On the day you want to use the ticket, simply scratch off the day, date and month and year and seal it with the protective overlay. Scratch Off tickets are not sold at rail outlets.
  • Pre-dated tickets (Family, Train & Bus, Train DayRovers) are sold at rail stations. You can buy them on the day of use or in advance if you know when you want to travel. You can even buy your Train DayRover on the train if there is no booking office open.

Valid by any train timed to depart between the following times:

  • Mondays-Fridays                                    09:30-00:30
  • Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays    05:00-00:30

Tickets are not valid on services Monday to Friday between 16:01 and 18:29.

Note that use between midnight and 0030 is permitted on a ticket showing the previous day's date.

Train travel is not valid in zone 6 and 7

BookingConditions.Details: Dogs - Up to 2 accompanied dogs will be conveyed free on trains.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You can buy your Train only DayRover at:

  • All staffed rail stations in West Yorkshire
  • On the train if there is no booking office open, or it is an unstaffed station.

Promotion.Summary: Reduced admission rate to Windsor Castle, when you travel by train.

OfferDetails.Details:
Windsor Castle is the largest and oldest occupied castle in the world and it's rich history spans almost 1,000 years.

Your entry ticket includes access to:

  • The State Apartments decorated with some of the finest works of art from the Royal Collection, including works by Canaletto, Gainsborough, Rembrandt and Rubens.
  • Restored rooms damaged by the 1992 fire. The fire damaged over 100 rooms and some of the castle's works of art. The restoration work was completed in 1997 by some of Europe's finest craftsmen.
  • Semi-State Rooms, formerly George IV's private apartments and some of the most richly decorated rooms in the castle. (Open October - March)
  • St George's Chapel is one of England's finest examples of Gothic architecture. It is the spiritual home of the Order of the Garter, established by Edward III in 1348, and also contains the tombs of ten sovereigns, including Henry VIII and Charles I.
  • The Drawings Gallery displays changing exhibitions of material from the Royal Collection.
As the Castle is a working royal residence, it's opening hours are subject to change. Please check the Castle's opening times .


Admission tickets are not offered on dates when the Castle is closed, or if a lower admission rate applies. The ticket is valid on the date shown. If a one-year pass is required, please buy admission tickets at Windsor Castle's ticket office (tickets sold under this offer cannot be converted to a one-year pass on arrival at Windsor Castle).

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Admission tickets are not offered on dates when the Castle is closed, or if a lower admission rate applies.

The ticket is valid on the date shown. If a one-year pass is required, please buy admission tickets at Windsor Castle's ticket office (tickets sold under this offer cannot be converted to a one-year pass on arrival at Windsor Castle)

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Tickets are available from any staffed train station in Great Britain, or from the guard on the train, and must be purchased before you arrive at Windsor & Eton Riverside or Windsor & Eton Central station.

The admission ticket is not available from the stations in Windsor, or at Windsor Castle.

Tickets are not available on days when the State Apartments are closed, or when the castle is closed for state functions. Please check the Castle's opening dates before you travel.

Please note that these admission tickets cannot be treated as Gift Aid donations.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Fares will appear in TIS, except on dates when the Castle is closed to the public, or if a lower admission rate applies.

Ensure your TIS is in "Fares Only" mode. Admission ticket should be issued as:

Origin: 3175 WINDSOR & E CTL or 5672 WINDSOR & E RIV

Destination: J740 WINDSOR CASTLE

ConcessionFares.Details: Aged 60+, or a student (proof of eligibility may be required, e.g. Concessionary Bus Pass, Railcard)

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated area

OfferDetails.Details: MetroCard can help regular travellers cut the cost of travel in West Yorkshire, and can be purchased weekly, monthly, quarterly or annually.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Simply show your MetroCard and PhotoCard to the driver when you get on the bus. At railway stations you will either show your card and photo to the inspector, or insert your ticket into an automatic gate. Conductors on trains may ask to see your card and photo too.

If your MetroCard covers only part of your journey, you will need to pay any additional fare before starting your journey. If you start your journey at a train station with an open ticket office, you must buy your ticket before boarding - no discounted fares are available from the conductor.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
You can buy a MetroCard from:

  • Staffed bus and rail stations in West Yorkshire.
  • Post Offices in West Yorkshire (weekly and monthly MetroCards only).

Buying your first MetroCard

For your first MetroCard you will need to take along a passport photograph, so a PhotoCard can be made for you to use with your MetroCard.

MetroCards can be bought up to two working days before the date you would like it to start.

If you are buying a quarterly or annual MetroCard make sure you register your card in case of loss

Renewing your MetroCard

When you want to renew your card you just need to show your PhotoCard. MetroCards continuing from the previous expiry date can normally be renewed one week in advance. A renewal need not be for the same travel type or period as the previous card.

Please note MetroCards cannot be renewed more than two days before the expiry date at rail stations.

AdultFares.Details:
Bus and Rail zones 1-3:

  • Weekly £31.70
  • Monthly £121.70       
  • Annually £1250.90

Bus and Rail Zones 1-4:

  • Weekly £38.30  
  • Monthly £143.00      
  • Annually £1469.50

Bus and Rail zones 1-5:

  • Weekly £45.00   
  • Monthly £169.90   
  • Annually £1764.20
Bus and Rail zones 2-5:
  • Weekly £31.50
  • Monthly £118.30   
  • Annually £1232.20

Student+ Mcard zones 1-5

  • Weekly £25.20
  • Monthly £93.60
  • Annual N/A

Promotion.Summary: Unlimited travel on train services within the selected zones

OfferDetails.Details:
West Yorkshire PTE Zone 6 and Zone 7 railcards can help regular travellers cut the cost of travel in West Yorkshire, and can be purchased weekly, monthly, quarterly or annually, with unlimited travel on trains within the selected zones.

  • Zone 6 railcards (stations are Harrogate, Hornbeam Park, Pannal and Weeton) are also valid in zones 1 to 5
  • Zone 7 railcards (stations are Skipton and Cononley) are also valid in zones 1 to 5

NOTE: railcards are NOT valid between zones 6 and 7

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Valid only on direct services between West Yorkshire and Skipton - Harrogate (not via York).

Railcards require a photocard.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Zone 6 and 7 RailCards are only available from staffed rail stations in West Yorkshire, plus Harrogate and Skipton in
North Yorkshire.

Promotion.Summary: Discounted admission with TransPennine Express

OfferDetails.Details: A discounted ticket to York Dungeons is available to customers who purchase a rail ticket to York with TransPennine Express. The discounted ticket is for admission only and allows entrance to the dungeons and is valid for entry up to 1 calendar month from the date of issue.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

PurchaseDetails.Details: Tickets are only available from TransPennine Express

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Tickets should be issued from York (8263) to York Dungeon (K421).

There are 2 ticket types ADM and ADC. ADM is for Adult and Child tickets. ADC is for Concessionary tickets.

AdultFares.Details: £10.00 add-on to train fare (16+ years old)

ChildFares.Details: £7.00 add-on to train fare (4-15 years old)

ConcessionFares.Details: £9.00 add-on to train fare, 60+ (ID required), Student ( NUS card required)

Promotion.Summary: A combination of rail and bus ticket to York racecourse

OfferDetails.Details:
Simply ask for a ticket with TransPennine Express services to York Racecourse and your ticket is then valid on the dedicated shuttle bus between York station and York Racecourse.  

The bus service operates up to every 10 minutes (frequency of service is dependant on the race meeting).

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details: Available on race days only.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Simply ask for a ticket to "York Racecourse" or produce a valid season ticket, which allows travel to York.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Origin Name: YORK

Destination Name: YORK RACES BUS

ConcessionFares.Details: Discounts are not available with the add-on fare

Promotion.Summary: The GA Club 50 Railcard costs £20 and is valid for one year.

OfferDetails.Details: Gives a discount of 20% on Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak fares when purchased on the GA App or the GA website. A 10% discount is available on purchases from a GA ticket office. When no Off-Peak fare is available, the discount is available on Anytime tickets at times when an Off-Peak ticket would normally be valid.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information, see the Greater Anglia website.

BookingConditions.Details: Railcard holders must show their valid Railcard and proof of age (driving licence or a photocopy of their passport's photo page) when using tickets and when purchasing them from a ticket office.

PurchaseDetails.Details: Tickets can be bought on the Greater Anglia App or on the GA website.  They can also be bought at a ticket office.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
Railcards can be purchased online or at stations. They are issued by the GA Business Travel office. If a customer purchases a Railcard online, a temporary print-at-home card is available until the permanent Railcard is sent to them. 

When a Railcard is bought at a station, the stamped sundry receipt and application form are used as a temporary Railcard until the customer receives the permanent Railcard in the post. 

Temporary Railcards are valid for one month.

Full instructions have been issued to GA stations.

DiscountsAvailable.OtherDiscounts:
20% off Advance, Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak tickets, in First and Standard Class, when bought through the GA App or on the GA website.

10% off when bought at a GA ticket office.

Where no Off-Peak ticket exists for the journey being made, the discount is available on Anytime tickets at times when Off-Peak tickets are valid.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated Rover area

OfferDetails.Details:
Subject to the restrictions shown below, the All Line Rover (14 day) ticket allows unlimited travel on most National Rail services for 14 consecutive days.

It does not include the charge for seat reservations, where payable.

The All Line Rover is valid for travel on:

  • Caledonian Sleeper services in seated coaches (reservations compulsory) or in a berth with the payment of the appropriate supplement. 
  • Great Western Railway - Night Riviera Sleeper services in seated coaches (reservations recommended but not compulsory) or in a berth with payment of the appropriate supplement. 
  • Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railways (Third Class only - see below for upgrade details)

The All Line Rail Rover is NOT valid for travel on;

  • Eurostar
  • Heathrow Express
  • London Underground
  • DLR
  • London Trams
  • private railways (except Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway) or,
  • on any shipping service

The All Line Rail Rover is NOT valid for boarding or alighting train services operated by Avanti West Coast, CrossCountry, East Midlands Railway, or LNER before 10:00 Mondays to Fridays at the following stations: 

  • Birmingham New Street
  • Bedford
  • London Euston
  • London Kings Cross
  • London St Pancras International
  • Luton
  • Luton Airport Parkway
  • Milton Keynes Central
  • Stevenage
  • Watford Junction

No restrictions apply on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railways

All Line Rover (14 Days) is valid for Third Class only. Upgrade to First Class on payment of an Excess.

Ffestiniog Railway Single Excess             £8.00
Welsh Highland Railway Single Excess   £12.00

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Except on Sleeper services, All Line Rail Rovers are valid for travel until 04:29 of the morning immediately following the expiry date shown on the ticket.

All travel must be completed by this time.

Sleeper Services

On Sleeper services, the All Line Rail Rover must be valid on the date of arrival at your destination but need not be valid on the date of departure of a Sleeper service. The date of arrival is the first date of validity of the All Line Rail Rover.

Passengers.Note:
All Lines Rail Rover is valid for 14 consecutive days.

The All Line Rail Rover is NOT valid for boarding or alighting train services operated by Avanti West Coast, CrossCountry, East Midlands Railway or, LNER before 10:00 Mondays to Fridays at the following stations:

  • Milton Keynes Central
  • Stevenage
  • Watford Junction

The All Line Rail Rover is NOT valid for travel at any time on;

  • Eurostar
  • Heathrow Express
  • London Underground
  • DLR
  • London Trams
  • private railways (except Ffestiniog Railway) or,
  • on any shipping service

Promotion.Summary: A monthly season ticket available in zonal areas in East Anglia.

OfferDetails.Details:
Available in Standard Class only.

The Norfolk zone covers the lines from Norwich to Thetford, Sheringham, Great Yarmouth, Lowestoft and Diss.

The Suffolk zone covers the lines from Ipswich to Lowestoft, Felixstowe, Stowmarket and Bury St Edmunds, also from Lowestoft to Somerleyton.

The Cambridge zone covers the lines from Cambridge to Bury St Edmunds, Ely and Thetford, also between Bury St Edmunds and Ely.

A ticket valid in both Norfolk and Suffolk is also valid between Stowmarket and Diss.

Holders of Anglia Plus Seasons may take a cycle with them, free of charge, but on mainline services between Ipswich and Norwich a free advance reservation is essential.

On other services, space will be allocated on a first come, first served basis.

Cycles are not permitted on services arriving at or departing Cambridge between 07.45 and 08.45 on Mondays to Fridays.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated rover area

OfferDetails.Details:
Travel wherever you like on Greater Anglia, East Midlands Railway and Great Northern services within the Anglia Plus area.  This is within the whole of Norfolk (except to Kings Lynn) and Suffolk (except to Sudbury) and to and from Cambridge and Ely.

Holders of Anglia Plus Passes may take a cycle with them, free of charge, but on mainline services between Ipswich and Norwich (and vice versa) a free advance reservation is essential.

ProductType.Name: Anglia Plus Day Ranger
ProductType.Valid: One Day. Not valid before 08.45 on Mondays to Fridays, except Bank Holidays. Easements apply on certain routes; see below. Up to four accompanied children per adult can travel for £2.00 each.

PromotionRailCard.Details: Accompanied child fare remains at £2 each with Family Railcard.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
The ticket is valid for one day from 08:45 Mondays to Fridays and at any time on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. Earlier travel is permitted on the following weekday departures:

  • 08:16 Saxmundham, 08:26 Wickham Market, 08:33 Melton (Suffolk), 08:38 Woodbridge (to Ipswich)
  • 08:21 Norwich, 08:31 Salhouse, 08:36 Hoveton & Wroxham, 08:43 Worstead (to Sheringham)
  • 08:22 Sheringham, 08:26 West Runton, 08:33 Cromer, 08:39 Roughton Road (to Norwich)
  • 08:30 Ely (to Ipswich)
  • 08:30 Thurston, 08:36 Elmswell (to Ipswich)
  • 08.36 Norwich, 08.43 Brundall Gardens (to Great Yarmouth)
  • 08.40 Norwich (to Cambridge)
  • 08.44 Ipswich (to Norwich).

On any First bus in Norwich, except Park & Ride services.
Between Ipswich or Derby Road stations and Ipswich Town Centre on any direct services by First or Ipswich Buses, or by Ipswich Buses to Ipswich Hospital or Ransomes Industrial Estate.
On the "Breeze" town services in Bury St Edmunds operated by Stephensons.

All refunds are subject to an administration fee.

Promotion.Summary: A rover ticket which allows 3 days' travel in a week in East Anglia.

OfferDetails.Details:
There are numerous possibilities for a perfect day out with this 3 Days in 7 Flexi Rover.

Travel by any service operated by Greater Anglia, East Midlands Railway or Great Northern/Thameslink within the Anglia Plus area. This covers everywhere north of Cambridge and Ipswich inclusive, except the lines north and west of Ely to Kings Lynn and Peterborough.

Holders of Anglia Plus Rovers may take a cycle with them, free of charge, but on main line services between Ipswich and Norwich a free advance reservation is essential.

On other services, space will be allocated on a first come, first served basis.

ProductType.Name: Anglia Plus 3 Days in 7 Flexi Rover

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
This ticket is valid for any three days in a seven day period, from 08.45 Mondays to Fridays and at any time on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. The following trains can also be used:

  • 08:16 Saxmundham, 08:26 Wickham Market, 08:33 Melton (Suffolk), 08:38 Woodbridge (to Ipswich)

  • 08:30 Ely (to Ipswich)
  • 08:30 Thurston, 08:36 Elmswell (to Ipswich)
  • 08:36 Norwich, 08:43 Brundall Gardens (to Great Yarmouth)

Also available on the following local bus services:

  • Between Ipswich or Derby Road stations and Ipswich Town Centre on any direct services by First or Ipswich Buses, or by Ipswich Buses to Ipswich Hospital or Ransomes Industrial Estate.
  • On the "Breeze" town services in Bury St Edmunds operated by Stephensons.

Promotion.Summary: Explore the beautiful and historic borders towns and villages from Edinburgh

OfferDetails.Details:
Ticket includes ScotRail travel to/ from Edinburgh Waverley and any Borders Bus from Galashiels Transport Interchange to Hawick, Jedburgh, Peebles, Kelso etc. Includes Borders hop-on, hop-off sightseeing bus, when running.

Customers can only leave or board the train at either Galashiels or Tweedbank in order to board the connecting Borders Bus service.

Perfect all-inclusive ticket, especially for residents and visitors staying in Edinburgh and the Borders.

Available for both Peak and Off Peak journeys.

Promotion.Summary: Unlimited mid-week days travel for over 65's.

OfferDetails.Details:
Unlimited days travel on weekday off-peak trains for passengers aged 65 and over, across the c2c network.

c2c Senior Rover (All-Line)

If you're over 65, you can hop on and off any off-peak weekday c2c service, with the c2c Senior Rover. The c2c Senior Rover (All-Line) is required if you're travelling to or from a c2c station within the London zones.

c2c Senior Rover (Non-London)

The c2c Senior Rover (Non-London) allows off-peak travel between stations outside the London zones (Upminster or Rainham to Shoeburyness) only. c2c Senior Rover (Non-London) can be used in conjunction with a Freedom Pass or 60+ Oyster (if over 65).

Senior Railcard Holders

If you're 60 or over, and hold a Senior Railcard, you can get our Senior Rover ticket if you haven't hit 65 yet

AreaMap.Details: Link to map of validity for c2c Senior Rover (All-Line)

FurtherInformation.Details:
c2c Senior Rover (non-London) is not valid for travel to or from the following stations:

  • London Liverpool Street
  • Stratford (London)
  • London Fenchurch Street
  • Limehouse
  • West Ham
  • Barking
  • Upminster
  • Dagenham Dock
  • Rainham (Essex) 

Travel is permitted from these stations in conjunction with Freedom Pass or 60+ Oyster (over 65's), or with c2c Senior Rover (All-Line)

BookingConditions.Details:
Valid identification must be presented when buying your ticket (Passport, driving licence, proof of age related pension, Senior Railcard or birth certificate).

Normal refund policy applies.

PurchaseDetails.Details: At c2c manages ticket offices and online

Promotion.Summary: A flexible Rover ticket that covers travel on ScotRail train services throughout Central Scotland, Borders railway services, and on the Glasgow Underground.

OfferDetails.Details:
You can visit some of the most famous spots in Scotland's central belt for any 3 consecutive days.

Central Scotland Rover tickets are not subject to availability and do not need to be booked in advance.

AreaMap.Details: View area of validity map for this product (ScotRail site)

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Valid with ScotRail and Glasgow Underground only
  • Valid for 3 consecutive days travel.
  • Travel is valid anytime at the weekend. Monday to Friday, you can travel anytime except on services departing before 9.16am
  • Also allows unlimited travel on Glasgow Underground

Discounts

  • Standard National Railcard discounts apply.
  • 50% discount for children aged 5-15.  Under 5's travel free.

Upgrades and Excess Eligibility

  • Central Scotland Rover tickets are valid for travel in Standard Class only.
  • Upgrades to First Class are not available.
  • Weekday and Weekend First supplements are not valid in conjunction with the Central Scotland Rover.

Refunds and changes to travel plans

  • Refunds are available, subject to a £10 administration fee, on each unused ticket surrendered before the first date of travel.
  • Customers can change their travel plans, as they have unlimited travel, but they cannot change the travel validity period.
  • Customers can break their journey as they have unlimited travel.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
• at a staffed station
  • ScotRail Telesales 0344 811 0141 
  • online

The Rover will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

All rail services in the county of Cornwall, including to and from Plymouth.

When is my ticket valid?

RAIL

Available from 09:00 (Monday-Fridays)* and all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays, plus the following additional trains:

08:33 Liskeard - Looe

  • Great Western Railways

As well as enjoying a great day out or short break you can also save money on your travel costs.

The map shows where the ticket can be used to get around the Cotswolds by rail. For details on travel by bus please visit https://www.cotswoldsaonb.org.uk/visiting-and-exploring/cotswolds-train-station/discoverer-one-day-pass/

OfferDetails.Details:
You make a one-off payment and scratch off the date on the ticket when you want to travel. Then hop on the bus at any time, or the train after 09:00. You can also use your Derbyshire Wayfarer to make some trips to and from some places outside the county as long as the journey starts or finishes in Derbyshire, including Burton-on-Trent, Leek, Macclesfield, Sheffield and Uttoxeter. 

The Derbyshire Wayfarer is available for Adults, Children, people aged over 60 (Proof of ID required) and Derbyshire County Council Concessionary Pass holders.

Group tickets are also available.

ProductType.Name: Derbyshire Wayfarer Ranger (when purchased from valid locations except Nottingham and Beeston)
ProductType.Valid: 1 day; Adult price includes travel for one adult and one child

On most bus services operating within the Derbyshire area.

On buses and trains to selected destinations outside of the Derbyshire County boundary.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Available on the day of travel or in advance.

The Derbyshire Wayfarer can be purchased from Alfreton, Burton on Trent, Buxton, Chesterfield, Derby, Long Eaton, New Mills Newtown and Sheffield rail stations in addition to Bus company travel offices, tourist offices and by post/telephone from the Council.

 

Tickets can only be purchased in the validity area.

Promotion.PromotionName: Derbyshire Wayfarer Ranger (From Nottingham or Beeston)
Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated Ranger area

OfferDetails.Details:
The Derbyshire Wayfarer is a day ticket allowing virtually unlimited bus and train travel throughout Derbyshire for a whole day.

You make a one-off payment and scratch off the date on the ticket when you want to travel. Then hop aboard your transport. You can catch the bus at any time or the train after 09:00. You can also use your Derbyshire Wayfarer to make some trips to and from some places outside the county as long as the journey starts or finishes in Derbyshire, including Burton-on-Trent, Leek, Macclesfield, Sheffield and Uttoxeter.

Nottingham and Beeston stations sell special Derbyshire Wayfarer tickets which also include rail travel from those stations to Long Eaton or Langley Mill. The Prices below are for these special tickets.

The Derbyshire Wayfarer is available for Adults, Children, Senior Citizens, and Derbyshire County Council Concessionary Pass holders.

Group tickets are NOT available from Nottingham and Beeston, however are available from Long Eaton or Langley Mill.

ProductType.Name: Derbyshire Wayfarer Ranger (From Nottingham or Beeston)

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
Valid for travel on trains after 0900, Mondays to Fridays, all day on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holiday Mondays.

Valid on all train companies services within the Derbyshire area shown on the map.

(It is not valid for travel between separate sections of route.)

On most bus services operating within the Derbyshire area.

On buses and trains to selected destinations outside of the Derbyshire County boundary.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Available on the day of travel or in advance from Nottingham and Beeston stations.

The standard Derbyshire Wayfarer can be purchased from Alfreton, Burton on Trent, Buxton, Chesterfield, Derby, Long Eaton, New Mills Newtown and Sheffield rail stations in addition to Bus company travel offices, tourist offices and by post/telephone from the Derbyshire Council.

It also covers the area bounded by the Settle-Carlisle, Barrow, Morecambe, Blackpool, Southport, Shipley to Bradford, Leeds, Halifax, Manchester, Liverpool, Warrington Bank Quay to Helsby, Chester, Shotton, West Kirkby and New Brighton.

Restriction does not apply to customer travelling from any station between Barrow in Furness and Carlisle or vice versa on direct services only. Customers should note that the time restriction would then apply to onward journeys from Carlisle or Barrow in Furness.

Promotion.Summary:
Freedom Travelpass

The Freedom Travelpass is a flexible ticket for unlimited train and bus travel within four zones. It's valid just for the day, for the week or for the calendar month - your choice!

The travel zones are shown on the map below, they are:

 

  • Zone A - Bristol City
  • Zone AB - Bristol Plus
  • Zone AC - Bristol and Bath
  • Zone ABC -Bristol, Bath, Nailsea & Yatton
  • Zone ABD - Bristol & Weston-super-Mare
  • Zone ABCD - Bristol, Bath & Weston-super-Mare

     

Freedom Travelpass is valid with the participating bus and rail operators named overleaf. Zone travel areas are shown on the map, with prices in the table below.

You can buy your day and week Freedom Travelpass from First West of England bus drivers, and from most bus and railway ticket offices.

You can buy a 1 day, 1 week or monthly ticket. A photocard is required for the monthly ticket, visit your local staffed station or bus ticket office for more details.

OfferDetails.Details:
Permitted Travel Zones

Travel zone Peak 1-day Peak 7-day Peak 1-month

Zone A: Bristol £6.00 £27.00 £100.00

Zone A B: Bristol Plus £11.50 £50.00 £192.00

Zone A C: Bristol & Bath £11.50 £50.00 £192.00

Zone A B C: Bristol, Bath, Nailsea & Yatton £13.50 £59.00 £227.00

Zone A B D: Bristol & Weston-Super-Mare £13.50 £59.00 £227.00

Zone A B C D: Bristol, Bath & Weston-super-Mare £18.00 £76.00 £290.00

Participating train operators:

Great Western Railway

South Western Railway

CrossCountry Trains

 

Participating bus operators:

First West of England*

Stagecoach South West*

Stagecoach West*

South Gloucestershire Council (and supporting services)

Faresaver Buses

Mike's Travel Somerbus

ABUS

* Freedom can be purchased directly from these bus operators.

A photocard is required for the monthly Freedom Travelpass; these are available at railway ticket offices.

Promotion.Summary: The Great West Way is a new 125-mile touring route between London, Bath and Bristol, based on ancient routes, roaming through idyllic countryside, quaint villages and elegant towns. Relax and journey along the Eastern part of the Great West Way on the rail and bus networks using the Great West Way Discoverer East ticket.

OfferDetails.Details:
With the Great West Way Discoverer East ticket the following routes:

  • London Paddington - Swindon Via Didcot and Westbury via Pewsey
  • London Waterloo - Westbury via Salisbury using GWR or SWR services
  • Thames Valley Branchlines East of Reading, except Services to Greenford. 

The EAST ticket also includes unlimited travel on the bus services along the route, listed below.

Bus services:

  • X2 and X32 Oxford and Wantage via Didcot Parkway - Thames Travel, Connector service

  • X38/X39 & X40, Reading, Henley, Wallingford, Oxford - Thames Travel, River Rapids service

  • X5 Salisbury, Amesbury, Pewsey, Marlborough, Swindon - Salisbury Reds service

  • Green Line services 702 and 703 between Heathrow, Windsor and LEGOLAND Windsor Resort                 

  •  Reading Buses services, excluding Greenwave, Kennections, football and special event services

Promotion.Summary: - Enjoy a circular journey in either direction around the designated circuit on Transport for Wales services.

OfferDetails.Details:
- Heart of Wales Circular Day Ranger offers a circular journey in either direction around the circuit between Cardiff Central - Craven Arms - Shrewsbury - Llandrindod Wells - Llanelli - Swansea - Cardiff Central on Transport for Wales services.

The journey can start at any station on the designated circuit. Valid over 2 days.

Heart of Wales Circular Day Ranger offers a circular journey in either direction around the circuit between Cardiff Central - Craven Arms - Shrewsbury - Llandrindod Wells - Llanelli - Swansea - Cardiff Central on Transport for Wales services.

The journey can start at any station on the designated circuit.

ProductType.Name: Copy of Copy of Heart of Wales Circular Day Ranger
ProductType.Valid: Valid for one journey around the designated circuit in either direction, starting at any station on the circuit.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information about Heart of Wales Circular Day Ranger and Transport for Trains Wales' Explore products, please visit www.tfwrail.wales or ask for information at your local ticket office.

BookingConditions.Details: Unused tickets are refundable subject to an administration fee. For more information please visit www.tfwrail.wales

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Buy Heart of Wales Circular Day Ranger from your local rail station booking office.  

If there are no ticket buying facilities at the station where you are starting your journey, you can also buy Heart of Wales Circular Day Ranger from a Conductor on board an Transport for Wales service.

Promotion.Summary: Travel in the designated rover area

OfferDetails.Details:
The holder of this rover ticket is entitled to unlimited Off-Peak travel for one day within the Bristol, Swindon and Weymouth triangle and as far out as Pilning, Yate, Parson Street, Pewsey and the Severn Beach branch.

There are various attractions scattered within the locations listed above.

No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays

Also valid on the following:
07.51 Severn Beach-Bristol TM
08.08 Pewsey-Westbury
08:10 Yate-Weymouth

PromotionRailCard.Details: In addition to any time restrictions applying to this ticket, note that Two Together Railcard discounted tickets cannot be used before 09:30 Mondays to Fridays (excluding public holidays).

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Ticket is valid for travel after 08:20 Mondays - Fridays and any time of day weekends and Bank Holidays.

Seat reservations on mainline trains are recommended at busy times, such as holidays and Friday evenings.

BookingConditions.Details: Not available on bus or ferry links or any other rail routes not shown on the map.

PurchaseDetails.Details: The Heart of Wessex Day Ranger can be bought at most staffed stations across the whole of Britain or via Great Western Railway Telesales on 0345 7000 125.

Destination NLC: I858

Promotion.Summary:
THE HIGHLAND ROVER IS UNAVAILABLE DUE TO FERRY SERVICES BEING SUSPENDED.

A flexible Rover ticket that covers travel on trains, ferries and a selection of coach services throughout the West and North Highlands.

OfferDetails.Details:
The Highland Rover entitles holders to unlimited travel on the following services:

Rail - ScotRail:
  • Glasgow - Oban / Fort William / Mallaig
  • Inverness - Kyle of Lochalsh
  • Inverness - Wick / Thurso
  • Inverness - Aberdeen
  • Inverness - Aviemore
Ferry - Caledonian MacBrayne: 
  • Oban - Mull
  • Mallaig - Skye
Coach - Scottish Citylink / West Coast Motors
  • Oban / Fort William - Inverness
Coach - Stagecoach in the Highlands
  • Thurso - Scrabster   

 

Rail Discounts

  • Strathspey Steam Railway: 10% discount on all full standard fares
  • Keith & Dufftown Railway: 10% discount on all full standard fares
Ferry Discounts
  • Northlink Ferries: 20% discount on seated Standard fares purchased on the day of sailing on the following routes: Scrabster - Stromness, Aberdeen - Lerwick, Aberdeen -Kirkwall - Lerwick

FurtherInformation.Details: THE HIGHLAND ROVER IS UNAVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Valid for any 4 out of 8 consecutive days travel
  • Anytime - except on trains arriving before 0900 Monday to Fridays at Aberdeen and Inverness
  • Anytime weekends and bank holidays
  • Valid on ScotRail train services only
  • Standard National Railcard discounts apply
  • 50% discount for children aged 5-15, under 5's travel free
  • Valid for travel in Standard Class only
  • Upgrades to First Class are not permitted
  • Refunds are available subject to a £10 administration fee on unused tickets surrendered before the first date of outward travel

BookingConditions.Details: Refunds are subject to a £10 administration fee for each unused ticket surrendered before the first date of travel.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
THE HIGHLAND ROVER IS UNAVAILABLE TO PURCHASE UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

  • At a staffed station
  • ScotRail Telesales on 0344 811 0141
  • online through Scotrail website (uk deliveries only)
  • online through Britrail website (overseas customers)

Passengers.Note:
When a passenger needs to self validate a Rover ticket, the date of travel should be completed in black ink using numerical values only for 'Day' and 'Month' eg 07 09 for travel on 7th September.

The Rover will need to be validated before the first journey on that day commences.

Promotion.Summary: The Kent Rover train ticket provides unlimited travel for 3 consecutive days on Southeastern services in Kent.

OfferDetails.Details:
From mysterious marshlands and breathtaking countryside to the dramatic white cliffs of Dover, from medieval towns, historic castles and towering cathedrals to bustling seaside resorts, a lively café society and contemporary arts scene, Kent has something for everyone.

So if you fancy a short break in Kent, the Kent Rover train ticket is the perfect ticket!

Please note the fare for accompanied children is £5 only. For unaccompanied children the fare is half the adult (£22.50 in 2018).

FurtherInformation.Details: https://www.southeasternrailway.co.uk/tickets/ways-to-save/kent-rover

BookingConditions.Details:
Travel after 9.30am on weekdays.

No time limit on weekends or Public Holidays.

Passengers.Note: Accompanied children (up to four) travel for £5.00. Unaccompanied children travel for half the adult fare (£22.50 in 2018).

Promotion.Summary: A car free day out in the lakes and Cumbria

OfferDetails.Details:
The Lakes Day Ranger offers excellent value for a car free day out in England's Lake District and the county of Cumbria.

The ticket includes travel on:

RAIL

Northern, Avanti West Coast and TransPennine Express services between:

  • Lancaster and Workington (via Barrow in Furness)
  • Lancaster and Penrith / Windermere (via Oxenholme Lake District)
  • Lancaster and Morecambe and Heysham Port

BUS

All Stagecoach buses within Cumbria (except school buses) and also service 555/6 between Cumbria and Lancaster.

BOATS

A Cruise on Lake Windermere from Ambleside, Bowness or Lakeside using Windermere Lake Cruises scheduled services.

ADDED VALUE

In addition, holders of a valid Lakes Day Ranger will be entitled to the following discounts on production of their ticket:

  • Lakeside & Haverthwaite Railway - 10% discount off Single and Return fares
  • Ravenglass & Eskdale Railway - 10% discount off Single and Return fares
  • Ullswater Steamers - 20% discount off Single and Return fares

PromotionRailCard.Details:

26-30, Senior, Disabled Person's Railcard, Two Together & HM Forces - £16.65

Discount does not apply to Lakes Family Day Ranger

Promotion.Summary: Great value ticket that includes both Rail travel and a City Sightseeing Bus Tour in Glasgow or Edinburgh City Centre.

OfferDetails.Details:
• Great value all in one ticket
  • Explore the beautiful and Historic Cities of Glasgow or Edinburgh with a hop-on, hop-off open-topped City Bus Tour included in this ticket.
  • Discover some of the major sights and attractions of both Cities like Glasgow Cathedral, Riverside Museum and Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum on the open-top bus tour of Glasgow and Holyrood, Edinburgh Castle and Edinburgh Old Town whilst on the open-top tour of Edinburgh.
  • Perfect non complicated all-inclusive tickets, especially for cruise passengers arriving into Greenock, Rosyth and South Queensferry.

FurtherInformation.Details:
• Available for Standard Class travel only.
  • Destination should be input to your TIS as K959 (EDB Bus Tour) or K960 (Gla Sightseeing) 
  • Valid from/to stations as shown below (with current Jan 19 fares showing):
Greenock Central - K960 (Gla Sightseeing)
SDR @ £23.60 & CDR @ £20.20

Greenock West -  K960 (Gla Sightseeing)

SDR @ £24.10 & CDR @ £20.40

Edinburgh Waverley - K960 (Gla Sightseeing)

SDR @ £37.70 & CDR @ £26.00

Inverkeithing - K959 (EDB Bus Tour)

SDR @ £24.40 & CDR @ £20.70

Glasgow Queen St - K959 (EDB Bus Tour)

SDR @ £39.70 & CDR @ £28.00

Dalmeny - K959 (EDB Bus Tour)

SDR @ £23.40 & CDR @ £19.70

  • Valid for travel on both Peak and Off-Peak services dependent on the type of ticket purchased.
  • Valid on ScotRail train services only.
  • No need to book in advance.
  • Bus tours depart from the following locations:
Edinburgh Waverley - Waverley Bridge

Glasgow Queen Street - George Square

Glasgow Central - Raddison Blu Hotel, Wellington Street.

  • Edinburgh & Glasgow Bus Tours normally depart from c. 0930 - 1630 daily, 7 days a week, every 15/30 mins.
  • Upgrades to First Class are not available.
  • Weekday and Weekend First supplements are not valid in conjunction with this product.
  • National Railcard, Club 50 and Concessionary discounts do NOT apply.
  • 50% discount for children 5-15, under 5's travel free.
Edinburgh Bus Tours

  • Valid for the date shown on the ticket for a hop-on, hop-off one day service operated by Lothian Buses as Edinburgh Tour, Majestic Tour and City Sightseeing.
  • Customer must choose which City Tour Bus they wish to travel on for the whole day as moving between the different Bus Tours is not allowed.  Please inform customers of this when issuing the tickets.
  • Please note that Customers must visit the Sales Desk at Lothian Buses Travel Shop on Waverley Bridge in order to receive their bus ticket before boarding the Tour Bus (leave Waverley Station via Market Street exit and turn right, the travel shop is on the corner of Market Street and Waverley Bridge, about 100m).
 Glasgow Bus Tours

  • Valid for the date shown on the ticket for a hop-on, hop-off one day service operated by West Coast Motor as City Sightseeing.
  • Customers need to show their return train ticket to the City Sightseeing bus driver when they board.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
Rail and City Bus Tour tickets can be purchased via the following retail channels: 

  • Telesales on 0344 811 0141
  • At a staff station
  • On-train when boarding at a station where no booking facilities available

Promotion.Summary: One days unlimited off peak (see restriction below) rail travel and bus travel available any time in the designated Ranger area.

OfferDetails.Details: The Ride Cornwall Ranger offers the holder one day's unlimited travel on all rail and most bus services within Cornwall and between Cornwall and Plymouth.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
AREA

All rail services and most buses in the county of Cornwall, including to and from Plymouth.

Only available within the area shown on the map.

When is my ticket valid?

RAIL - Available from 09:00 (Monday-Fridays)* and all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays, plus the following additional trains:

08:14 Plymouth - Penzance

08:40 Plymouth - Gunnislake

08:33 Liskeard - Looe

Note: when train times change, Ride Cornwall becomes valid on the equivalent service.

*Easements are in place over Christmas and New Year. Check back for exact dates.

Valid only on services of the following Train Operating Companies, within the area shown on the map below:

  • CrossCountry
  • Great Western Railways

BUS - Available from 09:00 (Monday-Fridays) and all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Available on all bus routes operated by First and CityBus / Go Cornwall. Key destinations within the area of validity include Lands End, The Eden Project, Lizard Point, Perranporth, Boscastle and Bude. Use of buses to/from Plymouth is restricted to direct bus services to/from Cornwall only, for journeys originating or terminating in Cornwall (i.e. not valid for local journeys within Plymouth).

BookingConditions.Details:
Ride Cornwall is valid for use on any rail or bus service after 09:00 Monday - Friday.

Ride Cornwall may be used at any time on Saturdays, Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Ride Cornwall is valid for use on all rail services in Cornwall and also between Cornwall and Plymouth and on the Gunnislake Tamar Valley branch line.

Ride Cornwall is valid for use on the bus operators listed for all journeys within Cornwall and also for journeys between Cornwall and Plymouth.

Ride Cornwall is not valid for local bus journeys on the services of bus operators not listed.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
The Ride Cornwall Ranger is a one-day Rover available from railway booking offices, train managers/conductors and bus drivers.

Note: Bus drivers are unable to sell discounted tickets when using a Railcard. If buying a ticket using a railcard then you have to purchase from either a railway booking office or train managers/conductors on board.

InternalInfo.IssuingInstructions:
• RCW RIDE CORNWALL J118
  • RCF RIDECORNW FAMLY J118
InternalInfo.Details: PRV and PRD Railcard discounts are not available with this product.

FurtherInformation.Details: For further information see

Promotion.Summary: Take one of the great rail journeys of the world: a circular route through some of Scotland's most beautiful landscapes.

OfferDetails.Details:
This classic tour of Scotland departs from Glasgow or Edinburgh and travels on some of the world's most dramatic rail lines: the West Highland Line, Kyle Line, and Highland Main Line.


Head north from Glasgow to the Isle of Skye, then east over the Highlands to Inverness, returning to Edinburgh through the lush farmland of Perthshire. You'll watch the landscapes get steadily wilder as you go - there's no other train journey in the UK with such variety.


The travel pass gives you time to explore along the way, and enjoy travel by train, ferry and coach on just one ticket

Don't forget

  • Travel in one direction only (clock or anti clockwise)
  • It's only valid for Standard Class and off-peak travel
  • Your travel is flexible, but the validity period is not: the 8-day period starts on the first day of travel
  • Free travel for under 5s, and half price for children aged 5-15
  • There's a £10 admin fee for changes or refunds

FurtherInformation.Details: www.scotrail.co.uk/tickets/combined-tickets-travel-passes/grand-tour-scotland-travel-pass

TicketValidityConditions.Details:
• Valid for 4 days travel in 8 days.  
  • Travel is valid Monday to Friday on trains departing after 0915. This restrictions does not apply on the following routes:- Glasgow Queen St - Fort William/Mallaig and Inverness - Kyle
  • Travel is valid at anytime on Saturday and Sundays.

PurchaseDetails.Details:
The ticket office at any staffed station
By phone on 0344 811 0141
Or complete ScotRail call-back form online

Passengers.Note:
Includes:

Rail: Travel with ScotRail on the following routes

  • West Highland Line: Glasgow or Edinburgh - Fort William/Mallaig
  • Kyle Line: Inverness - Kyle of Lochalsh
  • Highland Main Line: Glasgow or Edinburgh - Inverness via Perth (valid on trains departing after 09:15 and any time at the weekend)

Coach: The coach takes you between Armadale and Kyle of Lochalsh, with Stagecoach. Check latest timetables at www.stagecoachbus.com

Bus: Public bus services on Skye can be sporadic and often only operate during the Summer season

  • Stagecoach No 51 operates directly between Armadale (ferry connection) and Kyle of Lochalsh (rail connection) but is only available Monday - Friday
  • For other services (Nos 50, 52, 152, 917) change at Broadford/Armadale Road End on Skye

Ferry: The travel pass includes ferry travel with Caledonian MacBrayne between Mallaig and Armadale on Skye.

 

Recommended route

Start in Glasgow, heading north on the West Highland Line along the Clyde sea lochs, Loch Lomond and Rannoch Moor. From Fort William the train passes over the Glenfinnan Viaduct (you'll recognise it from Harry Potter), and on to the small fishing and ferry port of Mallaig.

From Mallaig, take the CalMac ferry to Armadale on the southern end of the Isle of Skye: you might like to stop here for a few days to explore the Munros and Faerie Pools. Then take the coach over the Skye Bridge to Kyle of Lochalsh, rejoining the train and setting course for Inverness. From there, you'll get the Main Highland Line south to Edinburgh or Glasgow.

The ferry connection between Mallaig and Armadale on Skye, and the coach connection to Kyle of Lochalsh are included in your ticket.

Journey times

  • West Highland Line: Glasgow to Mallaig (for the ferry to Armadale) - approx 5 hours 30 minutes
  • Kyle Line: Kyle of Lochalsh to Inverness - approx 2 hours 40 minutes
  • Highland Main Line: Inverness to Edinburgh - approx 3 hours 30 minutes
